loans.name: Jessica Janet

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven de 28 años de edad que vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Paiján, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida trabajando como obrera agrícola desde hace mas de cinco años, ella se desempeña como  recolectora en diversos cultivos del lugar, mayormente recolecta espárragos, un cultivo muy abundante en la zona. Estas actividades le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia, ya que es numerosa.

Jessica desea ayudar a sus padres a mejorar la calidad de vida con la que cuentan, por ello se ha propuesto realizar algunas mejoras en la vivienda en donde habitan, ya que durante las lluvias del pasado verano las estructuras de su casa, contruida de material rústico, se deterioraron;  para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternariva un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jessica es una joven honesta y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir apoyando a sus padres para que obtengan una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde viven ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
28-year-old Jessica lives with her parents in the District of Paiján, in Ascope Province, in the La Libertad region, half an hour from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.
For over five years, she has made a living working as an agricultural labourer. She picks various local crops, but mostly asparagus, which grows in abundance in the region. This work allows her to cover her personal expenses and to support her large family.
Jessica wants to help her parents improve their quality of life by making some improvements to their home. During last summer’s rainy season, their house’s structure, made of rustic materials, was damaged. In order to meet her goal, she saw the need to request her first loan from Edpyme Aternativa – a loan of 1500 PEN.
Jessica is an honest and hard-working young woman, whose greatest wish is to keep on supporting her parents to improve their quality of life. In the area where she lives, she is well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements to repair damage caused by rain

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén tiene 35años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su padre en el distrito de Paiján, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar ofreciendo servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en un vehículo motorizado llamado mototaxi, el se vale de esta labor para ganarse la vida, por lo que diariamente se esfuerza por sacar adelante su negocio, usualmente transporta pasajeros dentro del mismo distrito de Paiján y sus anexos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su padre con la economía del hogar.

El continuo uso brindado a su vehículo y el estado accidentado de la mayoría de caminos de la zona han hecho que su unidad movil empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamento, para realizar esta acción el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 muevos soles.

Rubén es un hombre honrado y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su padre una mejor calidad de vida, sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo le tienen mucha estima y le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Rubén is 35 years old, is single, and lives with his father in the district of Paiján, an area that belongs to the province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad, which is located half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the region of Lambayeque. He works transporting cargo and passengers in a motorized vehicle known as mototaxi. He earns a living through this work so he makes an effort to keep his business going. He usually carries passangers within the district of Paiján and its surroundings. The earnings he makes are used to fund his personal expenses and help his father with the household finances. The continuous use of his vehicle and the state of the roads in the area have caused his vehicle urgent mechanical problems. In order to repair his vehicle, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 1000 PEN. Rubén is an honest and hardworking man. His greatest wish is to be able to give his father a better life. His neighbors and colleagues have a deep appreciation for him and consider him trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair costs of vehicle

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a retail store where she sells daily use products such as coffee, Coffee-mate, noodles, juice, sugar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Sonia joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido por sus danzas afro-peruanas, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja desde hace dos años en el negocio de crianza y venta de animales, ella cría aves de corral y cerdos para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona y también a los vecinos. Como esta actividad es una de sus principales fuentes de ingreso ella trata de criarlos de la mejor manera, ofreciéndoles buenos cuidados y alimento balanceado.

Maria Esther desea incrementar sus ingresos incursionando en un nuevo negocio, ella desea adquirir una mototaxi con la cual pueda brindar servicio de transporte en la zona, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a juntar la cantidad que necesita para adquirirla.

Maria Esther es una mujer entregada a su familia y que da lo mejor de si para sacarlos adelante. Su sueño es brindarle a sus hijos una mejor educación y garantizarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is a 30-year-old mother who lives with her four children in the Zaña district, an area located 45 minutes away from Chiclayo known for Afro-Peruvian dance. For the last two years, she has had a business raising and selling animals. She raises poultry and pigs to later sell to neighbors and to visiting dealers. Since they are one of her main sources of income, she tries to take care of the animals in the best way possible, making sure to take good care of them and provide them with balanced meals. Maria Esther wants to increase her income by starting a new business. She would like to purchase a “mototaxi” (motorized rickshaw) which she will use to provide transportation in her area. To meet her goal, she has decided to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She would like a loan for 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles, which will help her meet the cost of acquiring the mototaxi. Maria Esther is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and always does her best to help them get ahead. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education to guarantee them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a rickshaw to provide public transportation

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Cayaltí, un distrito netamente agrícola que se encuentra ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.
Su actividad principal es la compra y venta D. colchones que trae directamente D. la ciudad D. Lima y los comercializa entre sus vecinos, el negocio se encuentra en su domicilio  y cuenta con más D. cinco años D. antigüedad en el rubro. Esta actividad le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar durante este tiempo.
Ella realiza su actividad por pedidos y debido a la calidad D. productos que ofrece su negocio cada vez está creciendo más, sus pedidos están aumentando y ello ha hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas colchones D. modo que pueda obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad D. vida, para lograr su objetivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1700 nuevos soles.
Juana es una mujer emprendedora y que toda su vida ha velado por el bienestar D. los suyos. Gracias al esfuerzo D. sus trabajos ella y su esposo han podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ello los llena D. orgullo, en la zona done vive ella es muy conocida y respetada.
texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old, she is married, has two children, and lives with her husband in Cayaltí district, a farming district located one hour away from Chiclayo city. Her main activity is buying and selling mattresses which she brings directly from Lima city and which she sells among her neighbours. The business is located in her home, and she has been working at it for over 5 years. During this time, this activity has enabled her to help her husband with the family expenses. She works to order, and because of the quality of the products she offers her business is growing more and more, the number of orders is increasing, and this has maD. her think about expanding the business, buying more mattresses so she can obtain greater gains and increase her quality of life. To reach this goal she asks, for the first time, for a loan of 1,700 PEN to Edpyme Alternativa. Juana is an enterprising woman who has looked after her family. Thanks to her and her husband's effort and work they have managed to get their children ahead, and that fills them with priD.. In her area, she is well known and respected.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: mattresses

loans.name: Jeanna

texts.en:
Jeanna E. is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Buenavista, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store and rice-retailing business.

Her husband, Vicente, is a truck driver who delivers sugarcane to a milling site, and they have five children who are between the ages of 7 and 19 years old.  The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Jeanna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and rice-retailing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $335 from her business activities.

She is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 26,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store and rice-retailing business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan the amount of 28,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her general store and rice-retailing business. Jeanna is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa T. is a 65-year-old widow who supports her family through her general store and farming businesses. She lives in Barangay Buenavista, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, with her seven children who are between the ages of 25 and 45 years, with some of them having their own family while the others help her with the family's needs.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $220.

Elsa is now borrowing 17,000 PHP so that she can continue her general store and farming businesses. This will be her 12th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elsa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.

Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mary Grace joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Grace from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional generic medicines to sell

loans.name: Dilshad's Group

texts.en:
Dilshad is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a house with four rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 25 years. 

Dilshad is a very hardworking lady. She believes in herself. She has faced difficulties in her life to provide a good life for her family. She became a seamstress to support her husband. Her husband appreciates her a lot and respects her feelings.

She is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son completed his education up to 10th level and started his own confectionery shop. The next son reads at a 5th-standard level. Her eldest daughter reads at a 10th-standard level. The next two are in kindergarten. 
 
Her husband sells sugarcane. He has his own four-wheeled cart, which helps him to transport the sugarcane. He takes orders from juice vendors and earns a good living by fulfilling these orders.
  
Dilshad is a regular client of Asasah (microfinance institution in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). She has successfully repaid her two loans to Asasah and now is applying for a loan for the third time to purchase items (dried fruits, sugar, cooking oil) in bulk for her son's confectionery shop. He will be able to produce more items and earn better profits from selling them.

loans.use: To purchase items for confectionery shop

loans.name: Mani's Group

texts.en:
Mani is a 44 year old working woman who lives in the city of Vehari, in Pakistan. She operates a business selling bedsheets. Her bedsheets business is famous in her neighborhood because of the good quality and cheap rates. She has been doing this work for the past 5 years. She does this work to improve the financial condition of her family. Her husband is also a very hardworking person. He is involved in the same business of bedsheets. He deals outside of the community. Their earnings are not much, but they meet the financial expenses of their home. 

They have big family to support and their current income doesn’t allow them to provide good facilities in addition to the education of their children. They are applying for a loan for the second time from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and partner of Kiva) to invest more capital into their business so that they may increase their income and enroll their kids in school.

loans.use: To invest capital towards increasing their bedsheets sales business.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a wife of M. I. and she lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 25 years. She has given birth to two children: one son and one daughter. Her daughter is 10 years old and her son is 4 years old. Her husband is a daily wage laborer and he earns approximately PKR 400 daily. His income allows him to manage the financial expenses of his family.

Khalidas’ brother is also lives with her and runs his own bedsheets selling business. He has been in this business for over 10 years. 
Khalida is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) to invest capital in her brother's business so that he may purchase more bedsheets and earn profit from the investment.

loans.use: To purchase more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Phanice Anyolo

texts.en:
Phanice Anyolo P. lives in Nambale Busia, Kenya with her family. She is 41 years old, married, and has six (6) children. She sells clothes, a business she started in 2006 due to its durability, after quitting the fishing business. She buys her stock in Nambale once every two weeks.

Her dream is to educate her children; something she believes will be possible but only with increased income. To do this she needs first to expand her business by increasing her stock. She would like to get a loan worth KES10,000.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth Akoth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Akoth O. owns a stationery store in Rongo town. Before starting this business in 2002, Elizabeth use to sell second hand clothes. She says the income from second hand clothing sales was not sufficient compared to her new profitable stationery business. She buys her stock in Nairobi every six weeks.

Elizabeth is 52 years old, married, and blessed with seven (7) children, whom she wants to educate to the highest level. To do this, she decided to join KMET microfinance program. She wishes to get a loan worth KES50,000 to increase her stock and ensure an increase in income.

Her future dream is to expand her business by building and owning rental housing. This would see her become financially independent.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Rosemary Anyango

texts.en:
Rosemary Anyango O. is 39 years old, married and a mother of four (4) children. She lives with her family in Rongo, but operates her fish vending business in Port Florence. She started this business in 1998 to generate income. 

Before then, she used to be a housewife with no source of income apart from the little she got from her husband. Rosemary wants to develop her business and it is for this reason that she decided to Join KMET revolving loan program. She would like to be able to acquire a loan and expand her business. She wishes to get a loan worth KES 30,000.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fish.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faith Achieng

texts.en:
Faith Achieng A. is a 26-year-old mother of three children. She is married and lives with her family in Rongo. Faith quit her business selling clothes and started a tailoring business in 2008 to generate income to support her family. She travels as far as Kisii on a weekly basis to purchase her stock. 

In addition to her business, Faith also supports some of the orphans within her community with the little income she generates from her business. She  wishes to expand her business so that she will be able to fully support her family and the orphans that are under her care, including their education.

After learning about the work that KMET does in relation to supporting small scale businesses, she decided to join the group. She would like to get a loan for 30,000 KES.

loans.use: To increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Monica Aoko

texts.en:
Monica Aoko O. lives in Kakmasya in Rongo. She is 40 years old, married, with eight children. Monica quit fish vending and started selling Jaggery (unrefined sugar) in the year 2000 due to the availability of sugar cane in the surrounding area. She buys her stock in Kamkasya on a weekly basis and would like to expand her business to be able to get enough income so that she is able to educate her children.

She would like to get a loan for 30,000 KES so she can increase her sugar cane stock in order to produce more of her product and generate more income.

loans.use: To increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abel José

texts.es:
Abel B. es un hombre que a sus 80 años es muy espiritual y disfruta su vida plenamente, tiene 13 hijos que ha sacado adelante y su última hija depende de él aunque también ha incursionado en su actividad como comerciante. El señor B. siempre trabajò en dos frentes, como empleado en empresas de las cuales ya está gozando de su jubilación y comercializando productos, simultaneidad que le ha permitido a él y su familia gozar de un mejor estándar de vida y no solo limitarse a la pensión, con la que no hubiera podido educar a sus hijos.
 
Su trayectoria en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo data desde el año  1996, cuando perteneció al programa dirigido a  tenderos donde le proveían artículos necesarios para surtir su tienda; durante este periodo realizó cursos en el orden administrativo  y técnico, en estos ùltimos  aprendió a elaborar manualidades en madera, actividad que aun ejerce al mismo tiempo que la comercialización de mercancías en la cual incursionó hace 20 años.

En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para invertirlo en ropa, calzado y cosméticos que tiene encargado para el día de la madre y en materias primas e insumos como madera triple de 3 a 7 milímetros, vinilo sellador lijable para elaborar hermosas artesanías bien decoradas.
Su sueño mas importante es  tener un viaje de esparcimiento donde su hija residente en  Panamá, pues ella lo invitò; vive enamorado de la vida y de su activismo en el mercado  de los productos que elabora y vende, porque goza de una excelente salud, hace ejercicio físicos y mentales: camina y es  un gran lector.
texts.en:
Abel B. is a man who at 80 is very spiritual and enjoys his life completely. He has 13 children that he has gotten ahead. His youngest daughter depends on him, although she has gotten into being a saleswoman as well. B. always worked on two fronts, as an employee in businesses, from which he is enjoying his retirement, and selling products. Doing these things at the same time has allowed him and his family to enjoy a higher standard of living and not be limited to his pension, with which he wouldn't have been able to educate his children. His trajectory in Fundación Mario Santo Domingo dates from the year 1996, when he belonged to the program led by shopkeepers where they would give him the items necessary to diversify his store. During that time, he took administrative and technical courses. In the latter, he learned to make things out of wood, an activity he continues to do as well as selling merchandise, which he got into 20 years ago. Presently, he is asking for a loan in the ammount of $2.000.000 to invest in clothes, shoes and cosmetics he has on order for Mother's Day . He will also invest in raw materials such as 3 to 7 mm triple ply wood and sandable sealing vinyl to make beautiful handmade, decorated items. His most important dream is travel to see is daughter who lives in Panama, since she invited him. He is in love with life and with being active in the market of the items he makes and sells. He is in excellent health; he exercises his body and his brain by walking and reading.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in clothes, shoes, cosmetics and raw materials such as 3 to 7 mm triple ply wood, and sandable sealing vinyl to make beautiful handmade decorated items.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 44-year-old working woman, who makes embroidered dresses to share the financial burden with her husband. 

She has given birth to three children; two sons and one daughter. Her son is older than the other siblings and reads at a 9th grade level. The younger son  reads at a 2nd grade level. Her daughter reads at a 6th grade level. 

Her husband's name is W. M. and he is an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. He has 10 years of driving experience. 

Shahnaz and her husband want to provide a good education for their kids because they got their education up to the 10th grade level and would have liked to study further, but due to financial problems they had to leave their education. They do not want the same thing to happen to their kids which is   why they work hard and manage their education expenses. 

They have successfully repaid their first loan to Asasah (microfinance institute of Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now are applying for a loan for the second time to repair their rickshaw because its repair is becoming essential now, otherwise its engine seizes up.

loans.use: To repair the auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen has resided in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan, for the past 12 years. She operates a sewing clothes business to support her husband in earning a reasonable income. Her husband's name is M. A.. He has been an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver for the last 5 years. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. As the children are growing, their needs are increasing also. In order to fulfill the needs of their children, like schooling, Parveen and her husband work hard in their businesses. 

Parveen has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now is applying for a loan for the second time to purchase an electric sewing machine. The electric sewing machine will allow her to sew more clothes because the manual machine takes more time to complete the order.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine to sew clothes.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is 43-years-old, married, and has four sons. She lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the last 20 years. She is a very shy lady. She loves to take care of her family. She is known for the best hospitality among her neighbors. Her husband is a shop keeper. He has been running a grocery shop in the main market for the last 10 years. He has a good reputation among his customer. As his shop is located in the main market, he has to face the competition with other shopkeepers. 

Asia has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now she is applying for the second loan. She will use the funds to purchase groceries (lentils, cooking oil, spices and rice) in bulk. Her husband keeps these items in his grocery shop and retains his customers by completing their requirements on time.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk for the grocery shop.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a wife of Z. A. and lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She is 40-year-old working lady. She prepares embroidered clothes on order and shares the financial burdens with her husband. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 30 years. She has given birth to three children: two boys and one girl. Her daughter is in 11th grade and her elder son is in 8th standard and the youngest reads in the 2nd standard. 

Irshad's husband operates a dairy business. He purchases milk from the milk shops and sells in the community. Irshad baji and her husband think that in order to compete in this world, one should have his studies completed. This is why they are very concerned about their children’s future. Irshad is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva)to purchase a dairy cow for her husband's business. This will allow him to get the milk from his own cow.

They hope to get good profit from this cow so they may save the money and make their children's future secure.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for dairy business.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a wife of M. A. and she lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She is a 28- year-old young woman and a mother of 4 sons. All of the children are enrolled in school and getting an education. 

Rukhsana is a very talented lady. She can sew and prepare embroidered dresses. Her talent gives her reward in the form of money. She prepares embroidered clothes on order and generates income. Her income allows her to fulfill the needs of her sons. Her husband is a vegetable seller and he sells his products in different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. He has sixteen-years of experience in this business. They both work hard to manage the financial expenses.

Rukhsana has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and is applying for the second time. The funds will be used to purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk so they may earn a good profit and provide their kids with a better education.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Norlan es activo y trabajador, tiene 23 años de edad, se dedica ala  venta de productos lácteos y venta de leña, lleva dos años en las ventas en donde ha captado su clientela, su esposa renuncio a su trabajo para poder invertir en la venta de tortilla y así poder cuidar de su niño que aun esta pequeño. 
El joven Norlan desde horas temprana sale a vender su leche agria, crema, queso y leña, pero hay días que sus ventas no superan ni para la alimentación lo que le preocupa. Como otros días bueno que termina la venta temprano, con este financiamiento invertirá en  más cantidad de leche para producir más los productos de leche agria, crema, cuajada y extender sus ventas a muchos mas bario de la capital con el fin de obtener mejores ganancias como hacer crecer su clientela.
texts.en:
Norlan is an active young man and a hard worker. He is 23 years old and he sells dairy products and firewood. He has been selling for two years and he has an established clientele. His wife quit her job to make tortillas full time and so that she would have more time to take care of their very young son. Norlan sets out in the very early hours of the day to sell his complement of milk, cream, cheese and firewood. But there are some days that he doesn't sell enough even to buy food for his family and he worries. There are good days when he can even wrap things up early. He plans to invest this loan in the purchase of more milk to make greater quantities of dairy products such as yogurt, cream, and cheese curds. He will then be in a position to extend his sales to many others in the district, with the goal of improving his earnings and expanding his client base.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk to produce yogurt, cream, and cheese curds.

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Yadira es madre de dos hijos, de edad de 46 años, es una mujer emprendedora, su esposo se dedica a la construcción. Su negocio es la venta de comida por pedidos en un centro comercial Managua, pues ante trabajaba ala dueña del comedor, pero cerro y la línea de cliente me quedo a mí, lo que fue para ella un buen comienzo en la inversión. Ya que sus dos hijos están estudiando y son muchos gastos. 
con este préstamo va a construir otro cuarto al fondo del patio anexado al que hizo con el préstamo anterior comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar,  de gran ayuda no gasta en mano de obra ya que es su mismo esposo es quien construye y se ahorra mucho dinero. Entre sus planes es seguir mejorando el menú cada día para lograr la captación de mas clientes.
texts.en:
Yadira is a mother of two children. She is 46 years old. She is an enterprising woman. Her husband works in construction. Her business is selling food to order in a mall in Managua. Before she worked for the owner of the dining hall, but it closed and the customers stayed with her, which was a good beginning for her investment. Her two children are in school and there are a lot of expenses. With this loan, she is going to build a room in the back next to the patio, attached to the one she built with the previous loan. She will buy: stones, sand, cement, and metal rods to start. A big help is that she doesn't spend on labor since her own husband does the building and that saves a lot of money. Among her plans is to keep improving the menu every day to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy: stones, sand, cement, and metal rods. She will begin to build a room.

loans.name: Begum Amna's Group

texts.en:
Begum Amna is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Vehari (a small mid-sized city), in Pakistan. She is a fifty-four year old widow. Her husband died few years ago leaving her alone in this world. She never lost her hope, but decided to fight for her survival. She started her business of sewing clothes.  
She has four children, two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son runs his own barber shop. The younger one works in a local factory on a monthly wage. Her daughters help her in her sewing clothes business. 

Begum owns a small home with two rooms. Her daughters are unmarried and she always remains worried for their marriages. She tries to work very hard to save money for their marriages. She is a regular client of Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). She has successfully repaid her three loans to Asasah. She is now applying, for the fourth time, to purchase an electric sewing machine to sew more clothes and to generate more income. She hopes to earn a good profit and plans to marry off her eldest daughter.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina de 51 años de edad es soltera, vive en el muncipio de Juigalpa, en su casa habita su unica hija  junto a su esposo y su nietecita, la hija trabaja en la UNAN y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Ernestina trabaja para el MINED en la Escuela Normal desde hace 24 años como conserje.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, reparando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado antes que comiencen las lluvias y parte de la madera de su casa que esta deteriorada.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para que su nietecita crezca en un ambiente agradable
texts.en:
Ernestina is 51 years old and single. She lives in the Juigalpa municipality. She lives with her only daughter, her husband, and her little granddaughter in her house. Her daughter works at UNAN (National Autonomous University of Nicaragua) and helps with the household expenses. Ernestina has worked for MINED (Ministry of Education) in the Normal School for 24 years as a janitor. She is requesting her third loan to improve her house. She will repair the roof, which is in a bad state, before the rains start. Part of the wood of her house has deteriorated. Her biggest dream is to be able to have better conditions in her house so that her little granddaughter can grow up in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build hygienic services

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mercedes es una mujer de iniciativa, de edad de 38 años, se dedica a la venta de enchiladas, el cual es una ayuda para apoyar  a sus hijos con los gastos ya que su esposo es jubilado y no tiene otros beneficios. Tiene años de estar negociando, sus ventas anteriores era la venta de cosméticos pero le atrasaban mucho el Dinero lo que le motivo cambiar a comida ya que se vende diario y efectivo. Con sus préstamos ha logrado las mejoras a su casa, con este financiamiento lograra terminar el cuarto que comenzó con el crédito anterior ya que le falta repellar, embaldosar, poner techo, puertas para poder hacer uso de el. lo que será de gran comodidad y privacidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 38, is a woman with initiative. She sells enchiladas. This is a help in paying her children’s expenses. Her husband is retired, and he does not have other benefits. She has been in business for years. She previously sold cosmetics, but she got very behind with the money. This motivated her to change to food, which she sells daily and for cash. She has used the loans to make improvements on her house. With this loan she will finish the room she started with the previous loan. The room needs to be plastered and tiled. It needs a roof and doors to be usable. This will provide great comfort and privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material like sand, cement, zinc, and beams to finish enclosing the room

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza de 58 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Alejandro Garcia, tiene 3 hijos, todos son mayores y ya estan casados, trabajan y le ayudan a sus padres en lo que pueden.  Ella tiene a su cargo a su nietecita Melisa de 8 añitos que esta en 3er grado de primaria. Esperanza trabaja para el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 20 años como conserje. 

Esta solicitando su 7mo credito con el proposito de  levantando 2 paredes para cerrar la cocina y que le quede adentro el baño y el lavandero, ademas ponerle el techo a ese pequeño anexo que hara y poner las puertas para que esta sea mas segura, pues los rateros ya le robaron algunas de sus cosas que tenia en la cocina.  

Expresa que gracias a los creditos que ha obtenido en AFODENIC ha logrado darle mejores condiciones a su casita y sueña con mejorarla mas para que su nietecita pueda crecer en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 58, is married to Alejandro Garcia. She has three children who are grown and married. They work and help their parents in what they can. Her eight year old granddaughter, Melisa, is under her care. Melisa is in the third grade. Esperanza has worked in the Asuncion Hospital for 20 years as a janitor. She is requesting her seventh loan in order to raise two walls to enclose the kitchen and have the bathroom and laundry room inside. She will also put a roof on this small annex that she will make. She will place doors in order to be more secure. Thieves have already stolen some of her things that she had in the kitchen. She expresses thanks for the loans that she has received from Afodenic. She has been able to improve the conditions of her little house. She dreams of improving it more so that her little granddaughter will be able to grow up in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise two walls

loans.name: Carlos Gregorio

texts.es:
Carlos Gregorio de 39 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Feliciana Gomez, no tienen hijos. Don Carlos trabaja como tecnico municipal del MINED desde hace 18 años.  

Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de comprar materiales para terminar algunos detalles que le hacen falta en la casa de su mamá, algunas de las cosas que hara es comprar ceramica para terminar de ponerle al pasillo poder instalar los inodoros en los cuartos de la casa.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder ver que su mamá tenga las mejores condiciones en su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos Gregorio is 39 years old, married to Sra. Feliciana Gomez, and does not have any children. Don Carlos has worked 18 years as a municipal technician for MINED (the Ministry of Education).

He is requesting his fourth loan in order to buy materials to finish a few details that are lacking from his mother’s house. Some of the things he plans to buy include ceramic tiles to finish the flooring in the hallway and toilets to install in some of the rooms.

His greatest wish is for his mother to have a home in the best condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic flooring & toilets for his mother's house

loans.name: Sandra Salvadora

texts.es: Sandra de 42 años de edad es Lic. en Administracion de Empreas, es casada con el Sr. Elvis Bravo, con quien procreo una a su unica hija de 17 años de edad de nombre Laiz la cual esta estudiando su 1er año de Lic. en Derecho. Sandra trabaja en la Administracion de Rentas de Chontales como auditor fiscal. Tiene un alto espiritu de superacion pues actualmente se encuentra estudiando 1er año de contabilidad, pues desea desempeñar mejor su trabajo.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, repellando las paredes para que estas sean mas duraderas.  Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia las condiciones basicas en el hogar, que no les falte nada y poder ver su vivienda bonita para hija, pues es el patrimonio que le dejara cuando falte.
texts.en:
Sandra is 42 years old and has a degree in business administration. She is married to Sr. Elvis Bravo and they have a 17 year old daughter named Laiz who is in her first year of college studying to become a lawyer. Sandra works in the tax office for the City of Chontales as a financial auditor. She has a strong desire to excel, so she is currently in her first year of taking accounting classes so that she can perform her job better.

Sandra is requesting her third loan to be used for a home improvement. She will plaster the walls of her house to make them more durable. Her greatest wish is to provide her family with basic living conditions so that they lack nothing and have her daughter live in a beautiful home, which will also serve as an inheritance for when she passes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jacqueline de 38 años de edad es casada, tiene  3 hijos, Grethel de 20 años la cual es casada, Axel de 19 años estudiando en la universidad el 3er año de Ing. Agroindustrial y Jacqueline de 18 años que tambien ya esta casada. Doña Jacqueline es pequeña comerciante de electrodomesticos y administra su propio negocio llamado "Distribuidora del Hogar".  

Gracias a un proyecto de vivienda Jacqueline obtuvo la oportunidad de tener su casa, la cual esta pagando con cuotas mensuales, y esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de ampliar su casa, construyendo 2 cuartos para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, ya que sus hijos viven con ella.  

El mayor deseo que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita y con las condiciones necesarias para que su familia se sienta comoda.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Grethel is 20 years old and married. Axel is 19 years old and a third year university student studying agro-industrial engineering. Jacqueline is 18 years old and is also married. Doña Jacqueline is a small businesswoman who sells household appliances and manages her own business called “Home Distributor”.

Thanks to the assistance of a housing program, Jacqueline had the opportunity to buy a house and now pays a monthly mortgage. She is requesting her first loan in order to expand her house by building two rooms that will help her family be more comfortable since her children still live with her.

Her greatest wish is to have a beautiful house with all the necessary comforts that will help her family feel at home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build two additional rooms for her house

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: La señora Sandra es madre de familia de una hija,  su esposo labora como jardinero, juntos han logrado hacer la casa de concreto, su negocio es la venta de cosa de horno, que día a día labora en su casa de habitación, hay días en donde las ventas son bajas, pero otros lo superan, con la entrada del invierno baja el maíz lo que permite hacer el producto mas grande y al mismo precio lo que genera buenas ventas. Con este financiamiento invertirá en comprar ropa usada para obtener mejores beneficios de sus ventas en conjunto. Ya que la canasta básica esta cara, los pagos  básicos, de luz, agua, es por eso desea invertir más para poder equilibrar sus costos.
texts.en:
Sandra has a daughter. Her husband works as a gardener. Together they have built a concrete house. Her business is selling baked goods. Day to day she works in her home. There are days when sales are low, but other days they are excellent. With the start of winter, corn is down. This allows her to make a larger product for the same price, which generates good sales. She will use this loan to buy used clothes to get better benefits from her joint sales. Basic food items and expenses for light and water are expensive. That is why she wants to invest more in order to be able to stabilize her costs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothes to increase her production of bakes good to improve sales

loans.name: Hasina's Group

texts.en:
Hasina is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Vehari (a mid-sized city), in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 18 years. She is a very caring lady. She stays at home, takes care of her family and manages the household work. She is a mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. Her sons are daily wage laborers. Her daughters are free and stay at home to do household chores. 
Her husband's name is M. N. and he runs a food stand in the community. He sells specifically Punjabi foods (Nan Kabab and Dahi Bhalay) at his food stand. People love his food. This results in the fact that he has a good number of customers. 

Hasina is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) for her husband so that he may purchase the food items (spices, cooking oil, and lentils) in bulk and expand his food stand.

loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for food stand.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen lives in Vehari (a mid-sized city), in Pakistan. She is a widow. Her husband died few years ago, from an accident.
 
Her husband was the only breadwinner of the family. After his death, all responsibilities came upon Shaheen. She has not married again. She cares for her children and completely pays attention to them.

She started a business of making carts (by filling the free space with ropes) by taking orders from her neighbors. Now she gets a good income, which she utilizes to manage the financial expenses of her family and to pay the education expenses of her two kids. Her sisters’ son also lives with her and operates a vegetable selling business. He has been in this business for over 3 years. 

Shaheen has been with Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kvia) for the last two years. With the loan profits, she enrolled her two kids into school and now they are getting an education. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk to expand her nephew’s vegetable selling business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Abrabo Pa Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 48-year-old woman who describes herself as hard-working.  She has 3 children.  

For the past 8 years, Grace has operated a food retail business selling items such as rice, stew, gari (cassava grits), beans and cooked yams.  Gari is processed from cassava.  She will use the loan to purchase more food supplies for her business.  She would like to expand her business by opening a wooden structure where she can sell her food items.
  
Grace is the leader of the group named 'Abrabo Pa', which means “living a decent life ” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  There are 10 members in this group.  The other members in the group operate retail businesses selling items such as fish, groceries, body cream and body spray.

loans.use: buying bags of rice for her business

loans.name: Anwar Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Anwar Sultana is a wife of M. S. and lives in Vehari (a mid-sized city), in Pakistan. She is a
50-year-old mother of three daughters and a son. Her husband is a tailor, by profession. He occupies a room of his house and uses it as a tailoring shop. She helps her husband by sewing clothes at home, but she also prepares the embroidered dresses by receiving the orders from her neighbors. They both earn a good income from their businesses and manage the financial expenses of their home. 

Their son drives an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Their eldest daughter completed her education up to 10th standard and now works in a local school as a teacher, on a monthly wage. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Anwar has successfully repaid her two loans to Asasah (micro-finance institute of Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). With the loan profits, she purchased a color television and an air cooler. Now she is applying for a loan, for the third time, to repair her sons’ rickshaw so he can better continue his work. She hopes to get a good profit from this loan too and has a plan to marry off her eldest daughter.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: New Way Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Boas is a 30-year-old man who describes himself as hard-working.  He is married to a 'fufu' food vendor and has 3 children between the ages of 4 and 8 years old.  Boas would like to provide quality education for his children up to university level.

For the past 15 years, Boas has been a “Kente” cloth seller.  “Kente” is one of the traditional cloths that depicts the rich culture of the Asante in particular and Ghana as a whole.  Boas will use the loan to buy and sell more “Kente” cloth.  Boas hopes to eventually expand his business by opening a store to sell “Kente” cloth and also establish a Kente store at Kumasi so he can make more sales.
  
Boas is the leader of the group named 'New Way'.  There are 14 members in this group.  The other group members operate retail businesses selling various items such as “Kente” cloth, fish, rice, and other products.

loans.use: Purchase Kente cloth

loans.name: Zahida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Zahida Parveen is a wife of M. A. and resides in Vehari (mid-sized city), in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 18 years. She is a 34-year-old young woman with five children. She is a very caring lady. She stays at home and manages her household chores and prepares food for her family. She has two daughters and three sons. All are enrolled in a school and are getting education. Her husband is a fruit vendor. He sells fruit to the fruit shops and earns an income. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. 

Zahida has successfully completed her first loan to Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). Now she is applying, for the second time, to purchase seasonal fruits in bulk so that her husband can sell more fruit and generate a good profit from it.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Lion Of Judah Group

texts.en:
Yaa is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are between the ages of four and twenty-four years old. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a food crop farmer.

Yaa is a hard-working and trustworthy woman. She is a petty trader. She trades in provisions and food items. She has been trading for twelve years and wants the loan to procure goods such as rice, tins of milk, sugar, etc., in bulk. Yaa buys her products from nearby towns. She hopes to give quality education to her children and put up a house for the family. 

Yaa is the leader of a twelve-member trust bank group called ‘Lion of Judah’. The group is made up of trustworthy members who are mainly petty traders and food vendors. They want the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Nyame Asem Group

texts.en:
Sara is twenty-four years old. She is married and has two children who are one and seven years old. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a book publisher.

Sara is a hard-working and trustworthy young woman. She is a petty trader. She trades in cosmetics. Sara has been trading for four years now and wants the loan to procure cosmetics such as body spray, perfumes, powder, pomades, etc., in bulk. She buys from nearby towns. She hopes to provide quality education for her children. 

Sara is the leader of a nine-member trust bank group called ‘Nyame Asem’, 'God’s word'. The group is made up of trustworthy members who are mainly petty traders and food vendors. They are requesting the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Ahemaa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Louis is forty-five years old. He is married and has four children who are between the ages of six and eighteen. All are currently in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in their community. His wife is a farmer who cultivates food crops to support the family.

Louis is a hard-working man. He is the proprietor of a private school in the community. His school being one of the good ones in town has made many parents enroll their offspring there. He has been in business for ten years. 

Louis wants the loan to enable him to have his broken-down school bus mended and also to procure other logistics to facilitate teaching and learning. He hopes to give his children the best education he can afford. 

Louis is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ahenema’, which literally means 'royals'. The group is made up of thirteen members. Some are petty traders and others are into food production/sales. The group requests the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Repair broken-down school bus

loans.name: Awurade Nsesa Da Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 39-year-old married woman with 4 children ranging in age from 6 to 21 years old. Her husband is currently unemployed thus making her the sole breadwinner for the home.  Grace describes herself as hard-working.  

Grace has been a hairdresser for the past 10 years.  In addition to her hairdressing business, Grace also sells food items such as rice and stew.  Grace will use the loan to buy hair pomades and rice.  She hopes to eventually expand her hairdressing business from a kiosk (a small wooden store) to a container store which will give her business more exposure.  Grace would also like to help her children get an education. 

Grace is the leader of the group named 'Awurade Nsesa Da', which means “God Never Changes” in Twi, the most common language spoken in Ghana.  There are 6 members in this group.  The other group members are involved in the retail business, selling groceries, 'kenkey' (maize balls), gari (cassava couscous) and beans.  'Kenkey' and 'gari' are traditional Ghanaian foods.  'Kenkey' is a maize-based starchy ball that is usually eaten with pepper and fried fish.

loans.use: Purchase hair pomade, etc.

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha is a wife of M. S. and she lives in Vehari (a mid-sized city), in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. She is a very active lady. She always keeps a smile on her face. She is fond of cooking. She prepares delicious foods for her family and takes care of their health. She has two daughters, both in kindergarten. She wants to raise them with a good education. Her husband's name is M. S. and he runs a PCO (public call office, where people make a call and pays charges of single minute). His PCO is located in the main market. He has been running this business for the past 10 years. 

Ayesha has been a client of Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) for the last three years. With the loan profits, she has been able to purchase a color television and a fridge. Now they are applying for a loan again to purchase telephone calling cards in bulk for her husband’s PCO. 
They hope to get a good profit this time too. They would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband and take the family on rides on weekends.

loans.use: To purchase calling cards for their business.(Public Call Office)

loans.name: Harvest Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Adwoa is forty-five years old. She is a divorcee and has five children under her care. They are between the ages of seventeen and twenty-seven years old. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the community.

Adwoa is a hard-working and trustworthy woman. She is a petty trader. She trades in provisions and perishable goods. She has been trading for five years now.   Adwoa wants the loan to purchase provisions and other goods – vegetables, food items, etc., in bulk. She buys from nearby towns. She hopes to see some of her children attain higher education. 

Adwoa is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Harvest’. The group is made up of six members who are mainly petty traders and food vendors. They are requesting the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase bags of sugar, milk and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING CEMENT, BLOCKS, AND SCREWS TO SELL

loans.name: Asomdwei Wura Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Olivia S., a trader in "Kente" cloth, calls herself a good planner and has been in this business for the past three years. Kente is a traditional cloth of the Asanti people and each design carries a unique message from whoever is wearing it. Olivia buys her kente cloth from weavers in her community for sale in Accra, the capital city of Ghana. She has a vision of establishing a Kente boutique in Accra where she will have assess to a bigger market for her business.

Olivia is the leader of 'Asomdwei Wura' group which literally means " a peaceful person" in Twi, a widely spoken language in Ghana. The group is comprised of 11 members mostly in the trade of Kente cloth, smoked fish, or working as food vendors. They hope to use this loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase Kente cloth for resale

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Omar S. est 35 ans et vit à Ziguinchor, la plus grande ville de la région de la Casamance au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et sans enfants, afin qu'il se concentre sur son travail. Pour les 3 dernières années, il a fait des robes haut de gamme pour les femmes à Ziguinchor. Il achète en tissu de haute qualité dans la ville de Tambacounda, qui est proche de la frontière du Mali, d'où le tissu provient. Il conçoit les robes lui-même et les vend pour $60. Il aime son travail et avec le prêt de Kiva, il veut acheter plus de tissu pour maintenir son entreprise. Il employe deux autres travailleurs qui l'aident à faire les robes.
texts.en:
Omart S. is 35years old; he lives in Zuguinchor, the largest city in the Casamance region of Senegal. He is single without children, and thus he dedicates himself fully to his work. For the last three years, he has been sewing high-quality women’s dresses in Zuguinchor. He purchases high-end fabrics in the town of Tambacounda, near the border with Mali, which is where the fabrics are produced. He designs the dresses himself and sells them for $60. He loves his work and would like to use Kiva’s loan to purchase more fabrics for his business. He employs two other people who help him make the dresses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for making garments

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata D. est 29 ans et une mère célibataire d'un enfant. Elle a été avec IMCEC depuis 5 ans déjà et a pris 3 prêts. Avec son quatrième prêt, elle voudrait continuer à développer son entreprise de confection. Elle achète du tissu provenant du principal marché de Ziguinchor appelée Boucotte pour fabriquer des vetements pour les femmes, notamment des robes. Elle peut acheter 5 mètres de tissu pour environ $20, ce qui rendra 1-2 robes. Avec 5 ans d'expérience, elle a une clientèle fidèle dans son quartier et les villages environnants. Avec ses bénéfices, elle continuera à soutenir son enfant.
texts.en:
Fatouma D., 29 years old, is a single mother with one child. She has been with IMCEC for five years already and obtained loans three times in the past. With her fourth loan, she would like to expand her garment-making business. She purchases fabrics at the main market of Ziguinchor, called Boucotte, in order to make women’s garments, especially dresses. She can buy 5 meters [5.5 yards] of fabric for about $20; this is enough to make 1-2 dresses. She has five years of experience in this work and a loyal customer base in her neighborhood as well as in the villages nearby. She will use the revenue to continue supporting her child.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for making garments

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J. is a 60-year-old woman living in the town of Pamito, Sagay City. She is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs and spices in the local community. Susan has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years and earns approximately PHP 8,000 a month from these activities.

In 2000, Susan joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 19,000 from NWTF. Susan is now requesting a new loan of PHP 17,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 17th loan Susan has taken out from NWTF. Susan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional herbs and spices to sell

loans.name: Anna Cynthia

texts.en:
Anna Cynthia V. is a 49-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Bollos, St. Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Anna Cynthia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for three years now and earns a living by running a general store business.		
		
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
	
About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase of Solar Lantern

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata Y. is a 56-year-old married woman with one child who lives in Bollos St., Brgy. Boyco, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Fortunata has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for five years now and earns a living by running a general store/frozen goods business.		
		
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.	
	
About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned their respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase of solar lantern

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of solar lantern

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth M. is a 43-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Brgy. Suba, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Maribeth has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for one year now and earns a living by running a general store business.		

She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. loans.use: Purchase of solar lantern

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu M. is a 49-year-old married woman with three children who lives in Brgy. Suba, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Marichu has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for nine years now and earns a living by running a rice retailing and general store business.		
	
She is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.		

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase of solar lantern

loans.name: Nere-An

texts.en:
Nere-an V. is a 29-year-old married woman who supports her family by owning a general store. She lives in Magsaysay, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their three children who are between 2 and 6 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Nere-an is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can expand her general store. This will be her 7th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Nere-an aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

In the picture you can see Nere-an with her husband.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital to expand her general store

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion’s 41-year-old husband, Rogelio, is a fisherman, and they have 5 children who are between 13-28 years old. Three of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores while the other two children are working in order to help the family.

Visitacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in pig fattening and fish vending businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000 from her business activities.

Visitacion is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund the operations of her fish vending and pig fattening businesses which had a positive impact on both the businesses and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 5th loan the amount of Php 15,000, which she intends to use on her pig fattening and fish vending businesses. Visitacion is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Talubangi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through a motorcycle operator venture, buying and selling charcoal and rice and her net-working business.

Lolita’s 49-year-old husband, Ramon, is a tricycle driver, and they have 3 children who are between 20-24 years old. One child is currently going to school and also helps out in the business as part of the daily chores while the other 2 children have work that helps the family.

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her motorcycle operator venture, buying and selling charcoal and rice and a net-working business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000 from her business activities.

Lolita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund the operations of her charcoal and rice sales business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 19th loan, the amount of Php 12,000, which she intends to use on her motorcycle operator venture, etc. Lolita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance and additional working capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G. is a 59-year old, married woman who lives in Sto. Comon, Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running her general store, her sewing business, billiard games and her cafeteria.

Evelyn’s husband, Froilan, manages the cafeteria business, and they have 1 child who is 22 years old. The child is currently going to school and also helps out in the business as part of the daily chores.

Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store, sewing business, billiard games and her cafeteria. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000 from her business activities.

Evelyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 18,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and cafeteria business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 16th loan, the amount of Php 19,000, which she intends to use on her general store and her other businesses. Evelyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely S. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in  buying and selling scrap, being a tricycle operator, and her food vending business. She lives in Casipsipan Brgy Hilamonan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband Noel, a tricycle driver, and their 9 children who are between 6-27 years old. Six of their children are currently going to school while the others work to help the family.

Fely has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her scrap business, being a tricycle operator and her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000.

Fely is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can expand her scrap business, tricycle operating and food vending business. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.
