Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Fely aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products to sell that will expand his business

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua began a web-based used/new clothing company in 2008. In 2009 he took out his first Kiva micro-loan through ACCION USA. In only seven months since his first loan he has already increased his sales by 50%, opened up a storefront, and is now married.

Joshua works full-time in his business and has been able to increase his income. He will continue doing online sales but would like to focus on his storefront and designing a new website.

Joshua will be using his second micro-loan to purchase a new computer that will help him process orders more efficiently, and to purchase new inventory. 


 About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy new inventory and a new computer

loans.name: Shokria Ator Gull Group

texts.en:
Shokria is the group leader of Shokria Ator Gull group. And she lives in district 11th of Kabul Afghanistan. She lives together with her husband and two of her children who are students. And she wants to take a loan for her husband’s business. Her husband has a metal shop. He is a hard working man and tries to have a comfortable life and educated children. Through the loan her husband wants to expand his business and to buy some essential tools which can make his work easier, so shokria wants to take a loan for him.
He is confident that will do his repayments on time and will join for the other cycle loan soon.

loans.use: he wants to expand and progress his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase gas stoves for his shop

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar is 58-year-old married woman with four sons. She lives in Vehari, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. She is a self-made woman who keeps herself busy sewing clothes even in her old age. She has given birth to four sons. 

By the grace of God her first three sons completed their education up to 10th standard and then got busy in their own jobs. Her elder son sells sewing machines with his father. The next son got a job in a factory earning a monthly wage. The younger son operates a business selling clothing. The youngest one is currently reading in 9th standard. Naseeem and her husband are very happy and satisfied that they brought up their children with discipline and good manners. 

Naseem has successfully completed her first loan with Asasah (a micro-finance institution in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now she is applying for the second time for a loan to purchase more clothes for her son to sell so he can make a good profit and expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Hasina's Group

texts.en:
Hasina is the wife of N. A. and lives in Vehari, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over thirty years. 

She is a vigorous lady. She operates her own business sewing clothes. She does this work to improve the financial condition of her family. Besides sewing clothes she manages her house very efficiently. She takes care of her family and prepares food for them. She has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. She has enrolled all of her kids in school because she wants to give them a good education. 
 
Her husband is a cobbler and makes footwear. He learned this art from his father who was a professional cobbler. He started this work twenty years ago and is now earning good money from it.
 
Hasina took out a loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institution in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) last year and successfully repaid it, and now she is applying for the second time for a loan to purchase materials required (leather, nails, and polisher) so her husband can make a good number of footwear and earn a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making footwear

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat is a 50-year-old married woman with five sons. She owns a small, two-roomed house in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan, where she has been living with her family for over 30 years. Ulfat is a very active and caring woman. She stays at home to take care of her family. She prepares good food for them and manages her household chores efficiently.
Her husband is G. A., and he received an education until 10th grade. The couple is satisfied because they have given the children a good education so that they can recognize good and bad and have discipline and manners in their lives. G. A. operates his own business selling vegetables. He sells from his four-wheeled cart, which he takes into different areas of the community. He hopes to have his own vegetable shop in the market where customers would come to make purchases. He has 10 years of experience in this business.
Ulfat is a regular client of Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan. She has successfully repaid two previous loans. Now she is applying for a third loan to expand her husband’s vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zaitoon's Group

texts.en:
Zaitoon is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. She lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari in Pakistan. Zaitoon is a talented lady who manages her own business selling women's clothes. At first, she completed orders for her relatives, but now her business has grown as she serves customers in her neighborhood, too. She receives orders from customers and completes them on time. She purchases clothes from different cities, such as Lahore and Faisalabad, for their good quality and low prices. Her income helps her to improve her family's standard of living.
Zaitoon's husband is S. A., a rickshaw (local, three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. He has been in this profession for ten years. His earnings support his family and meet their financial expenses. Zaitoon has successfully repaid three loans to Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan. With the profits from her loans, she purchased a color television, a washing machine and a goat. Now she is applying for her fourth loan so that her husband can repair his rickshaw and continue his driving.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw (local, three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a wife of M. R. and lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She is 33 years old and married. She owns a small, one-roomed house with a kitchen and bathroom, and has been living there with her family for the past 15 years.
Sakina is a very hardworking lady. She is skilled at making artificial flowers and different decoration pieces. She learned this skill from her mother and now uses it to make money. Although Sakina is not educated, she wants to give her five children a good education. She has three sons and two daughters. Her elder son is 12 years old and in 7th grade; her next son is 10 years old and in 10th grade; her youngest son is in kindergarten. Her elder daughter is also in kindergarten, and goes with her brother into school, while her youngest daughter is not of school age yet.
Sakina's husband is a salesman and works in a grocery store for a monthly wage. To support him financially, Sakina operates her own business. They are both very hardworking and work to improve the family's standard of living. They want to give their children a good education so they have a good future and make their parents proud.
Sakina has successfully repaid her first loan to Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for her second loan, which will be used to purchase groceries to start a grocery shop for her husband. He has obtained good experience of sales now and can better run his own grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to start a grocery shop for her husband

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 44-year-old married woman with three sons. She lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past 30 years.
Khursheed's eldest son has completed his education up to 10th grade and now operates his own shop where he sells electrical goods. Her next son is a daily wage laborer, and the youngest is an auto-rickshaw (local, three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver.
Khursheed is an active lady who makes pillow covers of different styles and designs and sells them at the market. Her skill rewards her with a monthly income of approximately 5,000 PKR, which she saves for the marriages of her sons.
Khursheed's husband is A. R., who has been an auto-rickshaw driver for the past four years. He works from 9am to 8pm, and earns almost 500 PKR from his daily business.
Khursheed has successfully repaid her first loan from Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for her second loan, which will be used to repair her husband’s rickshaw so that he can better perform his duties and generate income.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw (local, three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Iqbal's Group

texts.en:
Iqbal is a wife of M. P. and lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past 35 years. Iqbal is a very talented lady who operates her own business making and selling embroidered clothes. She has been running this business for over five years. Initially, her customer base was limited to her neighbors, but now she sells in the clothes markets as well to generate income. She has one daughter, who is just two years old.
Iqbal's husband operates a clothes-selling business. He purchases clothes from cities such as Multan, Faisalabad and Lahore because of their good designs and low prices. He has been operating this business for over ten years and has a good reputation among his customers. The couple's earnings help them to manage the financial expenses of their home. They dream that their daughter will grow up with a good education and a bright future.
Iqbal has successfully repaid her first loan to Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for her second loan, which will be used to purchase clothes so that her husband can increase his business and earn a good profit from it.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale in her husband's business

loans.name: Bilquis Begum's Group

texts.en:
Bilquis Begum is 49 years old and married with four children. She owns a small house with two rooms in the city of Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) and has been living in it with her family for over 40 years.

She is a very talented lady. She makes chingairs (used as a tray on which to place bread to serve) and sells decoration pieces also. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She earns approximately 5,000 PKR every month, which she uses to pay for the utilities. 

Her husband's name is M. H. and he has been a rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver for the past 10 years. His profession gives him earnings of 500 PKR on a daily basis, which he uses to meet the financial expenses of his house.

Bilquis has been with Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) for the last three years. With the loan profit, she purchased a color television, a washing machine and a fridge. This year she is applying again for a loan to repair her husband’s rickshaw so he may continue his work and earn well.

loans.use: Repair a rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is the wife of M. S. and lives in a city named Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) in Pakistan.

She is a 48 year old supportive lady. She operates a business selling artificial flowers. Before she did this for someone else, but later on she decided to sell on her own. Now she prepares the flower sets and sells them in the gift shops. She also gets orders from her community and earns good profit on it. She likes her work and makes it enjoyable because she loves colors and beautiful things.

Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been in this profession for the past 12 years. They both have good reputations among their customers and their earnings help them to improve the living standards of their family.

Allah Rakhi has been with Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) for the last two years. With the loan profit she purchased a color television and all the family sit together on weekends and enjoy watching their favorite programs.

She is now applying for a loan for the third time to purchase masonry tools for her husband so he can earn well and expand his work.

loans.use: Purchase masonry tools

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is the wife of A. H. and lives in a city named Borewala (which is famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 20 years.

She is a 53 year old woman, but despite her old age she does work because she loves her family and is still working to improve their standard of living. Her family loves her, too, and respects her a lot.

She has given birth to four children, three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son helps his father in his barber shop, the next to him is a welder by profession and the youngest one reads in the 5th standard grade. Her daughter is 12 years old and stays at home and learns sewing skills from her.

Her husband’s barber shop is situated in the main market and that’s why her eldest son works with him and helps him in dealing with the customers.

Parveen has been with Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) for the last two years. Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase required items such as scissors, chairs, mirrors and creams to expand her husband’s barber shop.

loans.use: Purchase required items for barber shop

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is 32-year-old lady from a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been living in it for the last 15 years. She has given birth to six children, four daughters and two sons. She has enrolled all of her kids into school because she wants to raise them with a good education so they can make their future bright. 

Her husband's name is M. H. and he is a motor mechanic who can repair every type of vehicle. He was just 15 years old when he started learning this work and he became an expert in it. 

Sugran has successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now she is applying for the third time to purchase tools for her husband so he can better perform his work and earn more.

loans.use: Purchase tools to repair vehicles

loans.name: Zuhran's Group

texts.en:
Zuhran is a wife of U. D. and lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for over 30 years.
Zuhran is a talented lady who manages both her business sewing clothes and her house very efficiently. She gets up early in the morning, gets her children ready for school, and then prepares breakfast for them. Then after she has done her domestic chores, she starts sewing clothes. She is very disciplined in her work, sewing clothes at the decided time. She earns approximately 5,000 PKR from her sewing business. She uses half of the money to pay her children's education expenses and the remaining amount she saves for rainy days.
Zuhran's husband is a carpenter who makes furniture to order. He has been in this business for the last 15 years. He is also a very hardworking man. Their earnings help them to run the financial aspect of their home smoothly.
Zuhran has been with Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan – for the last three years. With the profits she has made, she purchased a color television, a washing machine and a motorbike for her husband. Now she is applying for her fourth loan, which will be used to purchase items (such as nails, wood, glue and polishers) to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase items for her husband's furniture-making business

loans.name: Maqbool's Group

texts.en:
Maqbool is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 20 years.

She is a very kind lady. She stays at home and manages the domestic chores efficiently. Her husband is involved in a livestock business. He purchases the animals, takes care of them and then sells them. Maqbool helps him by taking care of the animals. She gives them proper food and water.

They have two sons and three daughters. Their daughters are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Their sons are drivers by profession and drive auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles) and generate income for the family.

Maqbool has successfully repaid two loans to Asasah. Now she is applying for the third time to purchase the animals to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase animals to sell.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, 52 years old, lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 40 years.

She is a wife of I. M.. They have three sons who are 29, 25, and 22 years old. They all got their education up to 8th standard and couldn’t study further due to little financial resources. Now they perform their duties of a mason and generate income for the family.

Parveen’s husband is involved in the livestock business. He purchases the animals from the animal market and sells them. He has been in this profession for 15 years. Parveen is very supportive. She helps her husband by taking care of his animals.

She is a regular client of Asasah and has successfully repaid three loans. Now she is applying for her fourth loan, to purchase animals and expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase animals to sell.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is 34-year-old young woman. She lives in a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 25 years.

She is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son goes to school for education. She wishes to send all of her children to school but unfortunately due to little resources she couldn’t complete her wish.

Her husband is A. R. and he runs his grocery shop. His shop is located in the busiest market and due to this he faced competition with other grocery shops.

Nargis is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s grocery shop so he can maintain his customers and complete their needs on time.

She hopes to get good profit from this loan and then she will be able to enroll her other kids into school too.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Nehemias Isarel

texts.es: El señor Nehemías Israel C. D. León, D. diecinueve años D. edad,  vive con su esposa, tiene dos años trabajando como Albañil, además su esposa se dedica a la amarrada para cortes típicos, para el sostenimiento D. la pareja, el señor por la necesidad D. adquirir herramientas para mejorar su trabajo, por esa razón se acercó a la Asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar sus herramientas D. trabajo, la que ayudará a obtener mejores oportunidades y opción D. trabajo, la que ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones D. trabajo y calidad D. vida familiar.
texts.en:
Nehemías Israel C. D. León is 19 years old, and he lives with his wife. He has been working as a bricklayer for two years. Also, his wife works making typical skirts to support the couple. He needs tools to improve his work. That is why he went to the Asociación ASDIR to get a loan in order to be able to buy tools for work. The tools will help him have better opportunities and work options. This will help improve his work conditions and the quality of his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. K., 48, is a married woman. She and her husband are blessed with five children; three of whom are working at different jobs, while the other two are enrolled in school. Mrs. K. is a professional chef who is recognized and is hired by people to cook for their wedding party or other ceremonies, earning a suitable income. Another source of income for the family comes from her husband’s farming business. He also buys beds to retail for gaining revenue. K. has a broken farming machine that has she stopped to use for a while and now she hopes to reuse it for farming, but it requires repairs. Thus, K. decided to take out a loan through Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to repair the broken machine.

loans.use: To repair a broken machine.

loans.name: He

texts.en: Mrs. He P. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in a commune in Kompong Tom province. To earn a living, she built a stall next to her house where she operates a pig raising trade for a profit. She can breed pigs at least two times a year and is able to sell to buyers when the pigs mature. Her husband also earns income for the family by working in the Ministry of the Interior. The couple now has four kids. Three of the kids are employed at a variety of occupations and help be responsible for the family, and one is jobless. He P. wants to encourage her jobless child to have a formal business but she requires capital. Because of that, He P. would like to request a Kiva loan of $500 for her child to use as capital to open a phone repair shop.

loans.use: To open a phone repair shop.

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs. Oem N., 29, lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She has built a medium pigpen behind her house where she feeds a few pigs from which she earns a living. By doing this, she is able to generate a simple daily income, which helps to ensure her family has a stable sells it for a profit. Mrs. Oem N. is asking for a loan in order to purchase a new machine to allow her husband to pick up firewood from the forest.

loans.use: To purchase a new farm machine.

loans.name: Chuch

texts.en: Mr. T. is an old, married father blessed with six children. He cares for the two children who attend school. The others are now married and have started new homes. To help with the family’s living expenses, T. owns a horse with a cart attached that he uses to provide a taxi service.  From this, he has been getting a suitable profit to resolve the family's financial problems. T. has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photo here. She stays at home to hold a daily job, which is to raise pigs and cultivate a rice crop. T. will be using his first loan to help to accumulate capital from his wife’s farming business by buying piglets, fertilizer, and crop seeds.

loans.use: To buy piglets, fertilizer, and crop seeds.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is 42 years old and married with four sons. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 30 years. 
She is a very talented lady. She makes embroidered dresses for her neighbors and generates income for her family. Her parents couldn’t provide her with an education but they taught her how to embroider on dresses. The result of their lessons is that their daughter is earning a good income from it and is supporting her husband financially. 
Her elder son is a mason and two others sons are daily wage laborers. Her youngest son is enrolled in a school and is getting an education. 
Her husband's name is A. R. and he is a carpenter by profession. He manufactures furniture such as tables & chairs on order and earns an income. He has 20 years of experience in this business.
Bashiran has successfully repaid her three loans to Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time to purchase items (woods, nails & polisher) to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase items for furniture making

loans.name: An

texts.en: Mrs. An D., 53, lives in Kompong Tom province. She owns a medium size farm that she inherited from her grandparents. Here she cultivates different types of crops from which she earns a living. An D. lives with her husband who always leaves home to buy firewood from the forest and bring it home to sell. This couple was married years ago and they have six children. Five of their children are employed and one attends school. An D. has been building her house for a long time but the building is never completed because she lacks materials. In order to finish the construction, An D. is applying for a loan from Kiva to continue building a new house.

loans.use: To continue building a new house.

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mrs. So P. became a requirement (on-call) laborer in a plantation company when she was single, but she is now married with three young children, all of whom are students and dependent upon their parents' income. In addition to her current job, So P. planted some vegetables on the land next to her house for extra income. She has a life partner in her husband who is a laborer who works with her in the same company. The couple helps each other to generate substantial income for her family. The family’s living situation is not comfortable because their house cracks often when there is heavy rainfall. That is why So P. is applying for a loan to hire a repairman to mend the broken house.

loans.use: To hire a repairman to mend her broken house.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en: Suraiya is a wife of M. S. and lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She has been living there with her family for the last 15 years. She is a very caring lady. She stays at home, takes care of her family and manages the domestic chores. She has given birth to seven children: one daughter and six sons. Her daughter is involved in the carpet-weaving business. The others are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this profession. He works really hard to manage the financial expenses of his home. Suraiya has successfully completed two loans from Asasah and now is applying for the third time to purchase masonry tools for her husband so he can produce more effective work and generate a good income.

loans.use: To purchase masonry tools for her husband

loans.name: Yov

texts.en: Mr. Yov K. is 39 years old, married, and the father of a young child who attends the local public school. Yov K. helps to support his family by farming rice crops and fishing around the river. His wife is shown on the left in the photo. She stays at home to manage the family housework and raises a few pigs to earn a living. Yov K. will be using his loan to purchase a cart to attach to his cows in order to provide transportation for faming business.

loans.use: To purchase a cart.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a wife of M. M. and lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 40 years. She is a very caring lady. She performs her duties as a mother and a wife very effectively. She stays at home, manages the domestic chores and prepares the food for them.  She has given birth to three sons. Her first two sons are daily wage laborers. The youngest is a tailor and sews specifically gent’s clothes.  Her husband is a vegetable vendor. He sells the vegetables on his four-wheeled cart in different areas. He also supplies the vegetables to the vegetable shops and generates income. He has been in this profession for 10 years. He has a good reputation among his customers. 
Bashiran has been with Asasah for the last three years. With the loan profit, she has been able to marry off her elder son. Now she is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase seasonal vegetables so her husband can expand his business. Her husband hopes to open a vegetable shop if he earns good profit from it.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech H. is a 60-year-old local farmer and the mother of a school-aged child, as well as another five children who are employed and help with the family responsibilities. Every day in the early morning, Pech H. and her husband go to their field where they plant a variety crops, such as rice and watermelon crops. They will harvest and sell crops when they come to maturity. 

Pech H. faces a problem: she has already been growing her crops since a month ago but they are not growing well and may need fertilizer. Therefore, Pech H. decided to request a loan of $1050 which she will use to purchase many sacks of fertilizers to improve her crop yields, as well as to buy an ox to help with plowing the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fertilizers to improve her crops.

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Mrs. Path N., 29, owns a small wooden house and a pigpen where she breeds pigs for sale. She is able to raise pigs twice a year and gets some income to ensure that her family avoids financial crises. Path N. became a pig breeder a long time ago and earns an average of $2.50 a day.

She has a life partner in her husband, who is a firewood seller. This couple helps each other in order to earn money to support both their kids, who are dependent on their income. Additional, the family always takes time to farm rice when the farming season approaches.

Path N. is taking out her loan to buy a cow to make it easier to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow farmland.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a humble woman, 28 years old, and lives in the best territory of Kompong Tom, one of the provinces of Cambodia. She built a small cage where she feeds pigs to earn a living.

She is married with a young daughter who attends school. S. has another financial earner in her husband, who climbs many palm trees to tap juice to boil for sugar to sell.

S. faces a problem as her house is in need of repairs and her living condition has been affected. Because of this obstacle, S. is pursuing a loan in order to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Ve

texts.en:
Mr. Ve K., 42, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has inherited a piece of farmland from his grandmother where he and his wife grow rice crops to make a living.

By working on this, the couple is able to generate a simple daily income and it helps to ensure their family has a stable product to sell for a profit.

Mr. Ve K. is asking for a loan in order to purchase more fertilizers and seeds to better plant his crop. The family lives with three children who are all students.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mr. Soeun Saing and his wife, Mrs. San Yoim, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of their children do construction work with their father, and the other two children assist their mother in her farming business. Soeun is not in the photo; his wife was available instead.

Soeun has been a wooden-house builder for more than three years. His wife has been a farmer for more than twenty years. Besides farming, she is a silk weaver as well. 

Soeun does not have enough materials to work, so he is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 30 years old, and a rice farmer. She lives with her husband who is shown in the photo above. He works as a laborer in the construction field. The family has given birth to a young kid who goes to school. Her husband complains that he faces difficulty traveling to work because his motorcycle breaks often. She is applying for a $150 loan from Kiva in order to repair the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair the broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Mr. Sos S. (pictured above) aged 52, and his wife Mrs. Sor Morn aged 53, live in a small village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1979 and have six children: one son and five daughters. Three of the children married.  
 
Sos has been raising pigs for three years. His wife sells desserts. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for his son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his son-in-law to drive to work.

loans.name: Mun

texts.en:
Mrs. Mun U. (pictured above) is a 58 year old widow with three sons. Two of them married and live outside the family home and the other one sells coffee at home. She lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Mun has been renting the space of her house for four years. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house and make a concrete foundation.

loans.use: build a fence around her house and make a concrete foundation

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a farmer from Western Kenya in the town of Kitale. He is 34 years old and married, with six children aged 2 to 12 years old. Four of the children are currently in school. He has been farming for 13 years and selling his milk, maize, and poultry to the local market. He also earns income from selling timber to the local market.

Harrison recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES, which he used to start a poultry project. He has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES to expand the project. He says the income from this loan will help him improve the living standards of his family. His main challenge has been poultry diseases, which, if not treated, can cause mass death of chickens. In the future, Harrison intends to buy more dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Mrs. T. is a 56-year-old fish catcher and the mother of seven children. Two of them are employed: one is a boat driver and one works on the massage staff for a club. Every day in the early morning, Mrs. T. and her husband fish in and around the river, and they quickly bring the fish they have caught to retail at the market. Now, the family needs more tools to use for fishing, but they don’t have the money yet to fulfill their need. Therefore, Mrs. T. decided to request a loan of $300, which she will use to purchase many sets of accessories to use for fishing operations.

loans.use: To purchase accessories for fishing operations

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. K. is a hardworking woman and a determined mother blessed with two kids who are students and dependent on her. K., 30, has been earning a living by selling various vegetables in the local market. She sells vegetables that she buys in bulk from people who are farmers and wholesale suppliers. Her husband is a requirement laborer who works in the construction sector. He also helps his wife to sell vegetables when he is free from his work. Because the vegetable-selling trade is a profitable one for the family, K. wants to improve it by borrowing a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, in the amount of $1200.

loans.use: To improve her vegetable business

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Making a living selling various grocery products such as cooking ingredients, plastic products, and sweets, Mrs. Sang S., 44, started her business five years ago and currently earns approximately $3 per day. She has another financial earner in her husband who owns a motorcycle to provide a taxi service for a profit. Sang has five children, all still living in the family home. One of the children works in a restaurant and the other four attend school.

Sang is taking out her loan to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband's motorcycle, an addition that will allow him to pick up more passengers. Sang will use any remaining money from the loan to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and additional grocery inventory.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing H., 25 years old, has been growing rice crops since 1999, earning a formal income to support her family’s daily living expenses. She has a life partner in her husband, Doeuk, 24, who depends on the river and lakes where he always fishes to make a living. Married for two years, they have a lovely young child whom they plan to send to the primary school next year. Hing needs a loan to purchase a plot of her neighbor’s land upon which she  will grow crops for extra proceeds.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of her neighbor’s land.

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en:
Chuong T. is a 56-year-old farmer and mother, blessed with 11 children, two of whom are attending the public high school, while the remainder work in various occupations. Her husband, Tep Hing, 60, is also a farmer. Chuong inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she and her husband grow a variety of crops. Because their current income is not enough to sustain family needs, she is requesting a loan to buy fresh fish to retail at the market. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to repair an old farming machine.

Mrs. T. was not available, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and to repair a farming machine.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong K. is a married mother blessed with five children, all of whom are single. To help with the family’s living expenses, one of her sons is a security guard in a company. To pursue a daily income, Suong arises early and goes to the farm field where she buys vegetables in bulk to sell at the market, while her husband builds wooden houses.

The family always finds it hard traveling anywhere because they don’t own a vehicle, so Suong is requesting a loan to add to her personal savings in order to purchase a new motorcycle as transportation for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Abd Alkarim

texts.en:
Abd Alkaim, a 28-year single man from Lebanon, rents a shop to provide auto and motorcycle repair services. He also buys and sells spare parts. Abd has been working in auto repair since 2008 and has eight years of experience in the industry. His main customers are friends and community members, and he is proud of the quality of service he provides, saying that his work is unmatched by other area repair shops. He decided to pursue a job in auto repair to gain experience and as a way to help support his family.

Abd notes the challenge in acquiring sufficient capital to help grow his business, which is one reason he is seeking his first loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. In the future, he hopes to further expand his business.

loans.use: To help grow his business.

loans.name: Prossie

texts.en: Prossie is married to a peasant farmer in Kawempe Division, one of the Divisions of Kampala District. Prossie has four children and all her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Prossie owns a charcoal stall in Kawempe and sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale. She wants to use this loan of 500,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal. Prossie works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and thieves. Prossie aspires to change her business from charcoal to second hand clothing.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 54-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has four children. He has been renting a shop to sell sinks, pipes, and other plumbing devices since 2008. He has 26 years of experience in the industry. Because of his extensive experience, he has a broad customer base that includes friends, neighbors, and professional contacts.  Majed is extremely proud of his work and believes that it is his experience that has helped him succeed. 

He is requesting a loan of US$ 2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He is planning to use the loan to purchase a new sink that he can then sell. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua. In the future, Majed hopes to further expand his business. He learned about Al Majmoua through the local loan officer.

loans.use: To new sink for resale

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 36-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has 4 dependents living with him. He has been working as a mechanic for the past 13 years. He has been renting a shop for his work since 2007 and is specialized in repairs for all models of BMW vehicles. This type of work is important in Lebanon because many people have BMW cars, which they often buy second-hand and so they require greater maintenance work. His customers include neighbors and friends from his community. 

Jaafar is requesting a loan of US$ 2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. Jaafar will continue to develop his business, but will use this loan primarily to make much needed repairs to his home.

loans.use: To develop his business and primarily to make repairs to his home

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has five dependents living with him. He has owned a store for polishing cars for more than 20 years. His customers include friends and other community members who have come to know him through his work over the past two decades. He says that he is very proud of the quality of his work and he believes that his extensive experience is what distinguishes him.

He is requesting a loan of US$ 2000 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to invest in polishing equipment and supplies. In the future, Ali hopes to further expand his business and provide greater support to his family.

loans.use: To invest in polishing equipment and supplies

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 27-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has two dependents living with him. His wife is currently pregnant with their second child. Adham has rented a shop for selling and repairing motorcycles and spare parts since 2005. His customers include friends, neighbors, and other people from his community who have learned about his business from previous or current customers. Adham believes that it is high quality work and experience that have helped him succeed. 

He is requesting a loan of US$ 1500 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to purchase more spare parts to sell as well as purchase a new motorcycle. Adham is hoping to continue expansion of his business in the future so that he can better provide for his family and the new baby.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and a new motorcycle

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married lady with one son, Eric, who is now two years old.  For ten years, she has been operating a retail shop where she sells cereals and food products.  She belongs to a group called 'Five Star'.  Being a member of this group, she is able to access loans easily from Faulu Kenya because the members guarantee each other's loans.  

Eunice has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more cereals and food products for sale.  She hopes to open up a supermarket in the future.  She dreams of venturing into other businesses so as to increase her income.  Eunice says that she is determined to grow her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of cereals and other food products

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: Madame Dior T., âgée de 61 ans, est veuve mère de 3 enfants tous majeurs. Elle pratique le commerce de produits céréaliers et la vente de jus de fruits locaux depuis presque 30 ans. C'était, à cette époque, pour bien s'occuper de ses enfants qui vivaient tous dans une très grande famille polygame qu'elle embrassa le commerce.Elle compte, avec ce prêt, s'approvisionner en arachides nécessaire à son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dior T., 61 years old, is a widow and the mother of three grown children. She sells cereal products and juices made of local fruit. Initially, she started doing this to provide for her children who lived in a very larger polygamous family. With this loan, she plans to purchase peanuts indispensable for her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing peanuts [for resale]

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Mr. S., 37, resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He owns a medium size farm that he inherited from his grandparents. Here he plants different types of vegetables from which he earns a living. He normally harvests and sells vegetables when it comes to maturity. He lives with his wife who works as a garment factory laborer. This couple was married years ago and they have three school-aged children. 

S. has difficulty irrigating his crop because his farm is far from the watering system. S. is therefore applying for a loan to buy a pump to pump the water to his crops.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigation

loans.name: Kaïré

texts.fr: Madame Kaïré Dioufest vendeuse de tissus du genre thioupe (indigo). E lle est également la femme de charge de la garderie d'enfants mis en place par le programme du CCF. Elle est à sa deuxième demande de prêt au sein de U-IMCEC.Ainsi, les bénéfices tirés de premier prêt lui ont permis de contribuer aux charges familiales. Cette fois ci, elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 FCFA pour s'approvisionner en marchandises et aider son mari qui est au chômage aux charges quotidiennes de la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kaïre Dioufest sells special tinted fabrics (indigo). She is also the lady in charge of the nursery put in place by the CCF program. She is requesting a second loan from U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions). The profits she made from the first loan have allowed her to contribute to the family expenses. This time she is asking for a loan of 100,000 FCFA in order to get supplies of goods and to help her husband, who is unemployed, with the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get fabric supplies for her business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok S., 73, is a father who is blessed with three children. Two are married and have already started new homes, while the third is single. One of his children helps the family by working in the garment industry. 

Sok S. owns a medium-sized piece of farmland that he plants rice crops on to earn a living. Also, he assists in his wife's business selling snack food. Sok S. is pursuing a loan in order to improve his farming business.

loans.use: To improve his farming business.

loans.name: Khoury

texts.fr: Khoury D. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE SUD depuis 1 an et demi et a reçu 3 fois de suite de crédit qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. C'est une femme très dynamique et assidu, en une année et demi dans le Banc Villageois elle a pu réalisé un bon niveau d'épargne. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter des produits cosmétiques pour dame et des bijoux qu'elle va vendre dans une petite boutique et en faisant du porte à porte. Son objectif est d'agrandir sa boutique tout en soutenant son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Khoury D. is a 45-year old lady who is married and mother to four children, who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in MONTAGNE SUD for one and a half years and has had three consecutive loans which she has always managed well and repaid on a regular basis. She is a very dynamic and assiduous lady, and in a year and a half with the Banc Villageois she has been able to achieve a good level of savings. With her new loan she is going to buy cosmetic products for ladies, as well as jewelry which she will sell in a small shop and on a door-to-door basis. Her objective is to expand her shop, while at the same time supporting her husband in taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capacity

loans.name: Tungalagtamir

texts.en:
Tungalagtamir L., 42, is married and the mother of a 19-year-old son. She and her family live together in an apartment in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her son, Bulganhangai, is a university student. They have been living together in their current home for 15 years. 

Tungalagtamir operates a pig farm with her husband. They have been operating their business since 2008, and have been steadily expanding their business. She has created another pig farm in a Tuv province as well. With her business profit, she purchased a car for her family. Over the past years, Tungalagtamir and her husband have been successfully operating their business and have built a loyal customer base. She is an honest and hardworking person. 

Tungalagtamir would like expand her business and to be able to pay her only son's university tuition fee. She is requesting a 2,600,000 Mongolian Tugrug (MNT) loan to expand her pig farm and to purchase more pigs for her business.

loans.use: To expand her farm

loans.name: Batirhan

texts.en:
Batirhan S., 52, is married and the father of two children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. They have been living together in their current home for 12 years.

Batirhan operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Tirlik. He has been operating his business since 1998 with his wife's help. In his business, his wife sells the products. In addition, Batirhan has been operating a taxi service since 2001 with his own car.

With the profits from his businesses, he built a house for his family in 2002. Batirhan has been planning to build a store with the profit from both businesses in the future.

He is a very hardworking person and focused on the future. Batirhan says, “I would like to successfully operate my business in order to provide a good education for my children."

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing from Taikeshken, a Chinese border town, to resell them to his many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur Y. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent).

Gantumur operates a water trading business in his town. He has been operating his business since 1996 with his horse cart. Over the past years he has expanded the business. Currently, he has been trading water with a small truck as well as his horse cart.  Initially he worked in a brick factory between 1982 and 1990.

Gantumur is a very hardworking person. He has been planning to operate businesses selling Chinese clothing and manufacturing energy efficient fuel. Gantumur's family and businesses are both very important to him. One of his children works in a gold mine and earns 300,000 MNT per month.

Gantumur has been working hard to provide a better life for his family. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory from Ereen, a Chinese border town.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Purevdash

texts.en:
Purevdash T. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, which is a Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest two daughters, ages 22 and 21, are university students. His youngest daughter, Enhzul, is a secondary school student.

Purevdash operates a retail business with his wife in his town. He has been successfully operating his business since 2008. Purevdash has been planning to expand his business and rent another counter in order to sell more clothing to his customers. Previously, he worked as a plumber, electrician and bricklayer in a local factory.

After Mongolia changed into a market economy, Purevdash became a herder with a few head of livestock. Unfortunately, during the winter disaster in the year 2000, most of his livestock died.

Purevdash is a very hardworking person. He says, “I would like to expand my business in order to be financially stable until my children graduate from university.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Khy K. is 49 years old, lives in the province of Kompong Tom and makes a living by selling fritters and raising animals. Her income is about $2.50 per day. She is divorced and has five children, four of whom are employed, while the youngest is still in school. Khy K. is applying for a loan to buy a piece of land, on which she will build a new house in which she and her family will live.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land on which she will build a new house.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en: Selenge Bayantur is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Two of her children attend a local secondary school located near the home that the family has lived in for seven years. Her husband, Natsagdorj, operates a transportation business while Selenge makes a living selling clothing. She started her business in 2008 with savings of 800,000 MNT and a 1,000,000 MNT loan from our bank. Selenge sells her goods in a rented space, and has working capital of 2,000,000 MNT. She is a hardworking person with great communication skills, and some time in the next year plans to buy a plot of land with a yard for her family. To help make this possible, she has applied for a loan for 1,500,000 MNT to buy more clothing to sell from her shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell in her shop

loans.name: Shaizanda

texts.en:
Shaizanda M. is 72-year-old businessman who lives with his wife and their youngest two children in a ger (or Mongolian nomadic tent) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. He and his wife have two older children who live independently while the youngest two, who are 16 and 17, attend a local secondary school. Shaizanda and his wife make a living by selling meat in their town. He has been in this line of work since 1998, and has gained much experience in that period of time. Mongolian families purchase large amounts of meat during the winter and use it until spring, and one household will consume approximately one ox and 10 sheep during that period of time. During March, the demand for meat increases because many families have run out of supplies. Herders from the countryside bring their livestock from as far as 100-200 kilometers away to the center of the province to sell it. 

In Shaizanda's business, his wife sells the meat and he does the butchering. Currently, meat prices are high and business is good because Shaizanda is a very smart and hardworking person. Now the most important thing for him is to save money to pay his younger children's university tuition fees. To make this possible, he is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy large amount of meat at wholesales price to resell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of meat to sell to his customers

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza is widowed with six children and all her children go to school.  She lives in a four-room house where she stays with only her children. She rears all types of chickens, i.e. broilers and layers. She owns a poultry farm in Kyebando Nsooba Kawempe Division with about 600 chickens, both layers and broilers. Tereza sells both at wholesale and at retail and gets around 20 customers a day.  Tereza wants to use this loan of 1,000,000/= to buy more bags of poultry feed and 200 chicks. She has been in this business for over 10 years and with MCDT for 12 years. Tereza doesn’t have any side job. Her major customers are nearby shops and families.  Tereza works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and an increase in the price of poultry feed.  She aspires to own 1,000 chickens and a delivery van. Tereza decided to work with MCDT because it was helping poor women. She stays in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more poultry feed and 200 chicks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old and the single mother of three children who range from 7 to 15 years old. All three currently attend school while she works as a farmer and sells milk in the local market. She also runs a hotel in the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. Susan went into business many years ago by selling groceries, then switched to farming, where her biggest challenge is the fluctuating price of milk, especially during the rainy season when prices are very low.

To improve her life and standard of living, she has applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 20,000 to begin raising poultry. She hopes the income from this loan will help her lease enough land to expand her farm. She is optimistic that this is the best way to increase opportunity for her and her family.

loans.use: To begin raising poultry

loans.name: Tseveendolgor

texts.en: Tseveendolgor A., 51, is a widow and the mother of three children. She and her family live in an apartment in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Two of her children are university students and one of her daughters, Andrah, is a secondary-school student. Tseveendolgor makes a living as a tailor, sewing traditional Mongolian dresses and coats (known locally as Deel). She began operating this business in 1986 in her home, and has become a very experienced seamstress over the past 24 years. In 2007, she started manufacturing traditional clothing for local sellers, and has been very successfully in this field. Tseveendolgor says, “Now the most important thing to expand my business and create my own working capital by getting a loan. My dream is one day to open my own sewing workshop.” She has applied for a loan for 285,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for a tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and flour.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Gertrude sells milk in Kalerwe Market and buys milk from diaries in Kawempe, so she incurs transport costs to and from buying milk. She wants to use this loan of 300,000/= to buy more jerrycans of milk.  Gertrude has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for 1 1/2 years, servicing her third loan. Besides this milk business, she also owns a motorcycle (boda-boda) which brings in additional income to the family. She sells both at retail and at wholesale. Gertrude works six days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow big and own a permanent place for her business. Gertrude joined MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital. Gertrude rents the house where the family stays and has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Riinya

texts.en:
Riinya is 47 years old. She is a widowed mother of 4 children aged between 14 to 23 years old. All of her children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Eastern Kenya in Nkubu town. Riinya has been farming for 24 years and to date she has 3 permanent employees and 10 casual labourers. Her main produce is tea, which she sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also earns income from rental houses she owns in the area and taxi services she offers to the locals.

Riinya recently completed her first loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES. 48,150 which she used to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She has now requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for KES. 75,000 to purchase a dairy cow.

The income from this loan will assist her in renovating her house and educating her children. She also plans to build residential houses on another part of her land with the profits from this loan. In future, she would like to expand her farming by constructing a zero grazing unit and installing a biogas plant.

She says, "Juhudi Kilimo has greatly improved on service delivery, and patience and hard work pays off eventually".

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and start a poultry project

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 21 years old and married, with a 2-year-old child. She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. She has been farming for 3 years with only one employee. Her main products are vegetables, maize and cereals, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from selling milk and beans to the market.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help her expand her business since she will earn enough income from the sale of milk, which will reduce her dependency on her husband's salary as it is at the moment. Her main challenges are fluctuations in the prices of cereals and the financial constraints to acquire a productive dairy cow. She intends to acquire more land to accommodate her dairy farming. Her desire is to purchase a piece of land where she will sell her produce.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa is married with five children. Four of her children go to school and the other one is a four-month-old baby. She resides in and rents a two-room house in Busega - Lubaga Division where the family stays. Kasifa owns a retail shop in Natete and pays a monthly rent of 40,000/=. Kasifa wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like soap (bathing and washing), sugar, salt, cooking oil and bread. Kasifa has been in this business for four years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her 11th loan. Besides this retail shop business, she also sells second hand women clothes and piped water. Her customers are taxi touts because she works near Natete taxi park and works six days a week. Her business challenges include thieves and the rainy season because she works in flooded place. Kasifa aspires to see her business grow bigger and sell at wholesale only. She joined MCDT because it was dealing with women regardless of their status. The family has access to electricity and piped water and monthly expenses include utility bills, rent for both residence and business, and school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Bartholomew

texts.en:
Bartholomew is 63 years old, married and has 9 children aged 16 to 37 years old. Two of the children are currently in school. He is a farmer from the Rift valley near the town of Litein. He has been farming for 35 years and has 3 employees. His main products are milk and maize, which he sells to the local market. He also owns some rental houses in Litein and earns income from selling vegetables to the local market.

Bartholomew is one of the many active clients in Juhudi Kilimo. He recently completed his second loan for KES 40,000. He has requested this third loan from Juhudi for KES 40,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The income from this loan will assist him in paying fees for his children. His main challenges in this business have been the shortage of water, which has affected production in the greenhouse (vegetable farm), and lack of machines to prepare the animal feeds.

In the future, he would like to have fully-fledged greenhouses for more vegetable and tomato production. He also intends to construct and improve his dairy units. He says, "Juhudi loans have improved my standard of living, have even helped me increase my rental houses and even buy a car."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Destiny Women Group

texts.en:
Sarah W. is the leader of a group of three borrowers called Destiny Women. She is 39 years old, married, and has four children who range from 9 to 22 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to poverty.

For 7 years, she has been selling fish, chicken and pork at the Topoe Village Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning. 
 
She plans to use her 16,000 LRD portion of this 47,000 LRD group loan to buy more fish, chicken and pork. Her goal is to expand her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sarah is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more fish, chicken and pork

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy some photo studio equipment such as camera batteries and film

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 51 years old, married and has five children aged 10 to 26 years old. Four of the children are currently in school. He is a farmer from the Rift valley near the town of Litein. He has been farming for 6 years and has been able to employ 3 workers over time. His main products are milk, bananas and tea, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from a retail shop and a private medical clinic he owns in the same area.

He has successfully completed his first loan for KES 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo. He has requested this loan for KES 80,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will improve his family's living standards. His main challenges in the dairy business are getting quality semen for his dairy cows and lack of funds to run a dairy business. He would like to start a hotel business in the future.

He is grateful to Juhudi / Kiva for the continuous funding which has improved his standard of living and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: United Sisters Group

texts.en:
Mamie D. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called United Sisters. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children who range from 13 to 18 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school because of poverty.

For a year, Mamie has been selling charcoal at the ELWA community in Paynesville, Liberia. Her nice manner of approach keeps her customers returning. Mamie started selling charcoal with a little cash that was given to her by her husband. However, she sometimes faces problems with a shortage of capital to buy more charcoal.

Mamie plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more charcoal for sale. Her goal is to expand her business and cater more to her children in their schooling, medical needs and nutrition.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mamie is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old, married and has 2 children, 16 and 22 years old. One of the children is attending school. Jane is a farmer from the town of Kitale, in Western Kenya. She has been farming for 4 years and selling her milk to the local market. She also earns income from making and selling ballasts at the local market. Her main challenges are the diseases which are rampant in the area, causing regular deaths of poultry and dairy cows.

Jane recently completed her first loan for KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo. She has requested this loan for KES 22,000 to start a poultry project and purchase an energy pack (solar panel, charger and a bulb). The extra income from this loan will assist her in providing for her family and educating her children. Jane intends to buy a piece of land and venture fully into dairy farming. She even wants to expand her poultry farm but lacks electricity.

She appreciates the fact that Juhudi / Kiva have given her a loan.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Marie S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children who range from 1 to 7 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school because of poverty.

For 8 years, Marie has been selling charcoal at retail at the Thinkers Village community in Paynesville, Liberia. She has a nice manner of approach to her customers which keeps them returning.

Marie started by selling oil and did not have any problems when doing business. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal for sale. Her goal is to build a house and send her children to school.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marie is holding the sign. And Teze D. is inset at the lower left because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 50 years old and married with 8 children aged 11 to 28 years old. Five of the children are currently in school. She is a farmer from Western Kenya in Kitale town. She has been farming for 10 years with only one employee. Her main produce is milk which she sells to the milk vendors who in turn supply to the industries. She also earns income from vegetables that she sells to the local market. 

She recently completed her third loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.25,000. She has requested this loan from Juhudi for KES.30,000 to expand her poultry project. She says the income from this loan will assist her in educating her children and providing for her family. Her biggest challenge in mixed farming business is the high chances of dairy animals falling sick, hence expensive to treat. In future, she intends to add more acreage of her land to enable her to expand her farming activities.

She appreciates the fact that Juhudi has supported her from the first loan up to this fourth loan.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Desde el año 2002 Aída Luz  Díaz A., puso en marcha  su idea de negocio concebida desde mucho antes de tener sus hijos, pero empezó en esta época porque priorizó las actividades propias del hogar y la educación personal de ellos. En la actualidad aun sigue como comerciante y además de  vender  calzado, correas bolsos, simultáneamente prepara alimentos y refrescos, como gaseosas y  chichas combinadas almuerzos para sus clientes del barrio y familiares que multiplican su publicidad y le traen referidos.

A sus 43 años aun vive en el barrio la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, un lugar muy cerca al estadio de Futbol Metropolitano  de Barranquilla”,  con sus tres hijos en edades de 16, 19 y 23 años, que son una gran motivación y la impulsan a crear opciones de ingreso constantemente. Aida Luz Díaz dice que los créditos le ha servido para mejorar sus ingresos, sacar adelante a sus hijos en el tema educativo y aumentar sus utilidades, por eso en la actualidad solicita su tercer  crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $1.500.000,  ella va comprar mercancías al por mayor y de contado como calzado, correas bolsos y materias primas e insumos  para la preparación de  almuerzos especiales en el día de la madre, mes en el que espera un repunte importante en sus venta y puede conseguir descuentos al comprar en mayor cantidad.

Su desafío constante es la fuerte competencia  pero diariamente mejora sus habilidades para sostenerse  con calidad  y ofrece plazos cómodos acompañados de una atención esmerada a sus clientes. Ahora su meta principal y también gran desafío, es construir una habitación para mas adelante montar un almacén en una de las esquinas de su vivienda.
texts.en:
In 2002, Aida Luz D. A. put into practice her business idea which she had years before she had children; she didn't start it till 2002 because she prioritized her household duties and her children's education. Now she works as a saleswoman selling shoes, belts, and purses; at the same time, she prepares meals and drinks, like soft drinks and chica (a local beverage), for her customers and relatives in her neighborhood--they all give her more publicity which brings in more business. She is 43 years old and lives in the Cuidadela 20 de Julio neighborhood, an area very close to the Barranquilla Metropolitan Football Stadium, with her three children who are 16, 19 and 23 years old. They are a great source of motivation for her and constantly encourage her to generate new income. Aida Luz D. says that the loans she has received have helped her to increase her income and help her children in their education and in what she can provide for them; this is why she is seeking a 3rd loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo of $750. She will use it to buy wholesale merchandise like shoes, belts and purses and ingredients for her food sales business; this is particularly important this month with Mother's Day as it will be a month of high demand and she will be able to get discounts if she buys in larger quantities. Her constant challenge is the amount of competition she faces but daily she tries to improve her abilities to support herself through better quality and offering good prices and good customer service. Her primary goal and challenge is to build an additional portion of her home that she can use as a warehouse in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise like shoes, belts, and purses, and ingredients for food sales

loans.name: Greatful Group

texts.en:
Helena C. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Greatful. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children who range from 4 to 10 year old. She did not continue her education through high school because of poverty.

For 6 years, Helena has been selling foodstuffs such as pepper, salt and oil at the Gbengba Town market in Paynesville, Liberia. She gives her goods a good presentation which keeps customers turning.

Helena started by selling dried meat and she has not experienced any problems doing business. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more oil, salt and pepper for sale. Her goal is to build a shop and send her children to school.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Helena is holding the sign. And Gueah is inset at the lower right because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To buy more oil, salt and pepper for sale.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 40 years old and married with three children, ages 9, 13, and 20. All of her children are attending school. She's a farmer in Litein in the South Rift Valley of Kenya. She's been farming for ten years and employs two people from the community. She has a mixed farm and sells maize, beans, vegetables, and tea produced on the farm. She also earns income from the hair salon and boutique she runs in town. (She is pictured above in her boutique.) She says that the main challenges to her business are an insufficient market for milk and hail storms, which have reduced her tea production.

She successfully completed a previous loan for Kshs. 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo and requested this loan for Kshs. 60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her overall dairy business and then she'll be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. In the future, she would like to expand into pineapple farming, increase and improve her dairy animals, and install a salon on her own premises (rather than renting). She added that "she has been able to learn how to save through Juhudi."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria Esther

texts.es:
Gloria L. D. Bonifàz  tiene 68 años vive en el barrio Costa hermosa del Municipio D.  Soledad, la tierra D. las mejores butifarras artesanales D. Colombia tal como lo dice Gloria; ella  tiene una negocio D. variedades llamado “ DonD. Julio L.”, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos D. 29 y 34 años D. edad. Empezó en el año 1999 con su negocio y lo registró en la Cámara D. comercio el año 2004, tiene una miscelánea donD. venD. ropa calzado, útiles escolares, ganchos moños, productos D. belleza, servicios D. fotocopiado, papelería, calzado, juguetes, artículos D. ferretería y hasta refrescos y medicinas sin restricciones D. consumo.
Considera a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo como uno D. los pilares para que su  negocio “DonD. Julio”  funcionara; con su primer crédito D. $ 900.000 empezó a surtirlo y asì continúo hasta hacerlo una gran miscelánea como la que ahora tiene;  En la actualidad solicita su noveno financiamiento por valor D. $2.000.000 para comprar mercancía como papelería lencería insumos D. modistería y confitería.
