Su gran sueño es ampliar su negocio convertirlo en un gran almacén, haciendo su casa D. dos pisos para que queD. separado el espacio productivo del familiar, D. esta manera estaría ubicado en el primer piso  su almacén y la familia viviría en  la segunda planta.
Los mayores desafíos están relacionados cuando llegan  problemas D. salud D. sus  familiares y debe hacer gastos extras,  pero todos los días tiene un gran desafío y es el que su negocio siga en pie, para sostener su familia y aumentar su nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Gloria L. D. Bonifàz is 68 years old and lives in the Costa Hermosa neighborhood of the municipality of Soledad. Gloria says that this is the area with the best Colombian artisanal sausages. She has a business selling all sorts of things called “DonD. Julio L.” and lives with her husband. They have two children ages 29 and 34. She started her business in 1999 and registered it with the Chamber of Commerce in 2004. Gloria sells a variety of products like: clothing, shoes, school supplies hair clips, beauty products, photocopies, paper products, toys, hardware and even drinks and medicines that don’t require a prescription. See thinks of “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo” as one of the foundations of her business, that help her business, “DonD. Julio,” function. With her first loan of $ 900.000, she began to stock it and continued in this way until she had the great variety of wares she has now. She is taking out her 9th loan, for $2,000,000, to buy merchandise like paper products, sewing,craft supplies, and sweets. Her greatest dream is to grow her business into a big warehouse making her house two floors so she can separate her business from her home. This way she would have her business on the first floor and the family would live upstairs on the second floor. Her greatest challenges are related. When family members get sick and she has more bills to pay and her everyday challenge of keeping her business going to maintain her family and better improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like paper products, craft,sewing supplies, and sweets.

loans.name: Dick Otoniel

texts.es:
En el barrio los Girasoles y sus sectores aledaños no hay quien no conozca a Dick Gutiérrez M., es un reconocido líder comunitario  proactivo y un comerciante  muy bien entrenado; que desde antes de iniciar su negocio participó en capacitación para aprender a viabilizar sus proyectos de inversión, muchas veces repitió los cursos microempresariales para tener todo claro, y eso es lo que lo ha hecho que se sostenga en el mercado.
Conoció a la Fundación Santo Domingo en sus oficinas de servicio al cliente en Bancoldex, este es su segundo crédito que invertirá en la compra de un computador, porque su negocio ha crecido y quiere controlarlo mediante esta herramienta de informática y de una vez poder acceder a la tecnología de la información. 
Dick Gutiérrez afirma “los créditos me han permitido crecer y se me han abierto las antenas de las oportunidades para seguir adelante y he logrado apreciar el valor del dinero, pues cuando era empleado lo derrochaba”, cree que antes perdió mucho tiempo y no ahorró, pero esas son cosas del pasado y ahora tiene unas metas muy claras y una directriz  de trabajo: él quiere tener un gran almacén  muy reconocido, pues es el sueño de  toda su vida, por eso su desafío es no desperdiciar esfuerzos, trabajar en su negocio y reinvertirle todo lo que pueda.  
Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 13 y 18 años, que lo inspiran para avanzar en esta época de cambios, como es un gran emprendedor, conciente de las oportunidades de negocio, que vende mercancía variada mediante catálogos, impuso a su cónyuge, una mujer  que  goza de su admiración y su apoyo y  que es madre comunitaria,  a que también lo hiciera,  ahora ella con esta actividad adicional  genera importantes ingresos para el hogar y para su negocio y ambos comercializan muchos productos.
texts.en:
In the Girasoles (Sunflowers) neighborhood and surrounding areas everyone knows Dick Gutiérrez M.; he is a well-known proactive community leader and very well-trained merchant. Long before opening his business he took part in training programs to learn how to make his investment projects viable. Often he repeated micro entrepreneurial courses in order to really be clear on the information; all of this has made it possible for him to succeed in the marketplace. He became aware of Fundación Santo Domingo through its customer service office in Bancoldex. This will be his second loan which he’ll use to buy a computer because his business has grown and he wants to manage it through this IT tool and once and for all have access information technology. Dick Gutiérrez states: “the loans have made it possible for me to grow and have opened antennas to opportunities to continue forward; I have managed to appreciate the value of money because when I was an employee I tended to waste it.” He feels that he lost a lot of time before and didn’t save. But these are things of the past; now he has very clear goals and work direction. He wants to own a well-known store; this has been his life-long dream. His challenge, therefore, is not to waste efforts, to work at his business and reinvest all he can into it. He lives with his wife and two children who are 13 and 18 years of age; they inspire him to continue forward in these changing times. Because he is a great entrepreneur, conscious of business opportunities, who sells an assortment of catalogue merchandise, he urged his wife-a woman who has his admiration and support and is a mother to the entire community-to do the same. Now she too generates additional income for her family and business with this new activity; both spouses sell lots of products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 61 years old. She is married and has 9 children aged between 18 to 42 years old. She is a dedicated farmer from North Rift valley Kenya near Litein town. Mary has been farming for 10 years and has 2 employees. Her main produce is cabbages and tea, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of milk to the local market. Before venturing into the farming business, Mary initially was a business woman selling vegetables and maize to the local market. Her main challenge in this business is the milk glut (excess milk) which causes the price of milk to go down, leading to unstable income.

Mary recently completed her third loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.30,000. She has now requested a loan from Juhudi for KES.40,000 to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable her to acquire a good dairy cow that will increase the production of milk, hence earn her more income. She hopes to use the excess income from this loan to build a better house. In five years' time, Mary intends to increase her dairy herd and also improve the quality of the dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y jovial, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, en la casa de sus suegros. Se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, por lo que su trabajo lo realiza visitando de casa en casa de sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos, adicionalmente el buen trato que tiene ha hecho que capte mucho compradores.  La gran ventaja que tiene es cuando lo productos están de oferta, logrando así comprar la por mayor, por lo que logra obtener un stock de estos cosméticos, vendiéndolos luego a un buen precio. Gloria esta muy contenta con la actividad que realiza, ahora su mayor anhelo es incrementar la cantidad de estos productos, además desea incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir, para que así pueda independizarse de sus suegros y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de belleza y prendas de vestir, para aumentar sus ganancias y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria, 34, is a dynamic and jovial woman; she lives with her husband and three children in her in-laws’ house. She sells beauty products door-to-door. Thanks to the positive way she treats her customers she has captured many regular customers. She takes advantage of being able to buy stock items at wholesale when they are on special and then reselling them for a better price. Gloria is very happy with the work she does and her greatest wish right now is to increase her stock; she also wants to start to sell clothing so that she can become independent of her in-laws and be able to offer her children a better quality of life. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy beauty products and items of clothing to increase her profits and meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and items of clothing.

loans.name: Julia Piedad

texts.es:
Julia de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, actualmente vende almuerzos en su casa. Ya todos sus hijos se casaron y vive sola ya que se separo de su esposo hace unos años atrás. 

Julia empezó el negocio de almuerzo cuando sus hijos se casaron y cuando se separo de su esposo. Por la falta de ingresos decidió invertir sus ahorros en arroz, legumbres, carnes, mariscos para la venta de almuerzos, comenzó a repartir almuerzos a sus vecinos y amigos en sus casas, poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio. 

Ahora ella vende almuerzo utilizando el comedor de su casa para que las personas vallan a comer porque no tiene un local para un restaurante por falta de dinero. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, mariscos y también una parte del dinero quiere comprar cemento y bloques para remodelar su casa. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para su restaurante y también un minimarket.
texts.en:
Julia, 58, lives in a periurban area in El Suburbio, Guayaquil; she sells prepared lunches from home. All of her children are married and she lives alone because she separated from her husband a few years back. Julia started her lunch business when her children got married and she separated from her husband. Because she lacked income she decided to invest her savings in rice, vegetables, meats and seafood for her lunches. She started to home deliver them among her friends and neighbors and gradually her business grew. Now she sells lunches using her home’s dining room where customers can come eat because she doesn’t have enough money to have a place to set up a restaurant. She will use the loan to buy rice and seafood and she’ll use part of it to buy cement and concrete blocks to remodel her house. She would love to have a place for her restaurant and a minimart in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, seafood, cement and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 41 años, vive en su casa propia con su  esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 17 años  se dedica a la crianza de animales, en donde adquiere estos animales a un menor precio para luego cebarlos y venderlos a un precio alto de lo inicial. Por lo general vende toros, ya que las vacas que posee son utilizados para la extracción de leche, siendo vendidos a un vecino que se dedica en la transformación de alimentos lácteos, como: el queso,  mantequilla, entre otros. Sus hijos la apoyan en la crianza de estos animales vacunos, ya que debe tener el mayor apoyo posible en esta actividad, por ser un trabajo que les da mucha rentabilidad, es por ello que desea aumentar la cantidad de vacas posibles y toros de buena raza. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza.
texts.en:
Delfina, 41, lives in her own house with her husband and three children. For over 17 years she has raised farm animals. She buys them, fattens them up, and then sells them for a price that is higher than what she originally paid. She usually sells bulls because the cows she owns are used for milk production that is sold to a neighbor that makes dairy products like cheese and butter, among others. Her children help her raise the cattle because she can use all the help she can get because this is a very profitable business. Because of this, she wants to increase the possible number of cows and bulls of good breeds. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with her repayments. She feels that this support will be very important for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy a thoroughbred cow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a thoroughbred cow.

loans.name: Agne Lissethe

texts.es: Agne es una joven emprendedora, de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de siete años, su negocio es una pulpería que logro poner hace varios años, inicio este negocio con la venta de pan, café, golosinas hasta que logro captar cliente y comenzó a invertir. Vive junto con su mama quien la ha  apoyado siempre, su meta es lograr mejorar la vivienda ya que aun le falta el repello a las paredes y las divisiones a si como embaldosar para una mejor higiene en su hogar como dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con este préstamo invertirá en productos de consumo diario como: pollo, carne, huevo, queso, granos básicos, productos enlatados, golosinas, gaseosas para hacer más competitivo su negocio. Lo que mas desea en un futuro es poder hacerla en distribuidora e ir ahorrando para hacer su propia casa.
texts.en:
Agne, 30, is a young entrepreneur; she is a single mother of a 7-year-old son. She set up a grocery store several years ago selling bread, coffee and snacks; once she started to acquire regular customers she started to invest more in it. She lives with her mother who has always supported her efforts; her goal is to improve their dwelling because the exterior and interior walls are still unsealed and the floors need to be tiled for better hygiene in the home and to provide better customer service. She will use this loan to buy stock merchandise items like: chicken, meat, eggs, cheese, basic grains, canned goods, snacks and soft-drinks in order to be more competitive. What she most desires for the future is to convert her store into a distribution site and to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, snacks, meat, chicken and canned goods.

loans.name: Francisca Cristina

texts.es: La señora Francisca vive en el barrio Walter Ferreti, procreo dos hijos, para ella ha sido difícil ya que no ha tenido la ayuda de su compañero. Desde hace varios años trabaja en una empresa privada como conserje, anteriormente lavaba y planchaba para ganarse el sustento cada día, muy agotador pero hasta ahora logro apoyar a sus dos hijos. Para ella estos financiamiento han sido de muchos beneficios ya que ha logrado mejorar su casa, con el crédito anterior logro embaldosar, y ahora quiere cambiar el techo que lo tiene en mal estado ya que comenzó a llover y se le pasa el agua. Sus planes es seguir haciendo las mejoras a su pequeña casa.
texts.en:
Francisca lives in the Walter Ferreti neighborhood; she has two children. It has been very difficult for her because she hasn’t had any support from her partner. She has worked as a caretaker for a private firm for several years; she used to take in washing and ironing to earn her daily support. It’s exhausting work but she’s managed to support her two children. For her, these loans have been of great benefit because they have made it possible to improve her home; she used the previous loan to install tile floors. Now, she needs to replace the roof because it’s in poor condition and the rainy season has started and water leaks in. Her plans are to continue to make improvements to her small house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to replace her roof.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es: Don Luís es un hombre dedicado al trabajo desde joven logro aprender la construcción hoy en día, trabaja como maestro de obra lo que se ha beneficiado ya que el ha construido su propia casa. Su esposa procreo dos hijos y trabaja como estilista para pagar gastos básicos y poder apoyar a su esposo. Don Felipe ha mejorado su casa gran parte con los financiamientos de la institución. Los tiempos difíciles es cuando no tiene trabajo por semanas la situación económica se le complica. Pero casi siempre trabaja por contratos haciendo escuelas, en los departamentos en donde se lleva meses en la construcción y su salario esta fijo. Son trabajo cansado pero se gana bien. Con este crédito comprara materiales para instalar el cielo raso de su casa, y poder bajar la temperatura del calor que ha estado bastante calorosa.
texts.en:
Luís is a dedicated worker; from a very early age he learned construction skills and today he works as a master builder. An added benefit of this is that he has built his own house. He and his wife have two children; she works as a beautician to help him with household expenses. Felipe has improved his home in large measure thanks to financing from the institution. Hard times are when he doesn’t have work for weeks and the economic situation becomes complicated. Most of the time, however, he has work contracts to build schools for departments where the job lasts several months and the salary is steady; it’s exhausting work but it pays well. He will use this loan to buy materials and supplies to install ceilings in his home in order to cool it down a bit because it’s been pretty hot.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to install ceilings in his house.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Paula es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Paula junto a toda su familia se dedican a la elaboración de tejidos artesanales, productos que venden a intermediarios y mercados. Además Paula tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende mercería.
Paula necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, betún y pila.
Los sueños de Paula son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula, 47, is a member of the Gabriela communal bank. She’s married and has three children. She, together with the entire family, manufactures artisanal weavings that they sell to middlemen and in the markets. In addition, Paula has a stand in the 12 de Abril market where she sells her merchandise. Paula needs a 900 sol loan to buy wool, die and a sink. Paula’s dreams are to improve her business and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, dye and a sink.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Maritza es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, obstetriz de profesión, Maritza tiene un consultorio y botica en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de una enfermera.
Maritza necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos.
Los sueños de Maritza son tener una clínica y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maritza, 42, is a member of the Gabriela communal bank. She is married and has three children. She’s an obstetrician and has a consulting office and drug store in her home; she is open for business every day and employs a nurse to help her. Maritza needs a 1200 sol loan to buy medicines. Maritza’s dream is to have a clinic and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Delia es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Delia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz y aceite.
Los sueños de Delia son educar a sus hijos y ampliar su tienda.
texts.en:
Delia, 36, is a member of the Gabriela communal bank. She lives with her life partner and two children. She has a store in her home where she stocks groceries like meats and vegetables; she is open for business every day. Delia needs a 1200 sol loan to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil. Her dreams are to educate her children and enlarge her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es: Sulma tiene 51 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y esposo en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años se dedica en la adquisición de animales a precios muy bajos del mercado, para luego cebarlos durante 4 meses y venderlos a un precio alto. Ella ha demostrado ser un excelente negociante, su facilidad de palabra y capacidad de convencer logra realizar una buena venta, de cuyas ganancias le ayuda para sostener a su familia. Sus hijos la ayudan en el trabajo, luego que terminar de hacer las labores del colegio. Con el pasar del tiempo, su capital de trabajo aumentó y eso le da tranquilidad y satisfacción al ver el buen trabajo que realizó, ya que el bueno cuidado en la alimentación e higiene de sus animales ha logrado este desarrollo. Su mayor anhelo es tener cantidad de animales para no dejar de trabajar y aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, por tanto continuará siendo muy responsable como lo fue siempre, además considera que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una vaca de buena raza  con la que pretende vender leche mas adelante.
texts.en:
Sulma, 51, lives with her five children and her husband in her own house. For over six years she has raised farm animals that she buys at low prices in the market and sells at higher prices after keeping them for four months. She has shown herself to be an excellent negotiator. Her sales skills and ability to convince her buyers allow her to make good sales the profits of which help her support her family. Her children help her with her chores when they finish their school work. As time has passed, her working capital increased and it gives her satisfaction and peace of mind to see the fruits of her labor because it’s thanks to the good care in feeding and hygiene that her animals manage to develop so well. Her greatest wish is to have a larger herd so that she will always have work and her income will increase. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she will continue to be as responsible now as she’s been to date; she feels the funding will be very useful for her business to succeed. She will use the requested funds to buy a cow of a good breed in order to go into milk production and sales later on.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and go into milk production.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Elena es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Elena tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realizaba todos los días. Además Elena vende canchas y golosinas de manera ambulatoria en el centro de la ciudad.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Elena son tener una tienda mas grande y construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Elena, 33, is a member of the Gabriela communal bank. She is married and has four children. She has a store in her house where she sells groceries like meats and vegetables; she is open for business every day. In addition, Elena sells snacks and canchas (roasted corn kernels) along streets downtown. She needs a 1050 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Elena’s dreams are to have a larger store and to build her house with substantial materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Lucinda Emilia

texts.es:
Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Lucinda es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Lucinda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realizaba todos los días. Además Lucinda brinda el servicio de bordado de correas, carteras artesanales.
Lucinda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Lucinda son tener una tienda mas grande y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a member of the Communal Bank Gabriela. Lucinda is married, 40 years old, and has 5 children. She has a grocery store within her home and works daily selling vegetables, meats, and groceries in general. In addition, Lucinda can do needlework on home-made belts and wallets. Lucinda needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles for the purchase of rice and sugar. Lucinda’s dreams are to have a larger store and offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Flor,  ella tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, la socia tiene un restaurante y ella trabaja de administradora y de cajera y a veces moza, nuestra socia es una mujer decidida y muy emprendedora, ella solicita el préstamo para mejorar su restaurante y también comprar cubiertos. 
   
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “KILLA” Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchas district in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Our member is named Mrs. Flor. She is 26 years old and has 2 children, one who is 7 and the other who is 5. She owns and manages a restaurant as well as works as a cashier and at times a waitress. She is a determined and very enterprising. She is requesting the loan to improve her restaurant and buy silverware.

She is very thankful for and appreciates the support offered through this resource and commits herself to repay her loan in the required payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her restaurant ind buy silverware

loans.name: Me Som Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Esther describes herself as a hard-working woman. She is a 45-year-old resourceful mother of four children. Esther has operated a retail business selling meat and charcoal for the past 3 years. Charcoal is one of the most common and affordable sources of energy for cooking in Ghanaian homes. Esther plans to use the loan to purchase a large quantity of charcoal to expand her current business.  Ester hopes to provide her children with the best training, especially in education.  

Esther is currently the leader of the trust bank group called "Me Som", which means “I will serve” in Twi, the most commonly spoken language in Ghana.  There are five members in this group.  The other members of the group are traders in foodstuffs, cosmetics, pastry, baked goods and others.  Esther says that the whole group is well organized and they hope to use the loan to grow their businesses and improve their respective families' living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and meat in bulk

loans.name: Francisco Xavier

texts.pt:
Francisco Xavier da Costa R. nasceu na cidade de Tete, Província do mesmo nome, centro de Moçambique tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 17 e 07 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 9ą classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos. 
Saiu de Tete para Nampula depois da desmobilização militar, onde se formou em enfermagem. Mais tarde vai a Maputo em missão de trabalho e constitui o seu lar. Trabalha como enfermeiro e é quadro do Ministério da Saúde ha mais de 17 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 3.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária. 
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um vizinho que por sinal é chefe de quarteirão e é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, barrotes, cimento, pedra e outros) para continuar com a construção do seu estabelecimento comercial. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para a concluir o seu estabelecimento e começar com o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Francisco Xavier da Costa R. was born in Tete City, Tete Province in central Mozambique. He is 46 years old, married, and has two children, ages 17 and 7. Both children go to school. Francisco finished ninth grade and did not continue school because he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone other than his children. After demobilization, Francisco left Tete to go to Nampula, where he studied nursing. Later, because of a job transfer, he went to Maputo, where he made his home. For more than 17 years, he has worked as a nurse for the Ministry of Health. He has no employees and has a salary of 3,600 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and sometimes saves some in his bank account. Francisco has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through a neighbor who incidentally is head of the block and is a customer of this institution. This is Francisco's first loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, cement, stone and other items) to continue building his shop. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he may take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to finish building his shop and start his own business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, cement, stone and other items)

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando tiene 39 años, vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su pareja Herlinda de 40 años y sus dos hijos. A  él lo consideran como un hombre honesto y muy trabajador y está dispuesto a sacar adelante a su familia a base de esfuerzo y perseverancia. Hace más de 25 años, se dedica a la agricultura, por lo que trabaja sobre terrenos arrendados, cultivando papa, alverja y gladiolo, ya que esta actividad le genera ingresos económicos que le ayudan a continuar con la crianza de vacas, toros, carneros, cerdos y asnos. La cosecha, es lo que más le gusta de todas las actividades que desarrolla, por otro lado le incomoda cargar los pesados sacos llenos de productos, según manifiesta: “es bonito tener una buena cosecha, pero para trasladarlo al mercado es pesado y muy difícil”.  Es por ello que su mayor anhelo es sembrar en mayor cantidad, para que pueda aumentar su productividad, asimismo desea instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en su domicilio, ya que esto le permitirá brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a sus seres queridos. La emoción que siente lo motiva a continuar luchando a diario. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y se muestra bastante entusiasta de laborar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, puesto que son muy responsables y unidos. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semilla de alverja para sembrar, adicionalmente desea comprar varios sacos de bono para cuidar los cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Armando is 39 years old, rents a home with his partner Herlinda and children. They consider him an honest and hardworking man who is willing to improve his family’s standard of living through his efforts and perseverance. He has been farming for 25 years. As far as working on rented land he grows potatoes, peas, and gladiolas. Since he makes enough profits with this activity it helps him continue with raising cows, llamas, pigs, and donkeys. Farming is his favorite activity, however he has trouble carrying heavy sacs filled with his products. He says, “it is nice having a plentiful crop, but to transfer it to the market is very difficult.” That is why his biggest desire is to sow larger quantities and increase his productivity in order to set up a grocery store within his home. This would allow him to offer a favorable standard of living to his loved ones. The excitement he feels motivates him to continue striving everyday. This is his sixth loan with MFP and he is very enthusiastic of working with the members of his communal bank since they are very responsible and united. With the 2,500 Peruvian soles he is requesting he will buy pea seeds to sow and various sacs of manure to maintain his potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seeds to sow and various sacs of manure to maintain his potato crop.

loans.name: Gelgi De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Gelgi es madre de familia de tres hijos, muy trabajadora ya que le ha tocado sola criarlo. Es difícil pero el amor a sus hijos se ha propuesto sobresalir para que no falte la alimentación y educación. Trabaja en la costura  desde hace varios años, y ha tomado mucha experiencia y rapidez en su trabajo. También invertirá en un taller de servicios de soldadura en sociedad con su hermano para mejorar sus ingresos, con el financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción para reparar portón y poner techo en el taller ya que es enfrente de su casa que se hará el negocio poniendo local y su hermano las herramientas lo que espera captar clientes y que funcione bien el taller ya que serán mejores las entradas económicas lo que vendrá a beneficiar su entorno familiar.
texts.en:
Ms Gelgi is mother of three children and very hard working as she raises her children alone. It's difficult but the love of her children helps her to excel so that they are not for want of food or education. She has been working in sewing for several years and has gained experience and speed in her work. She also invests in a welding services shop in partnership with her brother to improve their income. With the loan, they would buy construction materials to repair the door and add a roof for the workshop as it is in front of their home. They will do better business with this new shop front along with the the tools her brother wants. They hope to attract customers with the new shop and improve the economic situation for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tin to put a roof on the new welding shop

loans.name: Las Hadas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es el de Las Hadas, por que consideran que pueden lograr  grandes cosas, hacer realidad lo que sueñan para  emprender en la vida. las cuales viven en la comunidad Las Vigas en el municipio de San Marcos las integrantes son Elsa ( venta de ropa), Emma (abarrotes), Norma (venta de frutas y verduras)Guillermina (compra y venta de calzado), Santa C. (elaboración de queso) Ifigenia (compra y venta de pescado), Josefina (compra y venta de pescado), Dora ( comprar y venta de frutas y verduras), Teresa  (compra y venta de pollos), Maria Elia (se dedica  a la  venta de comida).


Emma J.  Ramírez, es la representante del grupo las hadas. ella esta casada , su esposo es Maestro y tiene tres hijos. Ellos  se llaman  Carina  que tiene 18 años de edad y estudia en la Preparatoria, Francisco  tiene 15 años cursando la Preparatoria, Manuel  tiene 6 años va en el Jardín de niños. 

Emma se dedica  a la venta de  Abarrotes, con el fin de poder sacar a su familia adelante, para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Otras de sus actividades es que también se dedica a vender tamales, atole y empanadas  en  los fines de semana.

Nos comenta que se sintió a gusto al obtener su préstamo, por que es de gran satisfacción para ella poder surtir su tienda. Ella  comprara arroz, fríjol, azúcar, y refrescos para almacenarlo, pues se acerca  la temporada de julio y es cuando los precios de estos productos suben, para esto ella surtirá con antes para poder vender mejor.

Todas las integrantes están muy agradecidas por el apoyo que le ha brindado Fundación Realidad, por la confianza que le  tienen y esperan seguir trabajando con los préstamos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Hadas” (The Fairies) because they think they can achieve great things, making a reality of the dreams they wish to undertake in life. They live in the community of Las Vigas (The Beams) in the municipality of San Marcos. The members are Elsa (who sells clothes), Emma (who sells groceries), Norma and Dora (buying and selling fruits and vegetables), Guillermina (purchase and sale of shoes), Santa C. (cheese making), Ifigenia and Josefina (buying and selling fish), Teresa (buying and selling chickens), and María Elia (selling meals). Emma is the representative of the Las Hadas Group. She is married, her husband is a teacher, and they have 3 children; Carina, who is 18 and studies at a preparatory school, Francisco who is 15 and attends preparatory, and Manuel, who is 6 and attends kindergarten. Emma sells groceries and hopes to advance her family, so that her children will have a better quality of life. Her other activities include selling tamales, atole and empanadas on weekends. She tells us that she is delighted to receive this loan because it gives her great satisfaction to restock her store. Emma will buy rice, beans, sugar, and soft drinks to restock, since July is approaching and that is when prices for these products rise. She wants to restock earlier, so that she can sell more. All the group members are very grateful for the help offered by the Reality Foundation, and for the confidence it has in them. And they hope to continue working with the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING COOKING OIL, RICE, SUGAR, BEANS, AND SOFT DRINKS TO SELL

location.town: Localidad de las VIgas, Mpio. de San Marcos.

loans.name: Grace Nayianoi

texts.en:
Grace Nayianoi L. is 32 years old, married to Tonou L., and the mother of four school-going children.
For the last 14 years, Grace has been farming her own piece of land. She learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan, which she is planning to spend on preparing her land for planting maize. Maize has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. Grace hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. Grace's dream is to be involved in large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land for planting maize

loans.name: Nepatao Ole

texts.en: Nepatao Ole K. is 34-years-old. He is married to Noonkuta K. and the father of two children. Nepatao has been a farmer for the past eleven years with his own piece of land. He learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. With the loan, he is planning to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his wheat. Wheat does well in his area due to good climate conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer in wheat and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his wheat crop

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio vive en casa propia, tiene 40 años de edad, se encuentra casado con la Sra. Valeriana con quien tiene 3 hijos los mayores ya se encuentran en la Universidad y uno se encuentra en edad escolar, la Sra. Valeriana  se dedica a la venta de desayunos en la Ceja de El Alto de este modo colabora con los gastos del hogar. El Sr. Antonio tiene como actividad transportista propietario y trabaja en la empresa de radio taxi GOLD, donde ya tiene muchos clientes, es una persona responsable y trabajadora que desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

El crédito solicitado por el Sr. Antonio está dirigido a realizar el cambio de la caja automática de su vehículo por una caja mecánica, pues ya se encuetra un poco mal y esto no le permite realizar un buen trabajo, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Antonio is the owner of the house he lives in, he is 40 years old and married with Valeriana: together they have 3 children, two attending university and one of school age. Valeriana sells breakfasts in the centre of El Alto (called La Ceja by its inhabitants), thus contributing to the family expenses. Antonio has his own vehicle with which he works as a taxi driver for GOLD Radio Taxi company, and he has many customers there. He is a responsible and hard-working man wanting to improve his family’s quality of life. The loan Antonio is asking for will be used to change the automatic gearbox of his car with a mechanical one the automatic one is not working properly, and this prevents him from working proficiently. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the faith shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To chage the automatic gearbox of his car with a mechanical one.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Olga,  ella tiene 25 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de  5 años de edad, Nuestra socia tiene un stand ambulatorio de servicios de llamadas telefónicas a celulares, ella presta este servicio en la esquina de su barrio, tiene 4 celulares recargados con llamadas a cualquier destino nacional y la socia cobra 0.50 centavos el minuto, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con este negocio, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar tarjetas de teléfonos y venderlas y también para recargar sus celulares.
  
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Killa Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchac distrist, Cusco province, Cusco department. Our member is 25 year old Olga. She is in a common law marriage and has a five year old child. She has a moveable stand providing cell phone call services. She offers this service on the corner in her neighborhood. She has four charged cell phones that can call any national destination. She charges 0.50 centavos per minute. She alternates her activities between the household and this business. She is grateful for and values the support offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone cards and sell them, also to replenish the minutes on her cell phones

loans.name: Lucia Enole

texts.en:
Lucia Enole N. is 66 Years old. She is married to Francis N. and the mother of two children. Lucia has farmed her own piece of land for the last twenty years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members. This will be her first loan of ten thousand shillings which she will use to prepare her land to plant maize and beans. Maize does well in her area due to good climate conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Lucia's dream is to build a nice house and educate her grandchildren. Lucia is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to prepare land to plant maize and beans

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.pt:
Lígia Maria Alfredo B. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 31 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 13, 11, 10 e 01 anos de idade, os 3 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa dos sogros com a sua família e sustenta seus pais enviando algum valor monetário para as despesas de casa. 
Saiu de Maputo para Nampula devido a transferência do seu marido, 2 anos depois regressam a casa. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 9 anos e é quadro do Ministério de Educação. Possui também um negócio próprio que desenvolve com ajuda de um empregado, consegue um rendimento de 14.000.00mt, salário 5.800.00mt e 2.000.00mt da contribuição do marido. Com estes valores aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar pintos rações e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para fazer crescer ainda mais o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Lígia Maria Alfredo B. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 31 years old, married, and has four children, ages 13, 11, 10 and 1. The three elder children go to school. Lígia finished tenth grade but did not continue school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her in-laws' house with her family and supports her parents by sending them money for household expenses. Lígia left Maputo to go to Nampula because her husband was transferred, and two years later they returned home. For more than nine years she has worked as a teacher employed by the Ministry of Education. She also has her own business, which she runs with the help of one employee. She has an income from the business of about 14,000 meticais, a salary of 5,800 meticais and 2,000 meticais contributed from her husband. She uses these funds for household expenses and saves some in her bank account at Millenium Bim. Lígia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through co-workers who are also customers of this institution. This is her second loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy chicks, feed and vitamins to increase her stock. The earlier loan was for 15,000 meticais, and was used for the same purpose. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out more loans. In the future she would like to ask for more loans to make her business grow even more.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has been in the quarry business for 25 years starting when he was young. He is 47 and married to Benta Auma. Richard has been able to take care of his family of six, including four school-going children, from the proceeds of his trade. 

Richard was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to rent another piece of land and become a large-scale supplier of the stones.

loans.use: To rent another quarry site

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has run his retail shop in Naivasha town for six years. He sells dry food stuff including rice, sugar, flour, and cereals, which he buys in bulk and re-sells to his customers in small quantities. He is 59 years old, married to Alice Njeri, and they have four children all in their thirties.

Moses was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan with which he plans to buy rice, wheat, flour and sugar in bulk. In the future, he plans to turn his retail shop into a wholesale shop and supply food items in bulk to local retailers.

loans.use: To buy rice, wheat, flour, sugar to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter started wheat farming in 2000. He is 34 and married to Christine Nkosira. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He applied for a first loan of Kshs 35,000 which he repaid on time. He plans to use the new loan amount to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the wheat in his farm. Peter hopes to buy his own tractor in the future to use on his own farm and also get extra income by hiring it out to other farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his wheat

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus repairs electronics in Naivasha town.  He is 28 years old, married to Emily M. and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He used the first loan of Kshs 38,000 to buy a new set of tools which he paid well and on time.  He plans to use this loan to buy copper wire and a grider machine. The grider machine is used to cut through steel and metallic materials.

Justus plans to become a big player in the repair of electronics in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy copper wire and a grider machine

loans.name: Maria Encarnacion

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Maria es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en su casa, además vende bebidas y un poco de abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza.
Maria sueña con tener un negocio mas grande, tener una distribuidora de cerveza y un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Gabriela Communal Bank. Maria is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Maria has a restaurant in her house. She also sells drinks and a few groceries. She does this everyday with help from her son. Maria needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy beer. Maria’s dream is to have a larger business, a beer distributorship, and a seamstress shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last four years in Naivasha town.  He is 36 years old, married to Margaret Nyatana and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He used the first loan of Kshs 63,000 to buy a new motorcycle and he paid it well and on time.  He plans to use this loan to renew his PSV license and insurance coverage and to buy a helmet for his passenger.  

Geoffrey plans to a buy a minibus in the future and use it in the transport business.  This will greatly increase his income.

loans.use: To renew his PSV license and insurance and buy a helmet

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio de 48 años, tiene 7 hijos, 6 de ellos, los tuvo con su primera pareja quien murió hace varios años, mientras que el menor de su hijo, es de Florinda de 40 años con quien mantiene una relación desde hace dos años, está familia vive juntos en una casa alquilada en la ciudad, asimismo tiene una casa propia, en donde viven sus demás familiares. Lo que más ama es la tranquilidad en los campos, por eso lleva 35 años, cultivando maíz, arveja, olluco y papa en sus propios terrenos, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus esposa, quien la ayuda en la etapa de cosecha. Paralelo a esta actividad y trimestralmente trabaja como estibador ganando diario de S/. 20.00  a S/. 40.00 nuevos soles.  Lo que más le disgusta a Dionisio, es llevar sus productos que cosechó al mercado, pese además que recibe pocas ganancias, que no lo ayudan a cubrir la mano de obra ni la inversión realizada. Dentro de sus objetivos, planea construir una casa grande en la ciudad con varias habitaciones, para que pueda alquilar a estudiantes y turistas; asimismo instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles. Por tal motivo desea continuar sembrando con gran dedicación, y producir varios sacos de papa. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y está seguro que todo le saldrá bien de aquí en adelante porque cuenta con el capital de trabajo que requiere, además le gusta trabajar de manera organizada en su grupo comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Dionisio is forty-eight years old and has seven children, six of whom he had with his first partner who died a few years ago. His youngest child is Florinda's, who is forty years old, and with whom he has had a relationship for two years. This family lives together in a rented house in the city. They also have their own home where the rest of the family lives. He loves the tranquility of the countryside the best, which is why he has grown corn, peas, olluco (a type of Peruvian potato), and potatoes, on own land, for thirty-five years. He can also count on help from his wife who helps him during the harvest season. Alongside this business, he works as a longshoreman earning 20.00 to 40.00 soles a day three times a year. The thing Dionisio likes least is bringing the products he has harvested to market. He doesn't earn much, not even enough to cover labor costs or make a return on his investment. One of his goals is to build a big house with several bedrooms in the city so he can rent them to students and tourists. He would also like to start a business selling groceries. This is why he would like to continue to plant with great effort and produce several sacks of potatoes. This is his sixth loan with MFP and he is sure that everything will turn out okay in the future because he can rely on the working capital he needs and he likes working in this organized way in with his communal group. He will buy pea seeds and several sacks of fertilizer and insecticide with the thousand soles he is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for peas, sacks of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Antonio G. L. tiene la edad de 28 años, habita en el Barrio de San Caralampio es casado y su esposa trabaja en las labores domesticas del hogar, son una familia de tres hijos menores de edad que dependen económicamente de ellos, el señor se dedica a la agricultura de la piña desde hace mas de 11 años.

Uno de los principales problemas  a los que se han enfrentado, con sus terrenos es la sequía y el ataque de las plagas que carcomen los plantillos, en la última cosecha su producción se vio afectada en un 48%, este porcentaje afecta de sobremanera la economía del Sr. G., ha  futuro desea realizar la compra de un camión para transportar la  mercadería, ellos comenzaron realizando estos trabajos  con el apoyo de su suegra,  quien les brindo un terreno para iniciar su propia fuente de ingresos, ahora ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas que ofrezcan un mejor mantenimiento a su tierras para la producción de una mejor cosecha y un aumento en las ventas de los productos y la oportunidad de mejorar sus niveles de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio G. L. is 28, and he lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood. He is married, and his wife does domestic work. They have three minor children who are economically dependent upon them. He has been growing pineapples for over 11 years. The main problems that have occurred are the drought and the pests that eat the plants. During the last harvest his production was affected by 48%. This percentage greatly affects Mr. G.’s economy. In the future he would like to buy a truck to transport the merchandise. They started doing this work with the support of his mother-in-law. She gave them a piece of land to start their own source of income. They are now requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and fungicides that will provide better maintenance of their land. This is for the production of a better harvest and an increase in the sales of the products. It is for the opportunity to improve their standard of living and that of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural materials

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante.
Valeriana es soltera, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Valeriana tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 3 personas, también vende licores.
Valeriana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sillas y mesas.
Los sueños de Valeriana son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Valeriana is a member of the Radiant Sun village bank. She is single, 48 years old and has 4 children. Valeriana runs a restaurant everyday in a rented locale; she has three people who help her to run the restaurant. She also sells liquor. She needs a $350 loan to invest in tables and chairs. Her dream is for her children to finish their schooling and to buy a house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante.
Carmen es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Carmen tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde vende condimentos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aji y comino.
Los sueños de Carmen es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Radiant Sun village bank. She is married, 37 years old and has 3 children. She has a stand in the Playa Grau market where she sells condiments everyday. She needs a $575 loan to buy chili and cumin. Her dream is for her children to someday finish their college educations.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chili and cumin

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Maribel,  ella tiene 26 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de  7 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el préstamo de servicios de llamadas telefónicas a celulares nacionales; La socia es una madre trabajadora y por no separarse de su niño cuando no está en sus clases está con ella en un pequeño espacio que acondiciono de forma ambulante, trabaja desde las 7 a.m. hasta a las 7 p. m. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para  recargar sus celulares.
  
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the Killa village bank and lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco, Peru. Her name is Maribel and she is a 26 year old single mother with one son who is 7. She juggles her household duties with her business offering national cell phone calling services. She is a hard-working mother who has found a way for her son to be with her when he is not in school and while she is out selling her phone services. She works from 7 am to 7 pm. She is seeking a loan to recharge her cell phones with more minutes. She is grateful for the support she is receiving and promises to repay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Recharge cell phones with more minutes

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante.
Zenaida es casada, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, Zenaida viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, quesos, productos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho de casa en casa.
Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos y cereales.
Los sueños de Zenaida son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the Radiant Sun village bank. She is married, 47 years old, with 4 children. She travels to various markets in the region to buy cereals, cheese, and other products which she sells in the city of Ayacucho from door to door. She needs a $225 loan to buy more cheese and cereals. Her dream is for her children to become professionals in their careers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese and cereals

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea del Carmen M. P., vive en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene la edad de 
60 años, es casada y su dos hijos son mayores de edad que sobreviven de manera independiente, ellos son agricultores y sus hijos le apoyan en los trabajos de la finca así mismo económicamente.

Uno de los principales problemas que los afectan, es la sequía y la afectación de las plagas, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, insumos vegetativos, semillas para la diversificación de los cultivos, para evitar perdidas en la reproduccion de las cosechas, hace dos semanas la señora Dorotea sufrio de una fuerte caida que le imposibilita realizar los trabajos diarios del hogar y de la finca, es ocn el apoyo de su esposo que lograran manejar el problema que tienen con las tierras, pero los dos son personas de avanzada de edad que se les dificulta controlar la situacion es por esto que una inversión a sus tierras les permitirá un aumento en el volumen de venta, por el incremento  de la producción, la tranquilidad necesaria para despreocuparsea por el sustento. Ellos agradecen el apoyo que en otras ocasiones  se les ha brindado ya que han  mejorarado sus niveles de vida de forma muy significativa.
texts.en:
Dorotea del Carmen M. P. lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood and is 60 years old and married. She has 2 children who are adults and live on their own. They are farmers and her sons help her in the fieldwork while helping to support her economically as well. One of the biggest problems they face is drought and crop diseases; this is why they are seeking a loan to buy fertilizers, crop nutrients, and seeds to diversify their crops and avoid losses in their harvest. Two weeks ago, Dorotea had a bad fall which made it impossible for her to do both her housework and the fieldwork. With the support of her husband, they will manage the issues with their fields, but both of them are quite old so it is difficult for them to get control of the situation. The investment in fertilizer for their land will help them to increase their production and sales; this will make things easier for them in terms of supporting themselves. They are grateful for the support they have received in the past which has helped to significantly improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Anastacia,  ella tiene 36 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de  18, 8, 5 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista; La socia tienen un pequeño restaurante y ella atiende desde almuerzos y cenas, también vende gaseosas y extras, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para ampliar su negocio, ella quiere romper una pared y ganar mayor espacio para aumentar mesas en su restaurante. 
  
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is a member of the Killa village bank and lives in the Huanchac district of Cusco, Peru. Her name is Anastacia and she is a 36 year old single mother with 3 children who are 5, 8, and 18. She juggles her household duties with her work as a retail businesswoman. She runs a small restaurant where she sells lunch and dinner; she also sells soft drinks and other extras. She is seeking the loan to expand her business locale; she would like to tear down a wall and have more space to put more tables in her restaurant. She is grateful for the support she is receiving and promises to repay her debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her restaurant locale

loans.name: Fanny Patricia

texts.es:
Fanny de 34 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, se separo de su esposo hace 5 años, pero tiene dos hijos que viven con ella y estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Ella es vendedora Yambal y Avon (son compañías de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales con un porcentaje de ganancia por venta),antes ella salia a vender a las zonas de Guayaquil perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, todos los productos que le pidian sus clientes. Ahora ella vende desde su casa tiene vitrinas de productos Yambal y Avon como mostradores. 

Con el préstamo quiere perfumes, cremas, colonias para poder surtirlo mas. En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender sus productos y otro para un restaurante.
texts.en:
Fanny is 34 years old and lives in the urban area Suburbio de Guayaquil; she separted from her husband 5 years ago but she has two children who lives with her and are in primary school. She sells Yambal and Avon (companies that provide commissions to Ecuadorian women for selling catalogue cosmetic products). Before, she used to go out sell perfumes, creams, deodorants and other products in various areas of Guayaquil; now she sells them in display cases out of her home. She would like to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams and colognes to stock her business better. In the future, she'd like to have a store where she can sell her cosmetics and another locale where she can run a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, lotions

loans.name: Bertha Elena

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Bertha,  ella tiene 51 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 son independientes y uno de 22 años depende de la madre, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, La socia compra y vende ropa y ahora Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para traer ropa de la ciudad de Lima y venderla de forma ambulatoria.
 
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the Killa village bank and lives in the Huanchac district of Cusco, Peru. Her name is Bertha and she is a 51 year old single mother with 4 children, 3 of whom live on their own while the 22 year old is still dependent on Bertha. She juggles her household duties with her work as a retail saleswoman; she buys and sells clothing. She is seeking a loan to bring clothing from Lima to Huanchac to sell it around town. She is grateful for the support she is receiving and promises to repay her debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing in Lima to sell in Huanchac

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar de 35 años, está casado con Edith de 30 años, con quien tiene dos hijos, todos ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicado en un lindo paraje de la ciudad de Tarma. Esta familia lucha por salir adelante por medio de la agricultura. Sabe que todo esfuerzo es recompensado, por eso cuida continuamente sus cultivos, principalmente el de papa y arveja, que son los productos más comercializados en los mercados de su ciudad y de La Meced.
Es así que lleva 20 años en la agricultura, sembrando sobre sus terrenos propios y sobre terrenos  arrendados, paralelamente a esta actividad, cría animales vacuno, ovino y porcino, en donde su esposo estás a cargo de la crianza. De los frutos que comercializa recibe buenas ganancias que le permite vivir cómodamente con su familia, esto lo motiva a continuar sus labores diA.. Edgar aS. que le gusta labrar la tierra pensando en que algún día será de propiedad de sus hijos, además sabe que los productos naturales de esta zona continuarán creciendo. Su meta es comprar más terrenos para ampliar su siembra y aumentar su productividad, además de construir una casa en la ciudad e instalar una bodega. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y manifiesta que le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal porque lo incentivan al ahorro, además que encuentra personas que son merecedores de toda su confianza. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes, costales de semilla de papa, además podrá pagar el alquiler de los terrenos en donde piensa sembrar esta campaña.
texts.en:
Edgar is 35 years old and is married to 30 year old Edith. They have two children and they all live in their own home in a beautiful area in the city of Tarma. They work hard to progress through their farming business. They know they all hard work is rewarded which is why Edgar is continuously taking care of their crops, primarily potatoes and peas, which are the most frequently sold crops in the city and the region of La Meced. He has worked for 20 years in agriculture, cultivating his own land as well as rented land; he also raises cattle, sheep and pigs. The fruits of his labor provide him with a good income to help his family live comfortably which motivates him in his daily work. He likes to work the land thinking that someday it will belong to his children; he also believes that the products of this area will continue to grow. His goal is to buy more land to expand his harvest and increase his productivity; he would also like to build a house in the city and put up a small store. This is his 6th loan through MFP and he enjoys work in groups because it encourages him to save. He also feels like he has found many people through the group who deserve his utmost confidence. With the $1050 he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer, potato seeds and pay the rent on the land he hopes to use this season.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, potato seeds and pay rent on land he will cultivate

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Marlene,  ella tiene 34 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 17 años, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella es una mujer optimista llena de proyectos y sueños, Nuestra socia tiene un restaurante bar karaoke y ella solicita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de sonido para su negocio.
 
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner belongs to the Killa village bank and lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco, Peru. Her name is Marlene and she is a 34 year old single mother with a 17 year old son. She juggles her household duties with her job as a retail businesswoman. She is a very optimistic woman full of dreams and projects. She runs a karaoke bar and restaurant and is seeking a loan to buy sound equipment for her business. She is grateful for the support she is receiving and promises to repay her debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sound equipment for her karaoke bar and restaurant

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elías tiene 66 años, está casado con Floriza de 55 años, en este matrimonio se concibió a 6 hijos, quienes son mayores de edad y trabajan de manera independiente, él vive sólo junto a su amada en su vivienda propia. Dedicándose a la agricultura, pudo solventar la educación de sus hijos, comprar su domicilio y todos los muebles necesarios para su comodidad, así como sus necesidades primarias. Es por eso que lleva 10 años sembrando papa, arveja, maíz y habas, en terrenos arrendados. Asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien la ayuda en la temporada de cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su oficio, es comercializar y recuperar la inversión que hizo. Por ahora su mayor anhelo es buscar un local en la ciudad, para instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles que le permitan obtener beneficios económicos sin tantos sacrificios. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y es uno de las personas más responsables del grupo, esto lo hace muy respetado y querido, por el cual se siente motivado para continuar laborando en su grupo comunal de manera activa. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará sacos de abono y costales de semilla de papa.
texts.en:
Elias, age 66, is married to Floriza, age 55. This couple has 6 children who are all independent and have jobs. He and his beloved live in a house of their own. His job in agriculture has allowed him to pay for his children's education, purchase a home, furnish it, and cover their basic needs. For this reason, he has been growing potatoes, peas, corn, and broad beans on rented fields. He has the support of his wife, who helps him during harvest. What he likes most about his job is selling his produce and recouping the investment he made. For now, his greatest wish is to look for a business space in the city so that he can set up a general store, allowing him to obtain financial benefits without so much sacrifice. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He is one of the most responsible members of the group, which makes him a respected and beloved person. He is motivated to continue working actively with the group. With the 1,500.00 PEN that he is requesting, he will purchase bags of fertilizer and sacks of potato seed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Erika Elena

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “KILLA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Erika,  ella tiene 34 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 9 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un bar restaurante, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio en especial su bar con copas y bebidas alcohólicas.
 
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our client is a member of the Killa Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchac district of the Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Ms. Erika is a 34-year-old married mother with three children ages 17, 15, and 9. Our client alternates her household duties with her duties as a small business owner; she owns a restaurant & bar. She is requesting this loan in order to restock her business, especially her bar, with glasses and alcoholic beverages.

Our client values and is very grateful for the support she has been given through this organization and she commits to making her payments according to the pre-established terms.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glasses and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
LA SRA. ELSA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTARN EN  EDAD ESCOLAR, DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE COMIDA QUIEN ADEMAS DEBE LEVANTARSE MUY TEMPRANO PARA PODER PREPARAR LOS ALIMENTOS PARA SUS HIJOS Y MANDARLES AL COLEGIO, EL ESPOSO DE LA SRA. ELSA TRABAJA EN EL CHAPARE POR TANTO MUY POCO SE ENCUENTRA DENTRO DE LA CIUDAD, Y ELLA SOLA SE ENCARGA DE LA EDUCACION Y SUSTENTO DE SUS HIJOS, ES ELLA QUIEN EN REALIDAD TRABAJA PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, Y AUNQUE EL TRABAJO ES BASTANTE SACRIFICADO ELLA NO SE QUEJA Y DICE QUE SE ENCUENTRA MUY CONFORME CON LA VIDA QUE LLEVA EL DINERO LO NECESITA PARA COMPRA DE INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS RIQUISIMOS 
PLATILLOS, Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL YA QUE LE ESTA YENDO MUY BIEN CON SU NEGOCIO, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Elsa is married and has children of school age. She prepares and sells meals for a living, and she has to wake up early every day in order to prepare food for her children and send them to school. Her husband works in the El Chapare region, and this means he is seldom at home, so she has to provide for the education and necessities of her children by herself. It is her efforts that actually support her family, and even if her job is rather demanding, she does not complain and declares being very satisfied with the life she is leading. She needs the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes, and thus being able to increase her income since her business is going very well. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: A sus 38 años, Epifanio está casado con Elida de 36 años y tienen 4 hijos que están estudiando, esta familia vive unida en su vivienda propia, ubicada en las alturas de la ciudad Tarma. Sabe que el esfuerzo y dedicación sobre sus cultivos se observan en las cosecha, por lo que resulta ser muy productiva, es por eso que siembra arveja, papa, maíz, que con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos, le resulta bastante rentable el trabajo que realizan juntos. Es así que ha logrado llevar más de 18 años en esta actividad sin descansar. Sin embargo este trabajo es sacrificado, pero le agrada ver siempre verdes sus terrenos, aunque le sea difícil regar la siembra durante la noche. Para obtener mayores ingresos económicos, en sus días libres labora de operario donde gana por día S/. 20.00 soles. Su mayor anhelo es instalar una tienda de venta de productos comestibles en un local alquilado en el centro de su ciudad. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se muestra contento de trabajar en su grupo comunal, donde todos los socios son unidos como una familia. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará bolsas de semilla de arveja y sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Epifanio, age 38, is married to Elida, age 36. They have 4 school age children and live in a house that they own in Tarma Heights. He knows that all his efforts and dedication to his crops are evident during harvest, which results to be quite productive. He grows peas, potatoes, and corn with the help of his wife and children. This business is quite lucrative for them. He has been in agriculture for over 18 years without rest. Even though one has to sacrifice a lot in this field, Epifanio is pleased to behold his verdant fields. Nevertheless, it is difficult to irrigate his crops at night. In order to increase his income, he also works in a factory during his free time, making 20.00 PEN a day. His greatest wish is to be able to set up a grocery store in a rented business space in downtown Tarma.
