ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat S., 45, is a widower and the father of three children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). His oldest two children, aged 20 and 18, are university students. His youngest daughter, Urangoo, attends a local secondary school. 

Erdenebat operates an auto spare parts trading business in his town. He started his business in 2009 with a working capital of 800,000 MNT, and within only one year, he has managed to increase his working capital to 1,100,000 MNT. He has been planning to expand his current business and to start a block manufacturing business as well. 

The whole family supports his business. Since he started this business, he has been providing money for his family expenses and paying the education fees for his children. Erdenebat is an open person who has very good communication skills. He says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Jambalnyambuu

texts.en:
Jambalnyambuu T. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Her husband, Bayrsaihan, operates a transportation business in their town. They have been living together in their current home for 10 years. 

Jambalnyambuu operates a vegetable trading business in town. She has been operating this business since 1998, and has steadily expanded. She rents a counter at a local trading center. She has gained significant experience over the past 12 years. She started her business with a working capital of 60,000 MNT. However, with a lot hard work and determination, she has managed to increase her working capital to 1,600,000 MNT.  

With her business profits, she has been saving money to build a house for her family. Jambalnyambuu is an open and very hardworking person. She says, “I would like to expand my business. My dream is one day to create my own workplace. ”  She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables to resell to her many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza Sambuunyam is 58 years old and lives with her husband in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her husband live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). All of her children are grown up and live separately from them. 

Liza operates a dairy product trading business in her town. She has been successfully operating her business since 2004. Liza started her business with 90,000 MNT working capital, and after years of successful operation, today her working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT. Since she started her business, her family's standard of living has improved.  

She is an industrious person who has very good communication skills. She says, “My dream is one day to have my own plot of land with a house and yard.” Liza is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products to resell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more diary products

loans.name: Li

texts.en:
Mr. Li L., 35, has been working as a domestic fisherman for more than seven years. He sells the fish to buyers, earning an average of $4 each day. He is married with one teenage child who is attending the local school. His wife helps feed the family by sewing clothes for the garment industry. 

Li L. is applying for a loan to add to his savings in order to buy an old motorbike to provide good transportation for the family.

loans.use: To buy an old motorbike.

loans.name: Narynbaeva's Group

texts.en:
Generally, by means of TV channels and newspapers, we obtain an opportunity to learn how the economy is developing and how the whole country is growing. Regarding the lives of individuals, however, there is little information available. So, the only way to learn is to consider our own lives and look at the lives of the people surrounding us. The general economic state of each country is estimated from all these lives. 

Our heroes (these group members) represent the multiplicity of any population. N. is fifty-five years old. She is a widow. She and her husband were happy enough, as they were endowed with six children. Most of these children are grownups, and not only make their own living, but also actively support N. in her old age. 

Her eldest daughter is married and works in Afghanistan, on American military bases. Her second daughter is married and works in Russia. The other two daughters are working in the capital city of Bishkek. Two of her sons are living with her. The elder one works for the local municipality. The younger son is fifteen and goes to school.

N. keeps a cow, and does some household work. Her sons help her in their free time. N. decided to apply for this loan to buy a refrigerator. 

N.’s partners: 

T. Esentaeva, 39, is married and has a twelve-year-old son. Her husband works in construction. T. is occupied with raising cattle, and intends to buy more calves to increase the total population. Therefore, this loan is very important to her. 

N. Imatova, 49, is a widow. She has a twenty-year-old son. He goes to college. N. is occupied with cattle breeding and this brings her a monthly income of about $110. N. needs this loan to purchase more cows or calves. She hopes that in the near future she will be able to buy her son a car. 

N. Otorov, 30, is the father of two little kids. His wife stays at home with the children. N. is the sole provider. He works as a taxi driver. N. hopes to obtain this loan because he is planning to purchase calves. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Mambetalieva's Group

texts.en:
The life of a small city differs from that of a village. In a village people at least possess a piece of land and may have some cattle to breed and can grow different kinds of vegetables and fruits in their gardens. For city residents the situation is somehow more specific. First of all, people depend on employers and markets. Especially in Kyrgyzstan, where cities used to be centers of industry, they now resemble villages because the living standards have worsened. 

However, even in that situation there are many people who, unlike their compatriots, find energy, ideas and inspiration to look for a better life and opportunities. P. Mambetalieva is the leader of this group. She is twenty-three, married, and has a four-year-old son. Her husband trades in spare parts for cars in a specialized market.

P. does her best to help her husband support the family, selling women’s clothes at retail prices. She has been doing this for the last two years and now her monthly income is around $200. P. has many plans regarding her occupation. She decided to apply for this loan because it would help her purchase new items of clothing (summer and fall) and thus expand her assortment. 

P.’s partners:

N. Jyrnova, 42, is married and, together with her husband, they keep a household and raise cattle. Apart from trading in cattle they also sell milk and manage to earn about $190 a month. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy a calf for feeding.

T. Abduldayev, 24, is married and has a four-month-old daughter. His wife stays at home with the child. To provide for the family, T. manufactures furniture. He used to work in a factory but now has his own business. T. needs this loan to buy materials for making furniture. 

Z. Abduldayeva, 27, is married and has a son. Her husband is a welder. Z. cannot work now and stays at home with the child. Her husband’s monthly income is around $205. She has applied for this loan to buy a calf for feeding and thus help her husband financially. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase new items of clothing to expand her assortment

loans.name: Kae

texts.en:
Mrs. Kae P. is a 49-year-old tailor and widowed mother blessed with four children, two of whom are now employed and helping to provide a little income for the family. Lacking the necessary capital, Kae, who owns a pond, is applying for a loan to purchase fertilizer and lotus seed in order to plant crops for extra profit.

Note: Mrs. Kae P. was busy when the photo taken, so her son is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and lotus seed

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina C. is from the village of Mitimos. She is 55 years old, married and has six adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling her harvested crops in the local community. Victorina has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Victorina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Victorina is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials for house renovation. This will be the ninth loan she has taken out from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for house renovation

loans.name: Rysalieva's Group

texts.en:
Today it is quite difficult to overestimate the value and importance of small loans. These loans have proven to be the driving economic force in developing countries, changing the lives of millions of ordinary people and helping them not only to accomplish their plans, but also to save tremendous amount of time. The heroes of this story are a sample from the societies of the third world:

S. Rysalieva is the widowed 57-year-old leader of this group. She has raised two daughters, 40 and 25, both living and working in Russia. S. makes her living by raising cattle and selling milk, having started the business after selling the big house her family lived in and downsizing. During the past years, they have been able to buy a second house and now S. has a stable monthly income of $70. While this is not a large amount, considering her age she is doing quite well. Now, S. is in need of a loan to effect repairs to her kitchen.

S.’s partners:

N. Israilova, a 26-year-old married mother of three children, earns her family livelihood by providing seamstress services as she manufactures national articles. Now, N. hopes to get this loan to buy a cow.

A. Turdugulova, 27, a divorced mother of a five-year-old son, breeds cattle and sells milk, earning around $40 per month. With this loan, she will be able to purchase sheep for breeding.

M. Koichukeeva, 29, married with three children, breeds cattle and sells milk with her husband, earning a stable income of $205 a month. Now M. is requesting this loan to make a house repair.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan delivering its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To repair the kitchen

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn T. is a 50-year-old mother blessed with four children, two of whom have already married and started new homes, while the other two are single. She has a daughter who is working as a tailor in the garment industry. Sorn owns a medium-sized piece of farmland upon which she and her husband (shown on the right in the photo) plant rice crops to earn a living.

Sorn lacks some supplies to support her farming business and so has requested a loan of $400 to buy fertilizer and seed, with any remaining money to be used for house repairs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to grow.

loans.name: Choek

texts.en: Mrs. Choek K., a 60-year-old widowed homemaker, has two children, one a daughter who is now married and lives with her in the family home. Choek relies on the income from her daughter’s job as a garment worker.  Her son-in-law has a taxi that is in need of frequent repairs, so Choek is requesting a loan in order to mend and decorate it.

loans.use: To mend and decorate the broken taxi.

loans.name: Matumaini Group

texts.fr:
Esperance H.  est une commerçante âgée de 38 ans qui habite la Commune de Kinama en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de poissons, les fruits mais aussi achète du matériel d’emballage pour divers produits pour les revendre au marche central de la ville de Bujumbura. Son époux, Rurerekana Marc, fait le même métier au même lieu. C’est un métier qu’elle a  commencé à pratiquer il ya de cela 15ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. C’est une cliente fidele de Turame qui arrive maintenant au 6e cycle. 

Elle est mère de 5 enfants : 2garçons et 3 filles mais prend aussi en charge 4 autres enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles de sa famille proche. Tous ces enfants vont à l’école.

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour acheter de plus grandes quantités de  poissons, fruits et matériel d’emballage à revendre aux clients. Elle a l’espoir,si les élections en cours se passent sans heurts, d’avoir un grand bénéfice avec cette augmentation de son capital et ainsi pouvoir relever les défis quotidiens de la vie comme la ration, les frais d’entretien du ménage et autres. 

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  solidaire « Matumaini  » qui signifie espoir.
texts.en:
Esperance H., 38, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Kinama in the Town Hall district of Bujumbura. She sells fish, fruit, and also packaging materials for various products in the central market of the town of Bujumbura. Her husband, Rurerekana Marc, is in the same business in the same place. This is the business she began 15 years ago when she was a farmer. She is a faithful client of Turame and is now on her 6th loan. Esperance is the mother of 5 children, two sons and three daughters, but she is also responsible for four other children, two boys and two girls, belonging to close relatives. All the children go to school. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy bigger quantities of fish, fruit, and packaging materials to sell to her customers. If the coming elections go off without problems, she hopes to make a big profit from this increased working capital and thus to be able to meet her day-to-day challenges such as food, household expenses, and so on. Esperance is a member of the solidarity group "Matumaini" which means 'hope'.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy bigger quantities of fish, fruit, and packaging materials for resale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
After having been through many problems in life, 40-year-old Evangeline S. has remained strong and tough to face more challenges to achieve her goal of bringing her family out of the shadow of poverty. Loans that she has taken out through her membership in ASHI have equipped her to have her own business and income to augment the small and sporadic earnings of her husband who works as a laborer. Eventually, Evangeline’s small “sari-sari” (variety) store has grown and has been able to acquire more customers from their neighborhood and even from other villages. Sari-sari means that various foodstuffs, beverages and an assortment of grocery items are sold in a small open room of their house. 

Evangeline is currently happy with the achievements of her business. However, its proceeds are still too small for her to set up a savings fund since almost everything her family needs for food, clothing, etc. are provided through this. Therefore, Evangeline is requesting a much larger loan so she can increase the inventory of her store and sustain its operation despite providing credit to her customers. Soon all four of her children will be in school with her eldest in college and her second eldest in high school. Through her business's profit, Evangeline hopes to support her children until they earn their own degree in college and have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, beverages and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Kol S., 45, has been a farmer since 2004, growing rice and vegetables in her village. A divorced mother of a child enrolled in secondary school,  Kol depends on farming as her main source of income to support her family.  Because she has a wooden house located in a troubled area, she is requesting a loan to build a hedge to protect the property.

loans.use: To build a hedge around her house to protect the property.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 45 year-old woman who runs a store that sells household goods (flasks, hot pots, mugs, plates, basins, hand bags, etc.).  She is married to a teacher and has two sons, ages 20 and 12, and one daughter, age 18.  She has been in business for 15 years and sells in the market center to local people, churches, and schools. Her primary challenges are low sales at different times of the month and competition from other businesswomen selling similar products. In addition to this business, she operates a transport minivan service ("matatu") on the Kakamega-Kitale route.

Josephine plans to use her 50,000 KES loan to pay school fees for her son at University Egerton (20,000) and school fees for her daughter at KCA Nairobi (30,000). In the past, Josephine has successfully repaid a 150,000 KES loan.

In the future, Jospehine hopes her two children complete college and will be working. She wants to purchase a car and build a home on her own piece of land so that her family can avoid paying rent. In 5 years, she aspires to be a wholesaler of cooking utensils in Kakamega, and to open many shops in different towns. She describes herself as hard-working, strict, and generous.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son at University (Egerton) and school fees for her daughter at KCA Nairobi.

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Aïda N. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2 depuis le 29 mars 2008 et a reçu 4 fois de suite de crédit qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés sans difficultés. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus teintés et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'en acheter 20 pièces. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal, pour revendre à chez elle à Louga en faisant du porte à porte. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïda N. is a 42-year old lady who is married and mother to three children, who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in MONTAGNE NORD2 since 29th March 2008 and has had four consecutive loans, which she has always managed well and repaid without difficulty. She is developing a small business selling dyed fabric, and her new loan will allow her to buy 20 pieces of fabric. She gets her stock in Dakar, the capital of Senegal, and resells them at home in Louga on a door-to-door basis. Her aim is to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small dyed fabric business

loans.name: Vyizigiro Ii Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie N.  est une commerçante âgée de 36 ans qui habite la Commune de Kinama en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle vend les fruits (mandarines) au marche central de Bujumbura mais aussi exporte une partie vers le Rwanda. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e primaire. Son époux, Sinzobakwira ,est lui aussi commerçant. Il ya 20 ans qu’elle pratique ce métier. Elle arrive au 7e cycle avec le crédit de Turame. 

Elle a 7 enfants : l’aine âgé de 13 ans et étudie en 5e primaire, le second âgé de 11ans et étudie en 4e année, le 3e avec 9ans et étudie en 2e primaire comme le 4e qui a 7ans ; les 3 derniers sont âgés respectivement de 5ans , 3ans et 6 mois et n’ont pas encore commence l’école. Elle prend aussi en charge 2 autres orphelines.  

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour acheter de plus grandes quantités de  fruits à revendre aux clients ; ce qui lui permettra d’acquérir une plus grande capacité de générer du bénéfice pour faire ses épargnes et accroitre son business. Elle a l’espoir de devenir une riche commerçante et être a mesure d’acheter sa propre maison et sa propre voiture et que ses enfants finiront les études avec succès. Elle a toujours préfère le crédit Turame aux autres institutions financières car aucune garantie n’est exigée. 

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  solidaire « Vyizigiro  ».
texts.en:
Anastasie N., 36, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Kinama in the Town Hall district of Bujumbura. She sells fruit (tangerines) in the central market of Bujumbura and she also exports some of them to Rwanda. She attended school through 5th grade. Her husband, Sinzobakwira, is also a businessman. She has been in this business for 20 years. She is presently on her 7th loan with Turame. Anastasie has seven children. Her eldest son, 13, is in 5th grade; the next son, 11, is in 4th grade, the third, 9, and the fourth, 7, are in second grade. Her youngest children are 5, 3, and 6 months and are not yet in school. She is also responsible for two orphans. She is requesting the Kiva loan to buy bigger quantities of fruit for resale, which will allow her to earn more profit so as to be able to save and grow her business. She hopes one day to become a rich merchant and be able to buy her own house and her own car. She also hopes that all her children will be able to finish their studies successfully. Anastasie has always preferred Turame loans over those of other financial institutions because no collateral is required. She is one of the members of a solidarity group called "Vyizigiro".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying more fruit for resale

loans.name: Latif

texts.ru: Умурзоков Латиф проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Образование - высшее "Инженер". По профессии работал более 10 лет. Кроме того Латиф открыл чайхану (столовую), где работает вместе с семей. В этой области более 4 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения мебели. Латиф хочет закупить столы и стулья.
texts.en:
Latif U. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 43 years old, married and has 8 children. He has a higher education with a specialty in engineering. He spent over 10 years working in his profession. Besides this, Latif opened opened a tea-house cafe, where he works together with his family. He has been in this field for over 4 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of furniture. Latif wants to buy tables and chairs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Хасанов Расул проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 52 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, учительница. Сам Расул имеет высшее образование по специальности "Педагог". Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 4 лет. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en:
Rasul H. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 52 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a teacher. Rasul has a higher education with a specialty in teaching. He works in his profession. Besides, he is involved in animal husbandry. He primarily fattens and sells livestock. Rasul has been involved in this business for over 4 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of a dairy cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Djumamurod

texts.en:
S. Djumamurod is a young, married man who breeds calves in a small village in Isfara town of Sugd region. Djumamurod is young, but full of energy. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Djumamurod started his business three years ago. He has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed it from childhood. He would like to expand his business and to purchase more calves. This will help him to increase his income and improve his life conditions. We wish his good luck and appreciate your help!   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Nhyira Akwan Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
John describes himself as hard-working, a man who sees no challenge as too great. He is 40 years old and is the leader of the “Nhyira Akwan” (translated as 'Ways of blessings') borrower group. John is a petty trader and trades in toothpaste and brushes. He has been selling these for the past ten years. He is excited to be taking out this loan, which he will use to purchase assorted toothpastes and brushes to serve his customers. He is divorced and the father of three children of ages 10-15. 

The other members are also engaged in trades such as food selling, smoked fish, palm oil production, grocery sales, used clothing sales, etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. They hope to put aside more savings to be able to provide good education for all their children, hopefully through university level.

loans.use: To purchase assorted toothpastes and brushes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She wants to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Romila Nawid Group

texts.en: Romila is a member of Romila Nawid group. She lives in district 8th of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has four children. Her husband has a public call office (PCO), where he works, and all the family members benefit through the income he generates. She wants to take a loan for her husband to buy new sets of telephones to attract more clients. He hopes to develop his business in a short time and to be a good business dealer.

loans.use: Towards purchasing sets of telephones.

loans.name: Rokhsar Group

texts.en: Kamela is the leader of Rokhsar group. She is married, 54 years old, and she has four children. Two sons and two daughters are in university. Her oldest son has the decision to support his father in his business. His business is selling fresh fruit and vegetables in a shop, so Kamela wants to take a loan for her husband’s business. He wants to rent another shop, next to his old one, and to expand his business. He wants to support his family. He wants to thank the Kiva lenders and AFS in Afghanistan that help with poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: He wants to expand his business.

loans.name: Sagar

texts.fr: Sagar D. est une femme de quatre vingt ans (80), elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE SUD depuis le 06 octobre 2008 et a reçu 3 fois de suite un crédit. Malgré son âge avancé, elle continue à faire de la restauration et ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en denrées alimentaires et de finaliser la construction de son petit restaurant. Son objectif est de terminer sa construction de restaurant tout appuyant son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Sagar D. is 80 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the MONTAGNE SUD “Banc Villageois” loan group since 6 October 2008 and has been granted three successive loans. Despite her advanced age, she is still active in the restaurant business, and this loan will enable her to resupply her stock of food products and finish building her small restaurant. Her objective is to finalise the construction of her restaurant while assisting her husband in supporting the family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her restaurant business

loans.name: Nana Akua

texts.en:
Nana Akua is a trustworthy and hard-working seamstress. She is fifty-three years old and has been running her seamstress business for the past fifteen years. Akua is divorced and the mother of two children, an eighteen-year-old and a twenty-four-year-old. She always loved sewing ever since she was young because of her love for fashion and her passion to sew for others. These inclinations landed her a seamstress apprenticeship many years ago. Her favorite part of her job is cutting and shaping various designs in clothing. 

Akua currently operates her business in a rented space in a busy market. She dreams of having her own furnished shop and being able to employ additional hands so that she can take orders from corporate institutions like schools, hospitals, and offices. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of fabrics and sewing accessories like assorted thread, needles, and thimbles in bulk in order to avoid price hikes and make more money to support her family and her kids’ education through university.

loans.use: To purchase sewing accessories and fabrics

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.ru: Урокова Бибинисо проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование - высшее, "Педагог". Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она в основном берет заказы у себя дома. В этой области более 14 лет. Кредит берет для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Bibiniso U. lives in the Vose district. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. She is a teacher and has a higher education. She works in her profession. Besides this, she is involved in sewing national dresses. Bibiniso primarily accepts orders at her home. She has been in this field for over 14 years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Asomoah

texts.en:
Asamoah describes himself as cheerful and prides himself on his patience and strong customer relations. He is 55 years old and runs a stationery shop. He has been operating his stationery shop for ten years and is eager to be taking out this loan. He plans to use this loan to purchase variety of stationery: note pads, pens, cards, books, etc., to serve his customers. 

Asamoah’s shop is strategically located near both offices and schools. This enables him to sell his stationery to the targeted market. He hopes the extra profits he will generate will enable him to expand into a bigger bookshop. 

Asamoah is married and his wife is a primary school teacher. Together they have four children, ranging in age from 11 – 18 years. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted stationery in bulk

loans.name: Candelaria Del C

texts.es:
Candelaria Jiménez D. C. con sus 53 años  tiene dos hijos D. 29 y 32 años D. edad y un negocio D. vender mercancías como perfumes, cosméticos, prendas D. fantasía, calzado, vestidos, mediante varias revistas especializadas; este negocio lo comenzó desD. hace 10 años cuando la separación D. su esposo y la obligación D. generar ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar, superiores a los que le enviaba el padre D. sus hijos, la llevó a buscar esta alternativa. En el barrio nuevo bosque D. la ciudad D. Cartagena D. Indias, donD. ella vive nació su  idea D. negocio y una amiga la ayudó a pensar en la mejor forma D. hacerlo: fue así como su hermano le prestó un pequeño capital e  inició con un catalogo y hoy, para poder diversificar su oferta, maneja 10 D. ellos; gracias a este negocio pudo ayudar a que sus hijos salieran adelante y por eso actualmente está muy contenta D. saberlos profesionales. 

En la actualidad solicita su segundo crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo invertirá en  la compra D. una línea nueva D. bolsos en cuerina comercialmente muy apetecidos por su clientela. DesD. que llegó a esta organización, hace algo mas D. un año, ha podido tener efectivo disponible para comprar D. oportunidad muchas D. las ofertas, especialmente en líneas D. nuevos productos y poder ofrecerle un precio mejor a sus clientes y obviamente generar mayor utilidad para ella. Su gran sueño ahora es que su hija también se agregue a su negocio, para que saque adelante a sus hijos a quienes educa ella sola y este es justamente su mayor desafío: tener un gran almacén para generar un buen empleo a su hija.
texts.en:
Candelaria Jiménez D. C. is 53 years old; she has two children ages 29 and 32 and has a business selling merchandise such as perfume, cosmetics, exotic garments, shoes, dresses, and various specialty magazines. She began this business 10 years ago when she separated from her husband. She was obligated to generate income to support her family in addition to what she received from her children's father, which led her to look for this alternative. In the new forest neighborhood of the Cartagena D. Indias city, where she lives the idea of having a business was born. A friend helped her come up with ideas for the best way to run a business. So, her sister lent her a small amount of capital to get started and she began with a catalogue. Today, in order to diversify her selection, she manages 10 catalogue businesses. Thanks to this business she was able to see her children move forward, and now, she is so excited to know that they are both professionals. Now she is asking for a second loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in the purchase of a new line of highly desirable leather purses for her commercial clients. Since she arrived at this organization, almost a year ago, she has had available cash to buy many affordable offerings, especially in new product lines, and been able to offer them at a better price to her customers, and obviously, generate more income for herself. Her big dream is to bring her daughter into the business to improve the lives of her children, whom her daughter raises and educates on her own, and this is precisely her biggest challenge; to have a large store and to generate a good business with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a new line of leather purses

loans.name: Riad

texts.en:
Riad is a 23-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is a single man who lives with his parents. Riad is a dedicated construction worker who works on very small projects. In order to improve his business, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to buy scaffolding and tools for his work so that he can take on larger projects and therefore better support his family.  

When he first started his business, he had some financial issues with buying the needed tools, but thanks to his previous loans, he was able to supplement his tools and prove himself. Therefore, this is the third loan he has requested from Al Majmoua. For the future, he plans on opening a stone-cutting plant.

loans.use: To buy scaffolding and tools for his work.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is a single man who lives with his parents. Mohamad has been working as a plumber since 2003. In order to improve his business, he wants to buy tools for his work. 

Mohamad is happy with his work and proud of the service quality that he provides. When he first started his business, he had difficulty making himself known. Once his customers were satisfied, however, they started telling each other about him and this allowed him to increase his number of clients. In the future, he is hoping to further expand his business. 

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to buy tools and electrical wires to help grow his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To buy tools and electrical wires.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 27 year old married man. He has one child. He has been working as a home painter since 2006. Therefore, Mouhamad has 4 years of work experience in this field. When he first started his business, he received the support and encouragement of his family. He works on a freelance basis, working at the request of his clients. Mouhamad works hard to satisfy the demands of his job, in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better life for his family. 

His previous loans allowed him to purchase new and better tools to improve his work. For the third time, he is requesting a loan to purchase paint tools. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase paint tools.

loans.name: Afif

texts.en:
Afif is a 45 year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. His is married and has four children. He owns a grocery store and has eight years of experience in grocery retail. Afif offers food products, dairy products, breads, cereals, drinks, canned food, bread, candies, home cleaning products and more to his clients. 

Because of his experience and seniority, he has a large customer base which consists of his neighbors and friends. When he first started he had some financial problems to create and establish his store. He decided on starting his business because he knows how to approach people. He is special in his work because he can deliver the orders at home; his clients call him, and then he goes and delivers at their place. For the future, he hopes to keep on improving his work and start selling toys. 

Today, Afif is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: Grocery store inventory

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 43 year old married woman from Lebanon, who has three children. She repairs and does all type of clothes for men and women, also she does curtains, and bed sheets and more. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to open a sewing shop. 

Fatmeh has been working from her house as a seamstress, and lately she has realized that she needs more space knowing that she has a broad customer base that includes friends, neighbors, family members and people from her region. Also, the fact that she receives her clients at home has been inconvenient for her family. This is her second loan, and she has reimbursed her previous loan on time. Her first loan let her purchase thread for her business. 

Fatmeh is speciA. in her work because she is known for her good and precise work. When she first started her business, she couldn’t afford purchasing a sewing shop because she didn’t have enough income; however know she has increased her customer base and her income. She learned the business when she was young so she has always been sewing. She plans to keep on improving her work and to expand her business to the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To open a sewing shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23 year old man and a father of one. He has been working as a concrete carpenter for five years already. Today, Ali is requesting a loan to purchase wood for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. His is planning to improve his work and expand his stock which he hopes will help him improve his financial situation. He is confident that this will help him get more projects.  

Ali is special in his work because he does it well and has good experience in this domain. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Souheil

texts.en:
Souheil is a 46 year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has six children. He has been working as a concrete carpenter. He has sixteen years of experience in this field of work. Because of his extensive experience, he has a large number of customers. His clients are people from his region, and sometimes from his surroundings. His family has always been in big support for him, either by their financial help, or simply by encouraging him. He is planning to improve his work and expand his stock which he hopes will help him improve his financial situation. He is confident that this will help get him more projects.  

Souheil is special in his work because he does a good and precise job. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he wasn’t very well known, but with time, he was able to prove himself and make himself known. He decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business. 

Today, Souheil is requesting a loan to purchase wood for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en:
Yasmine is a 24-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. She is married and has three young children. Yasmine has been working in bee keeping and honey production for the past nine years. This is a family business that she learned from a young age.
Yasmine has been a microcredit client for two years, and has repaid her loans on time. Today, she is requesting a loan to purchase bee hives and bees. She decided on starting her business because of her experience, as well as the fact that beekeeping has been in her family for so long and she didn’t want to break the tradition. In the future, Yasmine plans to keep on increasing her networking and number of customers because her business supplements her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase bee hives and bees

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 26 years old, married, and has one child. He has worked as a truck driver for the past eight years. He offers transportation services in his town and its surroundings; he transports all he can depending on his clients’ demands, but he mainly transports building materials. Mohamad has requested his first loan in order to carry out maintenance work on his truck to increase its safety features, as well as save money for his children's school tuition.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance work on his truck

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 26 years old and married. He has been working as an electrician for the past eight years. His customers are people from his region. He decided to start his business because of his experience. When he first started his business, he wasn’t very well known, but because of his good, fast and punctual work, he showed that he knew how to please his customers and he therefore enlarged his network.
Mohamad is asking for a loan to purchase more sophisticated tools and electrical wires for his business. His plan for the future is to keep on improving his business. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. This is his first loan and he promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: To purchase tools and electrical wires for his business

loans.name: God Our Father Group

texts.en:
Ivy K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Our Father. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children aged 2 and 14. She also cares for four siblings. She is presently a college student.

For the past ten years, Ivy has been selling rubber plates and spoons, clothes, pots,and hair wigs at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She provides good service to her customers, which keeps them returning. Ivy sometimes faces problems with a scarcity of customers, which makes business slow for her.   

Ivy plans to use her 14,000 LRD portion of this 62,000 LRD group loan to buy more rubber plates and spoons, clothes, pots, and hair wigs. Her goal is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they have a better future.Ivy describes herself as a friendly Liberian business woman. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Ivy is holding the sign. And Sinoe is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more rubber materials, such as plates and spoons, cloths, pots, hair wigs and weaves

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel trabaja como consultor en el Ministerio de Gobierno, y también tiene un vehículo que trabaja como trufi. ( transporte de pasajeros en área urbana)
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Cota Cota  de la ciudad de La Paz en casa en alquiler
El crédito será destinado para capital de de inversión (arreglo y mantenimiento de vehiculo).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Ángel works as a consultant in the Ministry of Government, and he also has a vehicle (trufi - a minibus) that he uses to provide urban public transportation services. He lives in a rented home located in the Cota Cota neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He will use this loan for investment capital (to fix and maintain his vehicle.) This is the second time that he has requested a loan from Impro, and he has demonstrated responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for maintenance costs for his trufi (minibus)

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan trabaja como chofer (driver) de transporte inter-departamental, su esposa elabora repostería en general.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Alto Miraflores  de la ciudad de La Paz en casa en anticrético
El crédito será destinado para capital de anticrético (Aumentar su anticrético y mejorar su calidad de vida).Vana alquilar un departamento más grande.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan works as a driver in long-distance transportation. His wife makes pastries. They are from the Alto Miraflores neighborhood of the city of La Paz, where they live a home that is leased in an anticrético arrangement. (An anticrético is an arrangement where the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum of money at the beginning of the rental term, and then receives the principal back at the end of the lease term. The landlord has the use of the money over the rental term; this is, in effect, his rent.) This loan will be used for anticrético capital (to increase their capital to improve their quality of life.) They are going to rent a larger apartment. This is the 4th time that he has requested a loan from Impro, and he has demonstrated responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to use in an anticrético arrangement to rent a bigger apartment to live more comfortably

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana vende perfumes y cosméticos, y actualmente entró en sociedad con su madre, donde atienden servicio de comida rápida en la Escuela Militar de Ingeniería.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa Fátima  de la ciudad de La Paz en casa en anticrético de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de insumos, y muebles para atención de pensión).
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas, con este crédito la cliente podrá mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Viviana sells perfumes and cosmetics. She has now entered into business with her mother. They provide fast food service in the Engineering Military School. Her home is located in the Villa Fátima area of the city of La Paz. She lives in her parents' house in "anticrético" (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). The loan is for work capital (to buy supplies and furniture for meal service). This is the fourth time she has requested a loan from Impro. She has demonstrated responsibility in making her payments. With the loan she will be able to improve her income and her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and furniture for meal service

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Q. vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa de la Cruz, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
El señor Pedro es rentista de la administración pública y su esposa realiza labores de casa.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un Baño en su vivienda para el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro Q. lives with his wife in his own house in the Villa de la Cruz area. It is on the west side of the city of La Paz. Pedro is a renter for the Public Administration. His wife does housework. The requested loan is to build a bathroom in their house. This is to improve the family’s living conditions. This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of building a bathroom in his house

loans.name: Obaa Pa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Francisca is a 42-year-old mother with two children, ages 12 and 18.  She describes herself as faithful.  

For the past 3 years, Francisca has operated her food retail business, specializing in meat.  Francisca will use the loan to buy more meat to supply to her customers.  She would like to provide her children with an education so that they can have a better future.  

Francisca is currently the leader of the group named "Obaa Pa," which means “good woman” in Twi, the most commonly spoken language in Ghana.  There are 10 members in this group.  The other group members are also involved in the retail business, selling items such as yams, meat, and second-hand clothes. They plan to use the loan to buy various items to grow their business inventories and better support their families and their kids education.

loans.use: To purchase meat in bulk

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan V. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y tres hijos.
El señor Juan es rentista de la alcaldía de esta ciudad y su esposa realiza compra venta de verduras en un puesto ambulante, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones, pues sus hijos no cuentan con el espacio suficiente para desarrollar sus actividades.
Esta es la séptima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juan V. lives with his wife and three children in his own house in the Pasankeri area. It is on the west side of La Paz. Juan is a renter for the mayor’s office of this city. His wife buys and sells vegetables in a movable stall. The income supports their family. The requested loan is to build two rooms. Their children do not have enough space for their activities. This is the seventh time he has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of construction for two rooms in his house to make his children more comfortable

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David E. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
El señor David es empleado de un restaurante del centro de la ciudad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de un anticrítico ( es una forma legal de alquiler de un inmueble) ya que en casa de sus padres solo ocupan una habitación y buscan mejores condiciones de hábitat.
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Davis lives with his wife in his parents’ home, located in the Tembladerani zone, on the west side of the city of La Paz. He is employed in a restaurant in the city center and this income allows him to support his family. He is requesting this loan in order to lease a better place to live because his parents only have a single family home. This is the first time he has requested a loan and his economic status allows him to qualify.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lease a home

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la zona de alto Chijini; de profesión músico, la actividad que el realiza es la de tocar en una orquesta los fines de semana en acontecimientos sociales, donde percibe una ganancia que le permite mantener a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar instrumentos musicales para seguir en su actividad..

Es la primera vez que silicita crédito en  Impro y el análisis de su flujo de ingresos y egresos muestra que  puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife and children in his own home located in the Alto Chijini zone. He is a professional musician who plays in a band at social gatherings on the weekends. This allows him to earn enough of an income to be able to support his family. He is asking for this loan in order to buy musical instruments to be able to continue his trade. This is his first loan through Impro. The analysis of his income and expenses qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Musical instruments

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario vive en casa propia en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; es profesor jubilado y percibe una renta muy pequeña con la cual mantiene a su familia. Recientemente tuvo un accidente que le hizo perder la vista, además tiene un hijo paralítico por lo tanto el crédito que solicita es para que su esposa ayude en la familia, comprando y vendiendo diferente mercadería, para así ayudar con los gastos y de esta manera poder salir adelante.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mario lives in his own home in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. He is a retired teacher who receives a very small income to support his family. Recently, he suffered an accident that caused him to lose his sight; also, he has a son who is paralyzed. The loan he is seeking is to help his wife to start a business to help support the family; she will buy and sell various products in order to help with the household expenses and help the family to move forward. Mario is an Impro customer who has always paid back his loans so he is qualified to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell (clothing, kitchen products)

loans.name: Hatice

texts.es:
La señora Hatice vive en casa propia en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como enfermera en el hospital de la mujer donde percibe un sueldo muy bajo.

El crédito que solicita es para obtener un diplomado en enfermería para de esta manera pedir un ítem en mejores condiciones, que le permita ascender a un cargo mejor ( se denomina ítem a un puesto de trabajo).

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Hatice lives in her own home in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz; she works as a nurse in the women's hospital where she receives a very small salary. The loan she is seeking is to get a nursing degree which will help her to request a better job with better working conditions as well as be promoted to greater responsibility. She has been an Impro customer and has always paid on time which qualifies her to receive another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nursing degree to be able to receive a higher salary in the hospital where she works

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto chijini de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en una empresa pública como secretaria.

 El crédito que solicita es para pagar la consulta médica de su señor padre el cual esta enfermo y no cuenta con seguro medico.

Es la primerva vez que solicta crédito en Impro y  por el carácter social del mismo, Lourdes puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in her parents' home in the Alto Chijini area of the city of La Paz; she works in a public company as a secretary. She is seeking a loan to pay for medical help for her elderly father who is sick and has no health insurance. This is the first time she is seeking a loan through Impro, and due to her social character, Lourdes should receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical consultation and medicine for her father who has no health insurance

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo vive en casa propia con su mama en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una movilidad con la cual trabaja en transporte público.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo de mantenimiento de su taxi ya que es su herramienta de trabajo y única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives in his own home with his mother in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz; he has a car which he uses to work in public transportation. He is seeking a loan to pay for the maintenance of his taxi since it is his primary work equipment and his only source of income. He has been an Impro customer and always pays on time which qualifies him to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of taxi

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique vive en casa propia en la zona San Juan de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como garzón el  hotel Camino real, pero sus ingresos son mínimos y como el señor es plomero y electricista, trabaja independientemente los fines de semana en domicilios privados, en conexiones eléctricas y otros.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas de trabajo (necesita un taladro electrico, máquina amoladora y llaves de plomería) y  poder de esta manera mantener esta otra fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Enrique lives in his own home in the San Juan area of the city of La Paz; he works as a waiter in the Camino Real Hotel but his income is very low. In order to supplement his income, he works as a plumber and an electrician on the weekends, working on the electrical connections in people's homes. He is seeking this loan to buy work tools (an electric drill, a grinder, and plumbing tools) in order to keep his alternate source of income going. He has been an Impro customer and pays on time which qualifies him to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an electric drill, a grinder, and plumbing tools for his job as an electrician and plumber

loans.name: United Friends Group

texts.en:
Mannie M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called United Friends. She is single and has 10 children. She also cares for 4 siblings. She is a high school graduate but could not continue her education through college.

For 3 years Mannie has been selling charcoal at the Duport Road market in Paynesville, Liberia. She gives her customers discounts during transactions which keeps them returning. Mannie started selling charcoal by bags at her house but now has a warehouse in the market. Transporting charcoal from the production site to her warehouse is a problem for Mannie.

She plans to use her 9000 LRD portion of this 45000 LRD group loan to buy more charcoal for sale. Her goal is to expand to a bigger business and to buy a car for transporting her goods.

Mannie describes herself as an easy going mother who loves people and hates dishonesty.

In the photo Mannie is holding the sign and Nyemonh is in the inset because he was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nkonim Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is a determined 59-year-old woman.  She has seven children ranging in age from 14 to 30.  Her husband is a painter. Adwoa M. has been engaged in the retail sale of seedlings and liquid soap for the past 7 years.  Adwoa will use the loan to buy more seedlings and liquid soap to grow her business.  She also would like to provide her children with educational opportunities, so that they can have better job opportunities in the future. 
 
Adwoa M. is currently the leader of the trust bank group named "Nkonim", which means “victory ” in Twi, the most commonly spoken language in Ghana.  There are six members of the group.  The other members of the group include second-hand clothing sellers, hairdressers, and clothes retailers, etc.  They plan to use the loan to purchase assorted stock to grow their businesses and be able to better support their families and their kids' education.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings and liquid soap

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El señor Eloy vive en casa de sus padres vive con su esposa e hija en la zona de LLojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Eloy trabaja independientemente como técnico en reparación de electrodomésticos (cocinas, refrigeradores, etc.)  Anteriormente obtuvo un crédito para pagar los gastos de salud de su señora madre, lamentablemente la señora falleció y el crédito que solicita es para pagar los gastos funerarios.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Eloy lives in his parents' home with his wife and daughter in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz. He works as a technician repairing electric appliances (stoves, refrigerators, etc.). He received a loan before to pay for the health care costs of his elderly mother; sadly, she passed away and this loan is to pay for the funeral expenses. He has been an Impro customer and always pays on time which qualifies him to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funeral expenses of his mother

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Blanca vive en casa del esposo con su hijo en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en un colegio de la ciudad de la Paz como profesora.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar los estudios de su hijo ya que en el colegio donde estudia tiene que pagar por adelantado para que el costo de pensiones le sea más económico.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002 y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband and son in her own home, located in the Achachicala zone of La Paz. She works as a teacher in La Paz and is requesting this loan in order to pay for her son’s education, as she must pay in advance in order to keep the cost as low as possible. She has been working with Impro since 2002 and has had a good repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Hamidan Begum's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan begum is married to G. M.. They live in a city named Multan (famous for its shrines & garments) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has lived in it with her family for over 20 years.

She is a very hardworking lady. She is involved in a wheat selling business and her husband helps her with it. They both have good experience in this business and do this work to generate income for their family.

They are parents of six children: four sons and two daughters. Their first two sons are drivers who drive auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles) and generate income for the family. The younger sons help them in their wheat selling business. Their daughters stay at home and do household chores and cook food for the family.

Hamidan is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase more wheat so they can sell wheat to more customers and expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José vive en anticretico en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja y es accionista en una empresa que elabora tarjetas de crédito y debito.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder continuar con esta actividad, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Jose lives in an “antricretico,” (An anticrético is a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent.) in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. He works in and is part owner of a factory that manufactures credit and debit cards. He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies that will allow him to continue operating, as this is his only source of income. He is an Impro client, with a reputation for paying on time, so he has been approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Kaniz Mai's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz mai is a 52 year-old married woman with four children. She lives in a city named Multan (famous for its shrines and garments) in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has lived in it with her family for over 30 years.

She is a very talented and hardworking lady. Her business is selling bed sheets. She has six years of experience in this business. She purchases the bed sheets from the main market of Multan and sells them in the community for profit.

Her husband, F. H., has run a grocery shop in the community for the last seven years. He has a good reputation among his customers. Kaniz and her husband both use their income to improve the living standards of their family.

Kaniz is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he may purchase more groceries and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: God's Mercy Group

texts.en:
David Q. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God’s Mercy. He is married and has 10 children. He also cares for 6 siblings. He could not continue his education through college.

For 15 years David has sold radios at the Redlight market in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells quality goods to customers which keeps them returning. He started selling with 4000 LRD as working capital and now he has more than 35000 LRD. Sometimes when goods finish from the market, it can be very hard to see what is not good for business.

He plans to use his 8000 LRD portion of this 34000 LRD group loan to buy more radios to sell. His goal is to expand to a bigger business and educate his children to a higher standard.

David describes himself as a pastor and a hard working man.

In the photo David is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more radios to sell.

loans.name: Maqsoodan Begum's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan begum is married to F. S.. They reside in a city named Multan (famous for its shrines and garments) in Pakistan.

She is a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughter. She has enrolled all of her kids into school because she knows the value of education and wants to grow them in a manner so they make their future bright.

Her husband is a vegetable vendor. He sells his vegetables in different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. He has 10 years of experience in this business.

Maqsoodan is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase the seasonal vegetables in bulk so her husband can expand his business and generate more income.

They hope to earn good profit from this loan so they may open their own vegetable shop and improve the living standard of their family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tacko

texts.fr: Tacko D. est une femme de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis le 06 octobre 2008 et a 3 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de téléphones portables et son prêt lui permettra de d'acheter plus d'articles, d'étendre son marché et augmenter sa clientèle. A côté de cette activité elle vend aussi des vêtements pour hommes et dames. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et des autres besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Tacko D. is 32 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group since 6 October 2008 and has been granted three successive loans. She sells mobile phones and her loan will enable her to buy more products, extend her business and increase her customer base. As a side business, she also sells men’s and women’s clothing. She assists her husband in taking care of the children and other family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her small business selling mobile phones

loans.name: Gerardo Darmiro

texts.es:
Gerardo de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 9 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperación de mantener a su familia, decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en arroz, azúcar y granos. 

Gerardo construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño puesto para ubicar los víveres que había comprando para vender. Poco a poco fue incrementado su capital para comprar mas víveres. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm, vende el quintal de arroz a $ 36.00, la caja de aceites a $ 16.50, el paquete de pañales a $ 14.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, detergente, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 46 years old and lives in the semiurban area of Fortin de Guayaquil; he has two children who are 9 and 10 and are in primary school. Since he had few other opportunities and was desperate to support his family, Gerardo invested his savings in rice, sugar and grains. Gerardo build a small stand in the front of his house to sell the food that he had purchased. Little by little he increased his capital to buy more food. Now he works from 6 am to 8 pm; he sell a quintal (46 kg) of rice for $36, a box of oil for $16.50 and a pack of diapers for $14. He will use the loan to buy rice, detergent, and drinks for his store. In the future, he would like to finish building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, detergent, drinks

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a wife of A. R. and they are both citizens of the Pakistani city of Multan, which is famous for its shrines and garments. They are very hardworking people who run a grocery shop in the community. They support each other by splitting their working hours – Shamim serves customers in the morning and A. R. serves them in the evening.
The couple has been doing this work for over six years. Shamim is applying for a loan to buy groceries, such as lentils, cooking oil and washing powder, to expand their grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for their grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: raise poultry

loans.name: Margarida

texts.en:
Margarida C. was born in the Maputo province 30 years ago. She studied until the 12th grade, the last one before university, but was not able to continue beyond that. She is now a teacher and lives with her partner. She has three children who range in age from four to 10. All of them are in school. She has been living in the Boane district of Maputo province for the last three years. Before that, she was in Matola, right next to Maputo city, where she trained for two years as a teacher. 

She is currently teaching nine-year-old children from 7 a.m. till noon. She earns enough money to save a small amount every month, using a savings group she belongs to. She learned about our microlending organization, Hluvuku, and about Kiva through a friend who is also a client.

Margarido has applied for a loan to buy cement and iron to improve her home. With the help of Kiva lenders, she dreams of finishing its construction and giving her family a good place to live. She hopes to continue teaching in the future and become completely settled in the job. 

In the picture she is standing by her partially-completed home.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron and other construction materials needed to finish building her house

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is 51 years old and was born in Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. He studied until sixth grade in the old educational system from colonial times. He is married and has five children, who range in age from 10 to 23. He is very proud of the fact that all of them go to school. 

Armando has lived in Maputo with his family for his entire life, except for a short period of time where he went to Havana, Cuba, to study to be an electrician, which has been his job ever since. (After the colonial period ended and Mozambique became independent, it was common for many citizens to go to learn a job in Cuba, the former USSR or East Germany.) He has worked at the same company for the last nine years. He works from 7.30 to 17.30 with a one-hour lunch break. He is able to provide for his family but not able to save anything because he needs his entire income to feed his family and continue building a house for them to live in.

Armando is applying for a loan to buy cement, sand, stone and other construction materials for the partially-completed house he lives in with his family. He learned about the possibility of getting a loan from Kiva through his neighbors.

With that help, he dreams of finishing work on his house. Once work is complete, he plans to buy furniture because he does not currently own any.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and stones to finish building his house

loans.name: Bisa Awurade Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
