Comfort O. is a 32-year-old woman who describes herself as hard-working. She is married to a carpenter and together they have 5 children who range from age 4 to 13.  Comfort would want her children to have good education.    

For the past 5 years, Comfort has operated a retail business selling clothing materials and jeans.  She will use the loan to purchase more clothing materials. She hopes to eventually open a shop where she can showcase her goods. 
 
Comfort is currently the leader of the trust bank group called "Bisa Awurade", which means “Ask God” in Twi, the most commonly spoken language in Ghana.  There are 12 members in this group.  The other group members are also  into the retail business, selling materials and foodstuffs. They plan to use the loan to buy more stock to grow their businesses to better support their families.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials in bulk

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis C. was born in Tete, Mozambique 56 years ago. He studied up to the sixth grade and then stopped to start military service. It was in the military where he met his wife. Being a former soldier, he gets a pension from the state. He has five children who range in age from 13 to 37.

He left his hometown to move to Maputo during the transition government, which came into power in 1974 after independence. He and her wife's pensions combined come to about 9,400 Meticais a month.

Luis is applying for a loan to buy cement, bars, sand and other construction materials to improve his house. He is concerned because prices for such materials are rising, and he may not be able to afford them if he does not make the purchase now. With help from Kiva lenders, he expects to finish construction in the near future and then begin applying for new loans to buy furniture for it.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars and sand he needs to finish building his house

loans.name: Mano Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Mano” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Dura S. (pictured left). Dura is age 50 and he was born in Makeni. He is married with 3 children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending both primary and secondary schools.  For many years now, Dura has been selling market food – beans and ground-nuts/peanuts. With this loan, he will expand his business by buying bags of beans and groundnuts to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy bags of beans and groundnuts to add to his current stock

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the “God Bless” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni who are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group in order to expand their businesses. Zainab T. is the leader of this group. She is a 26-year-old, and she was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has 2 children attending primary school. 

For 3 years now, Zainab has been selling women’s dresses and shoes. With her share of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying women’s dresses and shoes wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buying women’s dresses and shoes wholesale

loans.name: Tayagba Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tayagba” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Neneh K. is the leader of this group. The 52-year-old is married to a teacher and they have six children. Neneh has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells sweets, sugar and butter.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy sweets, sugar and butter

loans.name: Be Honest Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Be Honest” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Marie T.. Marie is 45 years old and she was born in Makeni. She is married with three children. Her husband is a professional worker and her children are attending both primary and secondary schools respectively.  For many years now, Marie has been selling market food: fish, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggie (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy fish, palm oil, Maggie, salt etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Ta-Ram Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Ta-Ram” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Masiray K.. Masiray is 35-year-old and she was born in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary schools.  For ten years now, Masiray has been selling market food: palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggie (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, onions, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, Maggie, salt, onions, etc.

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Talapsu” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata K. who is 29-year-old. She was born in Makeni. She is married with two children. Her husband is a businessman. One of her children is attending primary school and the other is not of school-going age.  For 15 years now, Aminata has been selling market food: palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggie (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onion, salt, flour, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, Maggie, onion, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Tataisutheke Group

texts.en: Fatmata K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city 35 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children. Two of the children are in secondary school and one is in primary school. For many years now, she has been selling beans and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy beans and palm oil at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy beans and palm oil at wholesale

loans.name: Ta-Try Group

texts.en: Baromie B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Baromie was born in a village called Gbenebu 35 years ago. She is married and the couple has six children – three in secondary school and three in primary school.  For seven years now, Baromie has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and rubber containers. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Baromie will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business; she will buy gallons of palm oil and dozens of rubber containers to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil and dozens of rubber containers

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia was born 34 years ago in Manjacaze, Gaza province, Mozambique. She studied until 12th grade, completing her entire secondary schooling, but did not attend university because she started to work. She lives with her partner who is a policeman and has two children, aged 5 and 10. The eldest goes to school and the youngest is about to start. Clemencia came to Maputo city, the capital of Mozambique, in 1999 to carry on studying. She lived with an aunt. She learnt to be a nurse in Beira from 2000 to 2003.
Clemencia works permanently as a nurse. She normally works from 07:30 to 15:30 every day, but she also does evening and night shifts from time to time. At the moment, she is living in a staff residence for policemen with her husband and family, but she is trying to finish her own house. As soon as she finishes the construction, with the help of Kiva lenders, she and her family will move there.
Clemencia is requesting a loan to buy door frames, zinc sheets, nails and other construction materials for the ongoing construction of her house. She is a bit concerned about fluctuations in the price of housing materials that prevent her from finishing her home as quickly as she would have wanted. She has several plans for the future, such as asking for new loans to start a chicken farm.

loans.use: To buy door frames, zinc sheets, nails and other construction materials

loans.name: Julia Jacqueline

texts.es:
Julia de 35 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijas de 13 y 10 años estudian en colegios fiscales. Empezó a ser costurera a los 17 años cuando salio del colegio, pero al no tener oportunidades de trabajo en otras partes, tuvo que trabaja desde su casa con una maquina pequeña haciendo trabajos de remendaduras a sus vecinos. 

Poco a poco fue creciendo sus ingresos en el taller de costurera, hace 10 años atrás ella decidió invertir dinero en telas y confeccionar su propia ropa para almacenes. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene maquinas de coser industriales y reparte al por menor a sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00 todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y hilos para promocionar a los almacenes ropa confeccionada por ella. En el futuro quiere tener su propia línea de ropa y distribuir al por mayor.
texts.en:
Julia is 35 years old and lives in the urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil; she has 2 daughters who are 10 and 13 and are in primary school. She started sewing 17 years ago when she finished secondary school, but since she didn't have other job opportunities elsewhere, she started working out of her home mending clothing for her neighbors with a small sewing machine. Little by little she increased her income in her workshop; 10 years ago, she invested in cloth and began making her own clothes for larger warehouses to sell. Due to this good decision, she now has industrial sewing machines and she sells retail to her customers. She works from 8 am to 7 pm every day. She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread to sell more clothing to the larger warehouses. In the future she would like to have her own clothing line and distribute wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Maria Augusta

texts.es:
La señora María  Augusta C. es socia del Bankito las Caleras, vive por el sector  El Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus ríos, paisajes,  donde podemos  disfrutar  lo colonial con lo moderno, su gente, su cultura y sus tradiciones  hacen esta urbe de ensueños atractiva para el turista nacional y extranjero.

María trabaja como empleada domestica de lunes a viernes con un  horario de 8H30 hasta las 14H00,  también se dedica a la venta de ropa los fines de semana desde hace  dos años la misma que vende recorriendo por distintas partes de la ciudad. Ella  es una mujer de  36 años de edad se casó muy joven,  su esposo hace tres años está en el exterior aportando económicamente para mantener a su familia, de sus cuatro hijos el mayor de 21 años es casado pero vive con ella compartiendo los gastos del hogar, sus dos hijos 16 y 14 años estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y el ultimo de 4 años pasa en casa o con ella. 


 Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en el bankito invitada por su nuera, tiene una muy buena amistad con todas sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal  y ahora con su nuevo credito  comprará pantalones, camisas, blusas, casacas, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños  para así incrementar  su negocio,  su  sueño es  llegar a tener su casa propia  porque aún viven arrendando.
texts.en:
Maria Augusta C. is a member of the Bankito Las Caleras village bank; she lives in the El Tejar area of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for its rivers and landscapes where people enjoy both the colonial feel and the modern feel; its people, its culture and traditions make this a dreamy city for both domestic and foreign tourists. Maria works as a housekeeper Monday to Friday from 830 am to 2 pm; for the past 2 years, she has also sold clothing on the weekends in different parts of the city. She is 36 years old and got married very young; 3 years ago, her husand left the country to find better work to support his family. They have 4 children; the oldest is 21 and is married but lives with Maria to help with household expenses; two children, 14 and 16, are still in school; and the youngest, who is 4, stays in the house with Maria. She is in her second cycle in the bank and was invited by her daughter in law; she is good friends with the other members of the village bank and will use this new loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, jackets, and underwear for men, women and children. This will help her to increase her business. Her dream is to have her own home as they are currently renting.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, blouses, jackets, and underwear for men, women and children

loans.name: Amone

texts.en:
Amone C. was born in Chibuto, Gaza province, Mozambique. He is 46 years old. He studied until 4th grade but had to stop because he did not have anyone to support him. He is a widower. He has five children, aged 21, 19, 14, 14 and 10. The ones aged 14 are twins. All of them go to school and he supports them. Additionally, he also sends money to his father in Chibuto to help with health, energy and water costs. 

He left his hometown in 1980 on his own to pursue better life conditions. He has been a guard in "Casa do Gaiato" for five years. "Casa do Gaiato" is a social-services center in the Boane area, where loads of cooperation projects take place. He works eight hours per day and learned the job on the spot. He makes only 3,600 meticais a month and he still manages to feed all his family and save some money.

He is asking for a loan to buy blocks, stone, cement, sand and iron for the ongoing construction in his home. He dreams of having a decent house for his family, big enough so they do not have to live cramped. He plans on working hard and asking for subsequent loans until he achieves it.

loans.use: Blocks, stone, cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta N. est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 9 avril 2009 et a reçu 3 fois de suite un crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers tels le poisson séché, du piment, de l'ail, du poivre et d'autre épices. Avec ce nouveau crédit elle va intensifier son activité en achetant plus de marchandises et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir mieux s'impliquer dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta N. is 47 years old, married and the mother of five children, all under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group since 9 April 2009 and has been granted three successive loans, all repaid in full. She runs a small business selling a variety of products such as dried fish, hot peppers, garlic, pepper, and other spices. This new loan will enable her to intensify her activity by acquiring more merchandise, increasing her profit margins, and allowing her to become more involved in supporting her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Rabeca

texts.en:
Rabeca A. M. was born in Boane in the Maputo province of Mozambique. She is 40 years old and studied up to 7th grade. She had to stop because there was no place she could get to to study 8th grade. Soon after that she started working. She is single and has four children, age 20, 14, 6, and 2. The two middle ones go to school. She also supports a young nephew who lives with her. She has never left the city where she was born.

Rabeca has a small retail stall she has owned for the last 19 years, where she works without fixed timetable or employees. From it, she has a monthly income of 14,000 meticais. She is requesting a loan to buy cement, iron and other materials for the ongoing construction of her home. She is concerned about fluctuations in the material prices but with the help of Kiva lenders she hopes to see her house finished in the near future. After that she plans on working hard and investing in the education of her children.

loans.use: Cement and iron

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina was born in Namaacha, on the Mozambican border with Swaziland, 43 years ago. She studied until 4th grade but stopped because she lost her place in the school. She lives with her partner who is a school teacher. Her youngest child, aged 9, still lives with her and goes to school. She also sends money for the upbringing of her three grandchildren although they, and her older children, do not live with her. She has never left the Maputo province, just moved from the Namaacha to the Boane districts of the province. She has worked as a cleaner for the last 10 years. She works from 7.30 to 15.30 and makes 4,800 Meticais per month. Most months she is able to save. 

This is Angelina's fourth loan with Hluvuku. She wants to buy cement and iron and other materials to improve her house that she is bulding bit by bit. The previous loans were all for the same purpose. She is eager to see her housing project finished and is worried about a rise in material prices that would prevent this from happening as quickly as she would wish. Attached is a picture of her by her house that she hopes to complete with the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Building materials for her house

loans.name: Maria  Transito

texts.es:
María Tránsito O. es una mujer de  55 años, casada y  madre de ocho hijos de los cuales una hija es casada y vive independiente,  cuatro de sus hijos trabajan y ayudan muy poco en la economía de su hogar porque lo más utilizan para sus gastos personales, los otros tres hijos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela y colegio de la localidad, su esposo de profesión albañil y  gracias al esfuerzo de su unión conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.


Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de granos cocinados en el mercado 12 de abril hace 10 años y trabaja todos los días de domingo a domingo  en su puesto propio, es socia del Banco Comunal Las Caleras hace mucho tiempo ubicado en el sector Virgen del Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca al centro sur del país donde se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza en todo su esplendor como sus paisajes naturales, los ríos que atraviesan la ciudad su gente y su cultura.  Con su nuevo crédito comprará mote, fréjol, arveja, habas, etc.  por quintales para  abaratar costos y seguir con su negocio.

Su meta es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Transito O. is a 55 year old woman, married, with 8 children of which one daughter is married and lives on her own, 4 work and help very little with household expenses as they use it mostly for themselves, and the other 3 are still in school. Her husband is a construction worker and thanks to their hard work they have been able to build their own home. She sells all types of cooked grains and the April 12th Market and has done so for 10 years; she works every day Sunday to Sunday in her own stand. She has been a long-time member of the Las Caleras village bank located in the Virgen del Milagro area of the city of Cuenca in the south central part of the country. It is a region known for its natural beauty with many amazing natural landscapes and rivers that pass through the city. With this loan, she will buy wheat, beans, peas, and green beans, etc. in large quantities in order to get better pricing. Her goal is to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat, beans, peas, and green beans, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela , de 51 años, es soltera y vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su madre Marcelina (87) .“Cada vez que retiro la mala yerba de mis terrenos, siento que mi padre me observa y me felicita porque estoy manteniendo de manera adecuada las chacras que dejó”, asegura Estela, a la vez que refiere que se esmera en  proteger sus cultivos de las plagas y las inclemencias del tiempo.Lleva 20 años sembrando granos como cebada, trigo, maíz, avena y verduras, también comercializa  cereales que manda a moler especialmente para venderlos en las ferias de las localidades cercanas. Además le gusta labrar la chacra porque le brinda tranquilidad y las ganancias que percibe son buenas y le alcanzan  para vivir cómodamente y cubrir los medicamentos costosos de su madre.Para el futuro quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues  contará con la ayuda de sus hermanos.Este es tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y está muy confiada en  invertir bien el dinero del crédito , pues al igual que los integrantes de su banco comunal, es muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.Estela invertirá el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  mayor cantidad de cereales (trigo, cebada, avena) para venderlos al por menor; y así calcula obtendrá buenas  ganancias .
texts.en:
Estela, 51, is single and lives in her own home with her mother Marcelina, 87. “Every time I clear the weeds from my lands I feel my father watching over me congratulating me because I’m caring properly for the farmlands he left me,” Estela assures us while also telling us that she works very hard to protect her crops from pests and weather related problems. She has been a barley, wheat, corn, oats and vegetable farmer for 20 years and sells the grains she produces, after having them specially ground for sale, at nearby farmers markets. She also enjoys working the land because it is calming and the profits she earns are good, allowing her to live comfortably and pay for the expensive medications her mother requires. For the future, she would like to plant larger expanses because she will have help from her siblings. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is confident that she will invest the funds well because, like her fellow group members, she is very responsible with repayments. Estela will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of cereals (wheat, barley and oats) to sell at retail; she figures she will earn good profits that way.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on cereals to sell at retail.

loans.name: María Reina

texts.es: María Reina G. D. G. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán. Ella posee un comedor, en el cual se dedica a elaborar diferentes tipos D. comida para desayunos y almuerzos, el comedor está ubicado en el parque central llamado el Overisco. La señora María vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta D. leña, así mismo vive junto a su nuera quien le ayuda en el comedor, y junto a su pequeño nieto quien se dedica a estudiar. María trabaja D. lunes a sábado, elaborando desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializa con habitantes del lugar y con trabajadores que trabajan en los alrededores. Ella es una señora muy conocida en el lugar, ya que elabora alimentos muy deliciosos y así mismo brinda muy buen servicio. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar: arroz, maíz, frijoles, carne, verduras y otras más, las cuales son la materia prima para la elaboración D. los alimentos. Ella cuenta con un gran deseo D. salir adelante y así prosperar aún más en su negocio para poder vivir D. una forma mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
María Reina G. D. G., age 47, lives in San Francisco Goteras in the Morazán department. She has a restaurant, and she makes different typical foods for breakfast and lunch. The restaurant is located in the central park, and it is called The Overisco. María lives with her husband; he sells firewood. She also lives with her daughter-in-law, who helps her in the restaurant, and her small grandson. The grandson goes to school. María works from Monday through Saturday making breakfasts and lunches. She sells them to local people and to workers who work in the surrounding areas. She is a very well-known woman in the area because she makes delicious food and offers very good service. María is requesting a loan to be able to buy rice, corn, beans, meat, vegetables, and other things. These are the ingredients to make the food. She has a great desire to get ahead and to prosper even more in her business. She wants to do this to be able to live a better way with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, basic grains, and other products to make food

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo tiene 45 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos en su haber. Reside en la Comunidad de Palestina Alta, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia. Para Cirilo en esta vida nada es imposible, a pesar de que estuvo económicamente mal, sacó a relucir su fuerza para salir adelante. Él siempre estuvo metido en su trabajo, según manifiesta “siempre hay algo que hacer” y eso lo convierte en una persona perseverante y digna de imitar. Aparte de tener su cultivo de cacao y café, también trabaja para otras personas como obrero de chacra, realizándolo cuando está desocupado de su trabajo, de esa manera logra tener un ingreso adicional para su familia. Generalmente labora de manera independiente desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia. Normalmente su producción los vende en su misma comunidad a precio de mercado, lo cual mejora su economía. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar la siembra de cacao y café, para ello necesita proveerse de plantaciones, eso ayudará aumentar su producción y sus ganancias, con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente conforme con su grupo comunal, por el buen camino que están llevando. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para darle un mejor tratamiento a sus tierras, aplicando abono, así logrará una producción de mayor escala.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 45 years old, is married, and has three children at home. He lives in the community of Palestina Alta, located in the beautiful jungle of Cuzco where they have their own home. For Cirilo, nothing in this life is impossible, his strength has raised him up to get ahead. He is always involved in his work, always proving that “there is always something to do.” This has turned him into a perseverant person worthy of admiration. Apart from growing cacao and coffee, he also works for other people doing farm work, earning money when he is not busy with his work. In this way he is able to have additional income for his family. Generally he works on his own from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening but at times his family helps him. Normally he sells his products in his community at market prices to help its economy. His main hope is to increase his cacao and coffee plantings. For this he needs to equip himself with more fields. This will help increase his production and his earnings, with the goal of improving his quality of life. This is his third loan with MFP which he is committed to pay on time and also wants to comply with his community bank because of the good path it is putting him on. With the loan he is requesting, he will use it to give better treatment to his lands better, to apply fertilizer, and in this way he will be able to produce on a large scale.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to cultivate coffee and cacao

loans.name: Germán David

texts.es: Germán David M. D. de 37 años de edad reside en la ciudad de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa quien le ayuda en el negocio y así mismo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también junto a su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad. Germán posee una panadería la cual se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación, en donde se encarga de elaborar pan dulce como pastelitos de leche, galletas, reposterías y otros más. El pan lo comercializa en la unidad de salud de Huizucar ubicado siempre en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde lo vende con los pacientes y doctores del lugar, así mismo su esposa se encarga de venderlo en su casa, de esta manera ellos pueden sacarle el mayor provecho a su trabajo y así obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual les beneficiaria mucho ya que tanto Germán como su esposa quieren mejorar su economía familiar para poder tener la capacidad de brindarle un mejor futuro mejor a su hijo y así mismo un lugar seguro para vivir en donde se le puedan suplir todas sus necesidades primordiales lo cual es lo que más incentiva a Germán, el amor de su hijo. Germán solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, azúcar y otros elementos más para poder elaborar mayor cantidad de pan.
texts.en:
Germán David M. D. is 37, and lives in the city of Santa Tecla, located in La Libertad province. He lives together with his wife who helps him in the business and together they do the household chores and take care of their 6 year old son. Germán owns a bakery that is located in his house. There he makes sweet bread such as rich cakes, cookies, baked goods, and much more. The baked goods are sold in the Health Department of Huizucar located in the La Libertad Department where he sells to the patients and to the doctors. His wife sells from the house and thus they get the most out of their work and earn more income. This is important since both Germán and his wife want to improve their family finances to offer their son a better future. They also want to have a safe place to live where they can fill their basic needs and that is Germán’s biggest incentive, the love of his child. He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy flour, shortening, sugar and other ingredients to be able to make even more bread.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, shortening, and sugar to make bread

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Felix V. L. tiene 30 años, es soltero, vive en zona Londo, comunidad de Sativañes que se encuentra en la provincia de Capinota, del departamento de Cochabamba.

El Sr. Felix tiene problemas de en sus extremidades inferiores, razón por la cual no puede desempeñar sus labores con normalidad, por suerte cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y en particular de su madre, quien le ayuda con el cuidado del ganado vacuno, el a pesar de su impedimento no se ha rendido se da modos para trabajar pero la vida en la granja es difícil pues no puede trasladarse de un lugar a otro sin ayuda, el Sr. Felix es un ejemplo de persona luchadora, no se siente derrotado con su impedimento, se desplaza de un lugar a otro, el ordeña muchas veces a las vacas solo, y madre le ayuda con la comercialización, pues se lo lleva al pueblo para vender. El Sr. Felix quedo con este problema a raíz de un accidente de tránsito cuando tenía 9 años, se lesiono la columna vertebral, y después de varios diagnósticos, los doctores no pudieron darle una solución oportuna. Ahora si bien el S. Felix no se desplaza con normalidad se ha dado modos para poder realizar todas sus actividades.

El Sr. Felix se ha solicitado el Crédito para poder comprar, una cabeza de ganado vacuno y alimento balanceado, el a pesar de su discapacidad, tienen la visión de poder triunfar en la vida como ganadero, y ha demostrado que hasta el momento lo ha estado haciendo muy bien, siempre con el apoyo de su familia, y de sus padres, que aunque son personas de la tercera edad siempre están con él.
texts.en:
Felix V. L., 30, lives in Londo, Sativañes which is located in Capinota province, Cochabamba department. Felix has problems with his lower extremities so he can’t do his chores normally; fortunately, his family, especially his mother, helps him care for his cattle. Despite his disabilities he hasn’t given up and finds ways to work even though farming is very difficult for him because he can’t get from one place to another without assistance. Felix is a fighter, he doesn’t let himself be defeated by his handicap; he moves from place to place, often milks the cows by himself. His mother helps with the sales because the milk has to be taken to another town to be sold. Felix has been in this condition since a traffic accident at the age of 9; he hurt his spinal column and, after many diagnoses, doctors were unable to provide him with a timely solution. However, notwithstanding Felix’s not being able to get around normally, he has found ways to perform all his activities. Felix has asked for funds to buy a head of cattle and nutritionally balanced animal feed. Despite his disability, he sees himself being able to succeed in life as a cattleman and, to date has shown that indeed he can; always with help from his parents who, although they are now senior citizens, are always by his side.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle and nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Marta Celia

texts.es: Marta Celia  P. C. de 58 años de edad, es una persona quien disfruta mucho del cuidado de las plantas, es por ello que posee un vivero, en el cual se encarga de plantar, los diferentes tipos de plantas que posee, así mismo se dedica a brindarles todo los cuidados necesarios para poder comercializar una mejor calidad de plantas. El vivero está ubicado en su casa de habitación, en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador en donde vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar, sus hijos y un hermano quien en la actualidad se encuentra sin empleo. Marta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más plantas como árboles y diferentes tipos de flores ornamentales, así mismo comprar abono y tierra negra ya que este negocio no solo le permite contar con un trabajo  el cual disfruta mucho hacer lo que hace, sino también, que es muy útil para poder aportar con todo lo necesario para su hogar y así mismo tener una vida digna en la cual cuente con todo lo necesario. Marta es una mujer muy responsable, quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que ella es amable y trabajadora, así mismo una señora de palabra.
texts.en:
Marta Celia P. C., 58, is a person who enjoys caring for plants very much. Because of this she owns a nursery in which she is in charge of planting a variety of different types of plants. She also provides all of them with the care needed so that she can sell the best quality plants. The nursery is located in her home in the municipality of Soyapango, located in the San Salvador department where she lives with her husband, who works, and her children and a brother who is currently unemployed. Marta requests a loan to use to buy more plants such as trees and different types of ornamental flowers. In addition, she will buy organic fertilizer and topsoil. This business not only allows her to have work that she enjoys, but also allows her to contribute to the support of her home so that she can have a decent life where she can have everything that she needs. Marta is a very responsible woman who has good references from her neighbors, since she is friendly and hardworking, and is also a woman of her word.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy plants, topsoil and fertilizer

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La señora  María Dolores  T. es socia del bankito Las Caleras ubicado en  el sector Virgen de Milagro en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus ríos, sus paisajes, sus edificaciones mezcla de  lo colonial con lo moderno, su gente, su cultura y su tradiciones  hacen de esta ciudad de ensueños un lugar hermoso para vivir y visitarlo 

María  Dolores tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal  concibió seis  hijos que se encuentran de 20, 17, 15, 12, 10, 9 años,  su primera hija estudia en una academia de belleza, sus tres hijos siguientes estudian en el colegio y los  dos últimos estudian en la escuela  de la localidad, su esposo es de profesión albañil y  gracias al trabajo y apoyo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra hace seis  años en el banco comunal gracias a la invitación de sus vecinas, con su nuevo crédito comprará pollos y alimento (maíz, balanceado, engorde)  para incrementar su  criadero ya que ella se dedica a la cria y venta de pollos así como también a la venta de frutas y verduras hace quince años recorriendo las calles de la ciudad sólo los días martes, jueves y sábado desde las 09h00 hasta las 16H00.

Su meta es  llegar a tener un galpón de pollos más grande y así ver crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs María Dolores T. is a member of the communal bank Las Caleras ("The Lime Quarries" or "The Lime Kilns") located in the sector Virgen de Milagro ("Our Lady of the Miracle") in the city of Cuenca, known for its rivers, its landscapes, its buildings which are a mixture of colonial and modern architecture, its people, its culture and its traditions. All this makes it a dream city to live in and to visit. María Dolores, aged 41, is married and in her conjugal life became the mother of six children, aged 20, 17, 15, 12, 10 and 9. Her eldest daughter studies at a beauty school, her next three children attend junior high school and the two youngest go to the local school. Her husband is a bricklayer by profession. Thanks to hard work and conjugal support they managed to build their own house. Six years ago her neighbors invited her to join the communal bank. She will use her new loan to buy chickens and feed (corn, balanced feed, feed for fattening) to increase her chicken farm, because she earns a living by farming and selling poultry. In addition, she has sold fruit and vegetables for 15 years, walking through the city streets every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday from 9 am to 4 pm. Her goal is to have a larger shed for her chickens and see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio G. Q. de 64 años de edad es un señor jubilado, el cual es muy trabajador y emprendedor, el cual desea mucho salir adelante y de esta forma contar con una vida estable. Vive en el municipio de Ilopango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su extensa familia la cual está conformada por su esposa y cinco hijos. José posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa, en donde se dedica a atender la tienda y a crear inventarios para determinar cuáles son los productos que se venden más, con el fin de comprar mayor cantidad de estos, lo cual es una estrategia que le ha funcionado mucho. El es un señor muy amable y responsable quien vela por su familia, la cual depende de él en gran manera. José solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder aumentar su inventario, tomando en cuenta las mayores necesidades del negocio, de manera que pueda sacar la mayor ventaja posible de este, ya que él cuento con el deseo de poder mejorar su estabilidad económica. José es una persona quien se esfuerza mucho por lograr sus metas y así darle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
José Antonio G. Q., 64, is retired gentleman but still very hard-working and enterprising; he very much wants to get ahead in life and have a stable life. He lives in Ilopango with his large family composed of his wife and five children. José has a general store in his home; he tends to it and checks his inventories to see which items sell the best so that he might buy more of these items, a strategy that has worked well for him. He is a very kind and responsible man who watches over his family who depend on him to a great extent. José is asking for funds to increase his inventory taking into account what the business needs the most so that he can make the best use possible of the loan; he wants to improve his economic stability. José is a person who works very hard to reach his goals thus providing for all his family’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita tiene 29 años viven con su conviviente, juntos tienen 4 hijos (10, 8,6 y 1) son una familia de escasos recursos económicos ya que apenas están 5 años juntos y ya tienen 4 hijos.

Viven en la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de Machacmarca, no tienen su casa propia viven en la casa de sus padres que en el futuro heredaran dicha casa. La principal actividad del cliente es la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente solo cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado lechero cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos. Así como también el esposo trabaja de mecánico a domicilio, como no trabaja en una empresa fija no todos los días tiene trabajo razón por lo cual el dinero  no alcanza para los gastos de la semana.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, para de que de esta manera pueda incrementar la producción de la leche y pueda mejorar sus ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas de la señora margarita esta aumentar la cantidad de cabezas de ganado lechero, tener por lo menos una pequeña granja de 20 cabezas de ganado lechero, realizar una nueva construcción de su casa que le heredara sus padres, lo cual tenga una habitación para cada hijo, ya que actualmente solo cuentan con 2 habitaciones uno para los 4 hijos donde están muy incómodos y el otro para los padres.
texts.en:
29-year old Margarita lives with her husband and their four children (aged 10, 8, 6 and 1). They do not have much money because they’ve only been together for five years and already have four children. They live in the town of Cochabamba in the Machacmarca area. As they do not own their own house, they live in their parents’ house which they will inherit one day. Margarita’s main job is producing raw milk, and she currently has three cows. She takes the milk to a factory which makes milk products. Her husband is a mechanic, going round to people’s houses to work on their cars. As he has no fixed place of work, he doesn’t work every day so money is sometimes in short supply. This loan will be used to buy another cow so that more milk can be produced and income increased. One of Margarita’s goals is to own even more cows so that she one day will have a small farm with herd of at least twenty. She also would like to add on to the house she will inherit from her parents so that each child has his/her own room. At the moment there are only two bedrooms, one of which is for the four children, an inconvenient arrangement, and one for the parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo,de 37 años, está casado con Lila (38), con quien tiene dos inquietos hijos, y juntos  viven en su casa  que es propia.Los fines de semana se dedica a la agricultura, mientras que de lunes a viernes es chofer  de camiones de carga  pesada  en una empresa minera. La buena producción de sus cultivos de habas, maíz, papas y alverjas en sus terrenos propios, se deben gracias a las atenciones constantes de su esposa, que desde hace 20 años no ha dejado de sembrar estos  productos sin dejar de lado sus quehaceres domésticos. Lo que más le gusta a Hugo  es cosechar las habas bien maduras las cuales sancocha con sal y degusta como un verdadero manjar. Su oficio de agricultor le resulta rentable porque le alcanza para  solventar los gastos de manutención de su familia , por eso dentro de sus planes para más adelante  desea  comprar más tierras agrícolas donde pueda  sembrar en busca de mayor productividad . Con las ganancias de su futura producción desea  instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en su casa.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes lo aceptaron dentro del grupo, se comprometió a ser puntual en los pagos para no defraudar la confianza que depositan en él.Hugo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  semilla de alverja para aprovechar esta campaña de siembra y con el monto restante comprará materiales para terminar de construir una parte de su casa.
texts.en:
37-year old Hugo is married to 38-year old Lila. They have two lively children, and they all live together in a house which they own. At the weekends Hugo works in his fields, while from Monday to Friday he drives a heavy-duty truck for a mining company. Thanks to his wife’s hard work, his fields produce a good crop of beans, corn, potatoes and peas. For the last twenty years she has tended these crops and at the same time has never neglected her household duties. Hugo’s greatest pleasure is picking the ripe beans which he then parboils with salt and enjoys them as if they were a true delicacy. His work as a farmer is profitable and he can cover the household costs with the money he earns. In the future he would like to buy more land and increase production. With the profit he would run a grocery store out of his home. This is Hugo’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP. The members of his community bank have accepted him into their group. He promises to pay back the loan punctually so he doesn’t let them down. Hugo has plans to use the money to buy peas to plant in the appropriate season; he will use any remaining money to buy materials to complete the construction of part of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peas

loans.name: Germán Esmeraldo

texts.es: Germán Esmeraldo S. M. de 35 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos de 11, 9, 6 y 2 años de edad, de los cuales los tres mayores se dedican a estudiar. Germán es un hombre muy trabajador quien posee dos trabajos para poder contar con el dinero necesario para llevar el sustento diarios hasta su hogar, él posee un carwash, el cual está ubicado en Tonacatepeque, cercano a varios talleres, lo cual le brinda mayor oportunidad de trabajo. Así mismo se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante en el municipio de Soyapango, lugar en el cual realiza su venta contando con mucha ventaja ya que es uno de los lugares de mayor comercio en todo el país, debido a que existen diversas fabricas, mercados y otros tipos de ventas, lo que lo hace un lugar muy concurrido y con muy buenas oportunidades para los comerciantes. Germán solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener los recursos necesarios para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes estampados, para aumentar sus ventas, así mismo comprar alguno implementos para equipar mejor el carwash y de esta manera mejorar su servicio. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Germán ya que le brinda la esperanza de crecer aún más como negociante.
texts.en:
35-year old Germán Esmeraldo S. M. lives in Tonacatepeque, located in San Salvador Department, with his wife and their four children aged 11, 9, 6, and 2. The three oldest ones attend school. Germán is a very hardworking man who has two jobs so that he earns enough money to cover the daily costs of his family. He has a carwash business located in Tonacatepeque close to several workshops which provide him with some good work opportunities. He also sells clothing in the streets of the municipality of Soyapango. It is a good location as it’s one of the best places to do business in the whole of the country. Many factories are located there as well as markets and other businesses, all of which make it a busy place with good opportunities for businessmen. Germán is asking for a loan to buy more clothing of different brands so that he can increase sales. He also wants to buy more equipment for the carwash and thus improve the service he offers. All these plans fill Germán with hope that he can expand his businesses even more.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and carwash equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital operations (tools for manufacturing furniture)

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es: Constantina tiene 37 años de edad, comparte su vida con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos en su haber. Vive en la hermosa selva cusqueña, en la comunidad de Palestina Alta, donde tienen su casa propia. Constantina manifiesta que ha tenido una vida difícil, comenzó a ayudar a sus padres desde su adolescencia como agricultora. Por las mañanas iba a su colegio, y por las tardes se dedica a la siembra, esa era su rutina diaria. Su madre estaba delicada de salud y su padre comercializaba sus productos de cacao, pero dentro de sus posibilidades le dieron a Constantina las comodidades básicas que necesitaba. Es por ello que Constantina se esforzó duro y parejo para sacar adelante la producción de cacao que sus padres le dejaron, ahora junto a su esposo labraron la tierra, para darle mayor impulso a su producción y con el tiempo rindió sus primeros frutos y de buena calidad. Posteriormente su producto es vendido en los centros de acopio,  dándole buenos resultados económicos; no contentos con ello decidieron instalar una pequeña bodega con la finalidad de ampliar su economía, por lo que ya van tres años de muchas satisfacciones personales y emocionales. Es así que anhela ampliar su bodega, con el propósito de introducir nuevos productos para ofrecer. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente en sus pagos respectivos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en comprar una cantidad determinada de mercadería, para así abastecer a su bodega, con el propósito de captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Constantina, 37, shares her life with her partner and their 4 children. She lives in the beautiful Cusco backcountry in the Palestina Alta community where they own their own home. Constantina relates that her life has been difficult; as an adolescent she helped her parents with their farming chores. In the morning she would attend school and in the afternoons she cared for the crops; this was her daily routine. Her mother was in poor health and her father was a cocoa bean merchant and they were able to provide Constantina with what comforts were within their meager means. Because of this, Constantina has worked hard and fast to succeed with the cocoa bean production her parents left her. Now, together with her husband, she works the land to produce higher yields and, in time, has had the first high quality fruits of her labor. Once harvested, the product is sold to area consolidating centers yielding good profits. Not satisfied with this, however, they decided to establish a small store with the goal in mind to improve their finances. They have gotten much emotional and personal satisfaction from this for three years now. Constantina would like to expand her store by introducing more merchandise into her inventory. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she assures us that she will repay in a timely fashion. She will use the funds to buy certain quantities of merchandise to stock her store in order to acquire more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es: María Luz M. D. R. D. 55 años D. edad, es una señora muy alegre y amable quien posee muchos años D. contar con un negocio en el cual se dedica a comercializar jugos naturales, frutas, bebidas enlatadas, sodas y ropa, ventas las cuales han ido creciendo poco a poco a través del tiempo gracias a todo el esfuerzo D. María. Ella vive en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, y el negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico, ya que se encuentra en el punto D. buses del transporte público que se dirigen a Soyapango, lo que le permite contar con varias compras diarias. Ha sido gracias a este negocio como durante varios años, ella ha podido brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y para los gastos D. su única hija D. 15 años D. edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar, es por esta razón que María se siente muy satisfecha con su trabajo, ya que es muy estable y a pesar que hay temporadas en las que sus ventas son un poco bajas, siempre logra obtener ganancias. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, ya que la venta D. esta ha incrementado, así mismo comprar más frutas, María espera poder mejorar en gran medida su negocio y D. esta forma percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
MMs. María Luz M. D. R. is 55 years old, she is a very happy and kind woman who has worked for many years selling natural fruit juices, milkshakes, sodas and clothing, the sale of which has been growing little by little thanks to Maria's hard work. She lives in Soyapango, located in the state of San Salvador, and her business is located in a very strategic place, on the very corner of the public bus transportation that comes to Soyapango. This location allows her to count on several daily purchases. Thanks to this business, over several years she has been able to proviD. the necessary assistance to her husband for household expenses and the expenses pertaining to her only daughter, 15 years old. Her daughter is a student, and for this reason, Maria feels very satisfied with her work now that it's very stable, and in spite of periods when sales are a little lower, she always manages to make a profit. For this reason, she's asking for a loan that will enable her to buy a large quantity of clothing, now that clothing sales have increased, as well as be able to buy more fruit. Maria hopes to improve her business and increase earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and fruit

loans.name: Natividad De Mercedes

texts.es: Natividad D. Mercedes F. D. R. D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive en casa propio junto a un hijo. Natividad posee una tienda en la cual venD. granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, pan, café, leche y otros productos más los cuales son para el consumo diario y así mismo para el uso diario del hogar. Ella también se dedica a la venta D. ropa, zapatos y cosméticos como: perfumes, labiales, cremas y otras más. Natividad debe trabajar muy duro día con día para poder salir adelante, ya que no posee la ayuda económica D. nadie, es por esto que ella desea mucho poder obtener un crédito con Integral, para poder comprar mayor cantidad D. productos perecederos para la tienda, así mismo comprar más mercadería como nuevos estilos D. zapatos y una diversidad más granD. D. ropa. D. esta manera ella espera poder ver el crecimiento D. su negocio, y así contar con un negocio más estable el cual le brinD. la tranquilidad que Natividad desea para su vejez.
texts.en:
Natividad D. Mercedes F. D. R., 62, lives with her son in Soyapango, San Salvador department, in her own home. Natividad has a general store where she stocks basic grains, instant soups, bread, coffee, milk and other products common to daily household use. She also sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics like: perfumes, lipsticks, creams, etc. Natividad must work very hard every day in order to get ahead because she doesn’t get any financial support from anyone. This is why she very much wants to have a loan with Integral so that she can buy greater amounts of perishable items for the store as well as to buy new styles of shoes and a larger assortment of clothes. She expects to see her business grow and become more stable so that she can have the peace of mind she wants for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable items.

loans.name: María Elia

texts.es: María Elia C. D. C. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. María posee una tortillería, en la cual se encarga D. elaborar tortillas cada mediodía y cada tarD. D. lunes a domingo. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada quien gracias a este negocio ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos, los cuales en la actualidad se dedican a trabajar. Cada día María coloca la cocina para hacer tortillas llamada plancha, frente a su casa, y se dirige al molino a moler el maíz con el cual elabora este alimento tan básico para las personas D. este país. Debido a que ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales desD. hace muchos años compran en su negocio, sabiendo que están consumiendo calidad D. producto. María solicita un préstamo a Integral con el enorme deseo D. poder comprar maíz por mayor para comprarlo a precios más bajos, y D. esta manera elaborar más tortillas y así atender a más clientes, esto será D. mucho beneficio para ella y su hogar, ya que podrá contar con el dinero necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Elia C. D. C., 47, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department. María has a tortilla shop where she manufactures tortillas every noon and every afternoon from Monday through Sunday. She is a very hard-working woman who has managed to raise her three children with earnings from this work; all her children are currently employed. Every day María sets up the stove to make tortillas, called “plancha” in front of her house and heads to the mill to grind the corn that’s used to make this basic food item of inhabitants of this country. Because she’s a very responsible and hard-working woman, she has many regular customers that have bought her tortillas for several years knowing that they are consuming a high-quality product. María is asking for funds from Integral with a great wish to buy corn at wholesale so that she can get it for a lower price, be able to make more tortillas and thus tend to more customers. This will be of great benefit to her and her household because she will be able to count on the necessary income to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Fatim D. a 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 28 mars 2008. La promotrice possède d'une calèche qu'elle voudrait valoriser et mettre en marche. Avec son crédit elle va acheter un cheval, embaucher un coché qu'elle rémunère mensuellement. Cette activité lui génère des ressources financières qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatim D. is 60 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group since 28 March 2008. The borrower owns a carriage she wishes to fix up and render operational. Her loan will enable her to buy a horse and hire a coach she will pay monthly. With the revenue generated by this loan she will be able to participate in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a horse to operate a carriage

loans.name: Carolina Elizabeth

texts.es: Carolina Elizabeth C. D. R. D. 33 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, en el mercado municipal D. Soyapango, un lugar excelente para todo tipo D. comercio, lo que beneficia en gran manera a Carolina, ya que posee un puesto muy granD. en la zona D. venta D. ropa del mercado, gracias a el tiempo que posee D. vender en ese lugar, como también a los precios tan accesibles que ella brinda, cuenta con varias ventas ya sea con personas que visitan el mercado o con personas que trabajan en el mismo lugar. Carolina vive junto a sus tres hijos D. 8, 6, y 2 años D. edad, así mismo vive junto a su madre quien le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar y con el cuido D. sus pequeños hijos. Como madre soltera quien debe sostener su hogar por si sola, es muy responsable, ya que siempre esta buscando alguna alternativa nueva para mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, ya que es ese el negocio que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Carolina solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa y D. esta manera aprovechar las temporadas y celebraciones que se aproximan tales como: el día del padre y el día del maestro, en los cuales ella espera poder mejorar sus ventas, es por esto que desea poder aumentar su inventario y así mismo las opciones para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carolina Elizabeth C. D. R. is 33 years old. She sells clothes in the Soyapango municipal market. It is an excellent place for all types of commerce, which is greatly beneficial to Carolina. She has a very large stand in the area where they sell clothes in the market. Thanks to the amount of time that she has been selling in this place and the accessible prices that she offers, she has many sales. She sells to people who visit the market or to people who work in the same place. Carolina lives with her three children; ages 8, 6, and 2. She also lives with her mother, who helps her with the household chores and taking care of her small children. As a single mother who has to support her household by herself, she is very responsible. She is always looking for a new alternative activity to improve her business and increase her sales. This business allows her to support her household. Carolina is requesting a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of clothes. This way she will take advantage of the upcoming season and celebrations such as Father’s Day and Teacher’s Day. She hopes to be able to increase sales for those days. That is why she wishes to be able to increase her inventory while giving her customers options at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Denny Ademir

texts.es: Denny Ademir C. M. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, la capital del país. Vive junto a su compañera de vida y tres hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, el mayor educación básica y los dos menores asisten a parvularia.  Denny posee una barbería, en la cual se encarga de cortar el cabello, cortar la barba y hacer otros tipos de trabajos, todos relacionados con el cuidado personal de las personas. Posee 13 años de experiencia laboral en ese rubro, contando con una gran cantidad de clientes, los cuales lo conocen desde hace muchos años atrás, ya sean familiares o vecinos, los cuales tienen muy buen concepto de él por ser muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo, el cual siempre esta renovando sus conocimientos para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Denny es el único que posee trabajo en su hogar, por lo que su familia depende por completo de él. Es esta una de las mayores razones por las cuales solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tijeras nuevas, maquinas para cortar el cabello, y así mismo tratamientos para el cuidado del cabello, de esta manera Denny espera mejorar sus ventas y así percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Denny Ademir C. M., 34, lives in San Salvador department, the country’s capital, with his life partner and their three minor children who are students. The oldest is in elementary school and the two little ones are in preschool. Denny has a barber shop where he cuts hair, trims beards and does other jobs that are related to personal care. He has been in this line of work for 13 years and has many regular customers that have known him for many years. Whether they are relatives or neighbors, he is held in high esteem because he is very responsible and dedicated to his work; he is constantly updating his skills in order to provide better service to his customers. Denny is the only employed person in his household so the family is completely dependent on him. This is one of the main reasons why he’s asking for funding to buy new scissors and hair clippers as well as hair treatment supplies. Denny hopes that this will help him to improve his sales and thus earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy scissors and hair products to stock his barber shop.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 41 años,  es soltero y  vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su hermana Epifania (60) y su sobrina. En su familia todos colaboran con las actividades del hogar de manera organizada.Desde hace 15 años se dedica al comercio de productos comestibles en su vivienda y con la ayuda de todos los miembros de la casa.Paralelamente a esta labor se dedica a sembrar papa, alverja y maíz, que comercializa en el mercado de su  ciudad, a precios considerables que le alcanzan para surtir bien su bodega y obtener mayores ganancias.Lo que más le gusta es atender a los clientes porque le dan la oportunidad de conversar un poco y muchas veces él ayuda a resolver los problemas en su localidad. Para más adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio, y además desea  incrementar su  mercadería, de igual modo quiere empezar a ser prestar dinero a sus conocidos.Es el décimo tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y asegura que le agrada laborar en su banco comunal, porque todos los integrantes  buscan la unión y el desarrollo.Luis invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de  mercadería  en productos comestibles, para dinamizar la venta en su tienda.
texts.en:
Luis, 41, is single and lives in his own home along with his sister, Epiphany, 60, and his niece. All members of his family work together with household chores. Luis has been selling groceries from his home for 15 years with the help of his family. At the same time he has grown potatoes, peas, and corn which he sells in the city market at fair prices that allow him to stock his store and increase his earnings. What he likes most is serving his customers because it gives him the opportunity to talk a bit and many times to resolve problems in his town. In the future he would like to expand his business and increase his merchandise. Likewise, he wants to begin to be able to lend money to his friends. This is his 13th loan with MFP and he says he likes working with his community bank because all the members seek connection and development. Luis will invest the loan in purchasing food products that will boost his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 37 años D. edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en L. comunidad D. Palestina Alta, ubicada en L. selva cusqueña, donD. tienen su propia casa. DesD. muy joven empezó ayudando a sus padres en L. actividad agrícoL., pero su meta a largo plazo era tener su propio negocio, es así, que lo cumplió con el pasar D. los años. Ahora se dedica a L. actividad agrícoL., específicamente al cultivo D. cacao y estevia, dándole mejor rentabilidad y satisfacción personal, sin embargo,  él quiere aspirar a grandes cosas, para ello es consciente D. que tiene que trabajar duro y parejo, para que pueda instalar una bodega, en donD. su esposa se haría cargo del negocio. Esto ayudaría a tener un ingreso adicional al D. L. producción agrícoL., en donD. lleva su cosecha al centro D. acopio D. su misma localidad a dejándolo a precio D. mercado. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones D. pago, además confía en que llegará muy lejos con su grupo comunal, ya que le ofrece muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá para darle un mejor tratamiento a sus plantaciones D. cacao y estevia, adquiriendo abono e fertilizantes, con el propósito D. mejorar L. calidad total D. sus productos.
texts.en:
Daniel, 37, is married and has four children. He lives in his own house in Palestina Alta in the Cusco backcountry. He started helping his parents farm when he was still a young boy but his long-term goal was to have his own business and after a few years he reached it. He is a farmer, especially of cocoa beans and stevia. This provides better profits and personal satisfaction. However, he aspires to greater things and he’s aware that for them he must work hard and consistently. He wants to set up a store that his wife can run. This will produce extra income to add to the income he gets when he takes his crops to the regional wholesale farm products gathering center to sell at the going market rates. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion. He is also confident that he will get far with his communal group because it offers many benefits. He will use the requested funds to proviD. his cocoa bean and stevia crops with better care; he will buy manure and fertilizers in order to improve the quality of all his products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to improve cocoa bean and stevia crops.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
el sr. Isidro O. P. tiene 58 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como ser mangos, platanos maduros y minimos, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su negocio esta ubicado contiguo a la terminal municipal de buses de la ciudad de Choluteca, este lugar es estrategico para las ventas ya que por aqui circulan muchas personas diariamente y esto hace que las ventas sean muy buenas, ademas las personas consumen mucha fruta por ser nutritiva y sabrosa.
Isidro es una persona de la tercera edad y esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar mas mangos y platanos, con las ganancias que obtenga podra cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidro O. P. is 58 years old. He sells fruit and vegetables such as mangos, plantains and bananas. He has been doing this for several years. His business is located nest to the city bus station in Choluteca. This is a strategic place since many people circulate there daily and this makes for very good sales. People also consume a lot of fruit because it is nutritious and tasty. Isidro is elderly and this is his only source of income. He is going to use the loan to buy more mangos and bananas.With the profit he obtains, he will be able to cover his household expenses and support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy green and ripe mangos, plantains and bananas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel P. D. V. está casada con el señor Maximiliano V. por más D. 45 años y viven en la ciudad D. Cochabamba en la zona D. Muyurina a solo una cuadra D. la agencia central D. Cidre en Cochabamba.

Juntos tienen una pequeña tienda D. barrio por casi 15 años, es esta la que los ayuda a sustentarse y a poder vivir. Sus 2 hijos mayores ya son casados y tiene sus propias familias, a pesar D. que ayudan en lo que pueden a sus padres, la señora Isabel y el señor Maximiliano dependen casi un 100% en su tienda para poder cubrir con sus gastos diarios.

El crédito que solicitan es para poder aumentar algunos productos en su tienda y así poder vender más y mejorar un sus ingresos. La señora Isabel nos cuenta que su mayor y único sueño que tiene es poder vivir muchos años más para ver a sus 3 nietos crecer.
texts.en:
Isabel P. D. V. has been married to Maximiliano V. for over 45 years; they live in the Muyurina area of the city of Cochabamba just a block from Cidre’s main office in Cochabamba. For the last 15 years they have had a small neighborhood grocery store which helps them support themselves and live. Their two adult children are already married and have their own families but try to help their parents out as much as they can. Isabel and Maximiliano depend almost 100% on their store to proviD. for their daily expenses. They will use the requested funds to increase some of the items they stock in their store so that they can sell more and increase their income. Isabel tells us that her greatest and only dream is to live many more years so that she can watch her three grandchildren grow up.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ludis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ludis Antonio G. V., tiene la edad de 30 años vive con su compañera de vida y sus 5 hijos menores de edad en Lomas de Gavilan en Ticuantepe, sus hijos  se dedican a los estudios, y la familia  labora en los cultivos de la yuca desde hace ya más de 20 años.

Dentro de los planes a futuro está la edificación de su vivienda, que por problemas de fluidez monetaria no han podido  llevar a cabo, ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, materiales agrícolas, fertilizantes y fungicidas, que permitan un mejor mantenimiento de las tierras para una mejor cosecha, esto les favorecerá a futuro el capital necesario para nuevos proyecto, incluidos claro está la edificación de su hogar. Esta inversion farvoreceria a gran escala los niveles de vida de la familia, sobre todo a los menores ya que les permitiria mejores condiciones y la satisfaccion de los padres de poder ofrecerles un futuro ams prospero.
texts.en:
Ludis Antonio G. V., 30, lives with his life partner and their 5 minor children in Lomas de Gavilan, Ticuantepe. His children are all students and the family has farmed manioc for over 20 years now. His future plans include building his house but cash flow problems have kept him from reaching this goal. They are asking for funds to buy farm supplies that will allow for better care of their farmlands so that crop yields will be better. This will be favorable for them because it will produce capital to be used in future projects, including building their house. This investment will greatly improve the family’s standard of living, especially for the youngsters because living conditions will be better and to the great satisfaction of the parents for being able to provide a more prosperous future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fungicides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Las Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Progresistas  está ubicado en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  capital de la provincia del Azuay, está situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999. En esta ocasion nos acompaña la niña de una de nuestras socias del banco.

La señora  Trancito Domínguez   tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos  que  se encuentran de 15, 13, 5 años, su primer hijo cursa la secundaria,  su segunda hija en la escuela y su último hijo esta en el jardín de infantes de la ciudad,  no recibe ningún apoyo por parte del padre de sus hijos y tampoco cuenta con  casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Trancito se dedica hace 5 años a realizar rehabilitaciones físicas, aprendió realizando tres años de cursos y también ha trabajado con un doctor especialista en traumatología, ahora labora desde su casa de 9 a.m. a 5 p.m. todos los días y también vende productos naturales para sus pacientes,  este es su primer crédito  en la fundación invitada por una amiga que ya pertenecía del bankito y con el comprará vitaminas, suplementos, proteínas, etc.

Su meta es de tener un centro naturista.

La  señora  María Juana  C.  tiene 70 años de edad, enviudó hace 35 años ya que a su difunto esposo le dio pulmonía, concibió cuatro hijos tres de ellos son casados  y viven en diferentes  partes de la ciudad, su otra hija falleció a causa   de una meningitis bacteriana dejando en la orfandad a dos niñas con quienes vive  en una casa arrendada en el sector  Yanuncay.

Doña Maria Juana  es negociante de ganado vacuno, cuyes y pollos   hace  ya 20 años y solo vende los días miércoles, jueves, sábados y domingos,  se     encuentra en su segundo ciclo en su banco comunal, con el   crédito anterior montó su negocio de animales y  ahora con su nuevo préstamo comprará crías de pollos, cuyes y alimento para incrementar su criadero hasta que dios le permita seguir con sus fuerzas.

Su mayor sueño es de tener una casa propia para su tranquilidad y de sus nietas.
texts.en:
The “Las Progresistas” (The Progressive Ones) communal bank is located in greater Cuenca, Azuay province capital, located in the southern part of the Ecuadorean Andes. It is Ecuador’s third most important city and noted for its tranquility and old city charm. Its historic city center was declared Patrimony of Humanity by Unesco in 1999. (On this occasion the daughter of one of our members accompanies us). Trancito Domínguez, 32, is a single mother of three children who are 15, 13 and 5 years old. Her oldest son is in middle school, her second daughter is in elementary school and her last son is in the city’s kindergarten. The children’s father does not provide any support and she also does not own her own home; she rents. She has been a physical therapist for the last five years; she took three year’s worth of course work and has also worked with a doctor who specializes in traumatology. Now, she works from home from 9am until 5pm every day and also sells natural products to her patients. This is her 1st loan with the foundation; she was invited to join by a girl friend who was already a member of the communal bank. She will use the funds to buy vitamins, nutritional supplements, proteins, etc. Her goal is to have a health spa. María Juana C., 70, was widowed 35 years ago; her husband died of pneumonia. She had four children, three of whom are married and live in other parts of the city. Her other daughter died due to bacterial meningitis leaving two orphaned daughters with whom she lives in a rented house in the Yanuncay neighborhood. María Juana has been a cattle, guinea-pig and chicken merchant for the last 20 years; she only sells on Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays. This is her 2nd cycle with her communal bank.
